story:
Secret Sisterhood is a women's movement that aims to empower, uplift and inspire women.

Secret Sisterhood is founded upon the belief that if women and girls can come together, from all around the world, no matter their colour or creed, they can make a significant difference to help end gender inequality. Our mission as a women's movement is to provide an uplifting community for women, while also giving back at the same time.  

Since our launch in June 2017, the Secret Sisterhood group has grown rapidly. Over 25,000 women and girls have now joined our Facebook Page. And in our Facebook Group, we see the power of love, kindness and support, that we show to each other, by coming together as one. The Group has allowed women to feel supported through their daily life, to open up about past traumas and to share their daily gratitude and triumphs. It has allowed them to form new friendships. It has created a sense of community and belonging as we women share our stories of the adventure that is our life - together.  

 

Our Secret Sisterhood Symbol

 

Our Sisterhood symbol represents empowerment and equality for all women. We have used two of the world's most recognised symbols and created our own. The female symbol and the symbol of love. These icons represent two of the most powerful forces on earth. We have joined these together as one, to reflect our unity in Sisterhood. Our Sisterhood strives for equality, no matter our colour or creed, our country or class, we are women and girls, and so we face many of the same personal struggles, choices, issues and inequities. In some places, we have come a long way, in others' we are still struggling. Either way, let's come together to support and empower each other.

 

Why Sisterhood?

Unfortunately, in every country worldwide, sexual and domestic violence are the most prevalent crimes against women and girls. Shockingly 1 in 3 women have experienced sexual violence in their lifetime and every second a new girl or woman is sexually assaulted somewhere in the world. Recently the MeToo campaign raised awareness of the staggering amount of women, who have been through the same. 

Our Secret Sisterhood Group has allowed many to have the courage and strength to open up and share. In the Group, we have been overwhelmed by the number of women who have experienced domestic violence and abuse. And we are saddened that so many feel stigmatised and alone. It has allowed women to exchange their stories, give advice and offer comfort. It has allowed the issue of sexual and domestic violence to be talked about openly, in a non-judgemental space. And so many women, have been through it all and are coming out as victors, not victims and are now lending an ear and comforting words to other sisters who are still in the midst of it. The effect these conversations are having on our Sisters is beautiful, heart-warming and inspiring.

 

Here is some typical feedback from our Facebook Group:

 

 

Join thousands of supportive, like-minded women in our online Facebook group! Join our Secret Conversations here:

 /SecretSisterhoodGroup

 

Let's Make a Difference Campaign

T-Shirt for a T-Shirt

We have begun to understand that the Group really can make a difference to women. Especially survivors of domestic violence and abuse and so we want to reach out and bring the Sisterhood to more women in need. For a woman to know she is not alone and that there is a massive support system of tens of thousands of other women behind her, could mean the world to her in times of trauma. To achieve this we have created this special

"T-Shirt for a T-Shirt" campaign.

 

Get a T-Shirt, Give a T-Shirt (to a Woman in Need)

For every one of our first-release Secret Sisterhood T-Shirt's sold, we will give another T-shirt to a woman who has recently experienced sexual or domestic violence. We will give them to women who are currently in crisis and give them out with the help of local domestic shelters and sexual assault counselling services. 

During this time of uncertainty, loneliness and trauma, a small gesture like this, can make a huge difference. Our Secret Sisterhood symbol embroidered on the T-Shirt will symbolise our group of women who are supporting each other. Letting these women know, that they are not going through this journey alone.  Tens of thousands of Secrets Sisters are there in spirit, sending them strength, love and peace from their hearts.

We need your help! Let's spread the word of love and support to these women in need. 

We have and will pair with domestic violence shelters, hotlines and counselling services to give out our Sisterhood T-Shirts. We need to reach as many women as we can, so we need your help! So please - check out the T-shirts, goodies and packages alongside and get yours. 

 

Sisterhood Symbol Jewellery

We will also be offering packs of not only our Sisterhood T-Shirts, but also our Secret Sisterhood symbol jewellery. By wearing our jewellery, you are showing your support for women everywhere and that you take a stand for women's equality. Remember, 90% of our profits from all of our jewellery sales, go back to our four women's charities. 

 

What our Sisters are saying about

Secret Sisterhood

 

"Absolutely in love with my Secret Sisterhood bracelet! It's a daily reminder for me to love and trust. And most importantly, when I look down at my wrist, it reminds me of all the beautiful, amazing women out there and how much love and support we have for each other and that this bracelet is helping women in need." - Tash P

 

"I have never been in a women's community that is full of such kind, supportive, genuine people. Thank you Secret Sisterhood for creating this amazing environment." - Danielle S

 

"LOVE what you are doing. I've got a bunch of friends turning 50... Particularly as one is terminally ill. The symbolism will remain a special link between us all." Anon

 

 

The Story Behind Secret Sisterhood

Founder Jacquie Love

Jacquie went to India at the start of 2017 with "Stop the Traffik", a charity that works to bring awareness around trafficking. After travelling to the red light districts and slums of Mumbai and seeing how hundreds of thousands of ten-year-old girls are taken from their families and lured into the sex trade, it was a wakeup call to do something about it. 

On returning to Sydney Australia, she discussed with her partner Colin what they could do to help. As creative and business personalities, starting a charity seemed outside their ability. Then learning about social enterprises - businesses that are created to solve social problems - they decided to start a profit-for-purpose business that created beautiful products, services and events for women.

And decided to distribute ninety percent of all profits, the Secret Sisterhood makes to women's charities. This allows charities to do what they do best -  the really hard fieldwork, while we, the founders, do what we hopefully do best, the social media, design and business stuff, thus creating a sustainable, win-win-win business for all. 

 

Founding Sisters 

We want other passionate supporters of women's unity and Sisterhood to join us.  Currently, we are offering the Title of Founding Sister of the Secret Sisterhood to anyone who contributes a net amount of over $100 to help spread the word and grow the Secret Sisterhood.

We want to build the group up to a million women worldwide, so we can have Secret Sisterhood gatherings in every major city and town, offering our Sisterhood love and support almost everywhere. You could be our next town or city community leader. 

This can be done by contributing $100 to grow the Sisterhood,  by purchasing our Founding Sister Secret Necklace on our website, by buying one of the Limited Edition Founding Sister T-Shirts and / or Packages as offered in our campaign.

The 2017 Founding Sister T-Shirts look like the first-release Secret Sisterhood T-shirts, but are limited to 100 in number and will have a Secret marking that will make them collectable and forever cherished.   You'll need to buy one to find out what the Secret marking is. 

As a Founding Sister, you will also be invited but not obligated to join our Founding Sister Facebook Group, to give your input to help envision the way forward for the Secret Sisterhood. 

 

 
 

Any Other Questions?

 

Check out our website: www.SecretSisterhood.com

Email: hey@secretsisterhood.com

 

 

Our Four Charity Partners

 

 

T-Shirt Size Guide

 

More Stories from the Secret Sisterhood Facebook Group

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

More Secret Sisterhood Reviews

 

"I completely fell in love with this necklace from Secret Sisterhood that oozes Kindness!" - Karen S

 

"When you find a cute little jewellery line that aims to uplift women, and donates a massive 90% of their profits to charities, helping end gender inequality, you have to get macthing bracelets for your pals! Killing it." - Casey G

 

"I wear your necklace all the time and get so many comments on it! I want to buy another one! And some for my friends!"- Bec

 

"I received my Secret Sisterhood necklace today and it's beautiful. Thank you for the inspiration" - Delia D

 

"I bought some Friendship bracelets for my friends and I. They are beautiful and great quality!" - Casey

 

"I really do love my necklace. I’m training to be a midwife and all my patients always comment on how beautiful it is. It’s even better being able to say that the money goes towards such good causes. Seriously, the best!" - Jenny P

 

"I have had so many compliments on my Sisterhood bracelet whilst I have been travelling here ! The Parisians are loving the jewellery and what the message behind it is !" - Sarah A

 

Let's do this! Let's make a difference!

Hugs and Kisses

 

 

FAQ

 

What is the story behind the Secret Sisterhood? 


After viewing first-hand the injustices of women abroad, our founder Jacquie Love and her partner Colin Fabig decided to build a modern business in the form of a positive, empowering, and uplifting women’s movement that gives ninety percent of its profits to women’s charities. 

 

Is the Secret Sisterhood religious? 


No, we have no religious affiliation whatsoever. We try very hard to be as inclusive as possible and welcome women from every country, culture, religion and creed, 

 

What’s with the secrecy? 


The idea of a secret society has been with us since the dawn of time. We thought it was time for a universal, secret girls club. When we founded the Sisterhood we wanted to make it exciting and fun and so added the "Secret" part. A community that starts off with secret symbols, can make us feel that we're part of something bigger than ourselves. And whenever there is a secret, let’s face it, everyone wants in on it. And that our ultimate aim, to get as many women and girls as possible into the Secret Sisterhood, supporting, uplifting and empowering one another. You can read more on our home page.

 

Are you a charity? 


No, we are not. We are a social enterprise set up to run like a modern business that competes with every other business in offering beautiful things to wear and in the future other products, services and events.   However, where we are different is in that we are a profit-for-purpose company. We distribute ninety percent of our profits to women's charities to help end gender inequality. 

 

Other companies give 5% or 10% of their profits to charity. How do you give away 90%? 

It is core to our beliefs that as a social enterprise for purpose, we must be making an effective difference in the world. As soon as possible.  The Secret Sisterhood was not set up to make profits, it was set up to make a difference to women, all over the world. The massive contribution we make to charities is not a marketing trick to get more customers, it's the purpose of the business.  

 

What is a Founding Sister?

We believe that Secret Sisterhood is built by everyday women in their local communities. We hope to enlist an army of Founding Sisters in every city and town on earth to help us grow the movement, so we can make real change. In order for this to happen, we have allocated the title 'Founding Sisters' to any woman who shows that extra support, by purchasing our Founding Sister jewellery, T-Shirts or $100 "Grow the Sisterhood" package. By purchasing our Founding Sister premium items, you are helping Secret Sisterhood grow while also showing you are committing to our cause.

Once you become a Founding Sister, Jacquie Love, the founder,  will get in contact with you and will go through our opportunities of how you can help spread the message of Sisterhood in your local area. You will also get an exclusive invite to join the Founding Sister Facebook Group online. There you will be able to help shape the successful future of the Secret Sisterhood. 

 

What are the Sisterhood T-Shirts made from?

Quality is very important to us so we have made sure each T-Shirt is made with beautiful quality materials. Each T-Shirt is made with 100% Cotton. Our Sisterhood T-Shirt logo is also embroidered with black cotton thread. 

 

I have ordered something. What next? 

Our campaign will run for 14 days. Once this has been completed we will get our beautiful T-Shirts made for each of you. If everything goes to plan, this will take 30 days. Once we receive the T-Shirts, we send them straight to you in our gorgeous Secret Sisterhood packaging. You should expect to receive your package late December/ early January. Please be patient with us, as we are a small team and our production lead times may change slightly, which is out of our control. If there is a delay to your order, we will let you know right away. 

 

I have a pre-sale or post-sales question.

How do I contact you? 

You can email us on hey@secretsisterhood.com

 

How much is shipping? Do you do international shipping?

We offer free international shipping for all orders. Yes, that's right- free shipping EVERYWHERE!

 

Do you offer exchanges or refunds? 

For unopened and unused items, we are happy to accept exchanges and refunds. You’ll have to post them back to us (we’re sorry, but we cant cover that cost) and your refund will be issued once your goods have passed inspection. For refunds, your payment will be reversed. Should your returned items not pass inspection because they’ve clearly been worn, we'll wash them and donate them to a woman in need or you can pay for shipping back to you.  We are prepared to exchange sizes or colours etc. on the condition that you pay the shipping cost both ways. So please insure you choose carefully the first time.  For both refunds and exchanges, you will need to notify us within 14 days of receiving your order.

story:
November 2016 was the start of a difficult journey for the United States.

Donald J. Trump was elected as President and has since divided our nation with ignorance and stupidity. Unfortunately, he is supported by a largely Republican Congress and as such, we feel it's our duty to wish them a happy holiday season.

We will order 540 greeting cards from a small, female run business out of Colorado, as pictured. We will address, stamp, and inscribe each one to the members of Congress, our vile Vice President, and our increasingly abhorrent President himself. Each holiday card will have a message calling for his impeachment and expressing distaste for what feels like a never ending transgression against women, LGBTQIA, people of color, and those that identify as all of the above.

The break down of the $2000 is as follows:

  • The cost of the cards is quoted as a little over $1600 including shipping
  • The cost of postage is ballparked at $180
  • The extra amount is to calculate for the fee Indiegogo charges to use the platform
    • 5% overall plus 3% + $0.30 of every credit card based donation

In the event the public addresses for the state offices are incorrect, we will put the White House down as the return address so that one way or another the message is received.

For every $2000 raised past the goal, we will order a second batch of cards to send to CEOs of companies that support the Trump administration. Amounts past that will turn our attention to news stations in large cities. In the odd event, we raise MORE than that, well....there's other holidays in which to send greeting cards objecting to whatever new policy that is being pushed through legislation.

In the event we don't reach our goal, we will personally make up the difference, in addition to covering any other out of pocket expenses that may come up (pens? tape? a caffeinated beverage?). Any amount that remains after the supplies are ordered, if any, will be paid to the small business providing the cards as a thank you.

Who are we?

We are regular people in regular cities across the United States, but it's getting harder and harder to feel like any action we take makes any sort of difference. In between voting in our district's elections, this is the least we can do.

Yours in resistance,

Leia, Sabrina, Meghan, Yvette, and Catrina

story:
The vision of Treasures of Joy by Neşe International is to help women artisans locally, nationally, and internationally share their hand crafted creations on a larger scale. Did you know that the artisan industry is the second largest economy in the developing world, behind agriculture? Yet it's largely disconnected from the supply chains of traditional retailers and corporations. Treasures of Joy provides opportunities for women we call Thrivers, those who have survived trauma to include, domestic abuse, sex trafficking and being a refugee, to get their artisan products in the hands, hearts and homes of our wonderful subscribers.

 

Treasures of Joy by Neşe wants to empower women to go from survivor to thrivers. The women who craft our products have endured lives full of unspeakable trauma. They have found the courage to leave abuse, trafficking, and strange lands that were not their own and beat all the odds that were stacked against them.

When you partner with us by signing up for a monthly subscription you are doing multiple things:

  • You are helping  women both locally and internationally earn an income from skills that are often overlooked in their local economy
  • You are investing into their future as they create a new life for themselves and their families
  • You are receiving a piece of their gratitude right to your doorstep.
     

Every month your Treasures of Joy box will contain hand selected, artisan creations picked by me, Deronda.  During my travels, my favorite thing to do was to go to the local markets and shop the artisan items. You could find so many things from items that fit in the palm of your hand to paintings, baskets, scarves or small things to accent your home or office.

My goal is to curate the finest and most unique items, that will fit into a box that will bring you joy as you hold them or proudly display them in your personal space. At a minimum each box will contain an item that's consumable, one that's regularly useful, and one that is artistic—that can be kept or used as a gift.

 

Hi, I am Deronda Aiken, founder of Neşe International and creator of the Treasures of Joy subscription box. Neşe is the Turkish word for joy and it describes how I feel every time I impact a thriver and her way of life.

Through the last few years, I have done work in many fields that intersect with women and their safety to include anti-trafficking and have become familiar with these wonderful, truiumphant stories of women who have survived the unimaginable and it is my goal to do all I can to help them tell their story and to also provide you with ways to support.

story:
Our Story

For the past 10 years, the Muslim Jewish Conference has gathered more than 1.000 young change-makers - from over 65 countries -  to engage in dialogue and together, create innovative networks of Muslim-Jewish cooperation. Through annual, week-long conferences that provide a safe space for participants to break down barriers and restore trust, the MJC has managed to become a grassroots leader in the field of interfaith dialogue. However, our ability to keep working independently depends on the necessary resources to establish a sustainable and professionally run organization.

 

Why we do it

Intercultural and interreligious relations worldwide have become increasingly tense over the past several years. Relationships between Muslims and Jews have particularly suffered. Nonetheless, given the right space and time, we know and have proven over the years that citizens can and will engage across different identities constructively and with an open mind, if given the chance to do so.

In 2007, Ilja Sichrovsky participated in a Model United Nations conference. There, in Geneva, he stumbled upon a new life path. A Muslim member of the Pakistani delegation asked if he was a Jew, telling him that he was the first Jew he had met. Sichrovsky recalled, “We were open minded and well-read, but quickly realized we knew nothing about each other. After determining that we posed no threat to one another, we spent time listening to each other.” Following the encounter, Sichrovsky convened like-minded peers to start changing the state of international Jewish-Muslim relations. He founded the Muslim Jewish Conference in 2009 (MJC) to change the pattern of Muslim-Jewish ignorance, mistrust, and hate, and instead repair and turn this relationship into a model for collaboration.

 

How far we have come

Over the last decade, the Muslim Jewish Conference has gathered more than 1.000 young changemakers from more than 65 countries. The MJC team has provoked meaningful communication on relevant topics including: religious teachings, confronting stereotypes, discrimination and prejudice, minority-majority relations, Anti-Muslim Racism and Antisemitism, inter-faith and intra-faith relations, gender relations, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, arts and culture, genocide awareness, and many more. We are proud to have provoked discussions and interactions of the highest quality as well as incubated some of the most original and impactful interfaith projects.

The MJC also managed to create an ecosystem of interfaith actors to learn from each other and build effective coalitions. With a decade of experience based on a network of deeply committed international volunteers, and despite a very limited budget from 2010-2019 which strictly allowed us to organize one conference per year, the Muslim Jewish Conference has become a trusted partner and a reference in the field of citizen and interfaith dialogue.

 

How far we can go

The mission cannot limit itself to annual conferences, be they of unmatched quality and depth. We have to multiply and sustain Muslim Jewish engagement in order to bridge the two communities and counter the divisive and confrontational discourse everywhere around the globe. We must therefore set up a sustainable movement which not only convenes regular conferences but also supports multiple local chapters as well as high quality alumni initiatives on Muslim – Jewish dialogue and collaboration. 

In December 2019, the MJC will host its 10th annual conference in Vienna with a specific purpose: to gather the main actors of this movement to reflect on how far we have come and how far we can go together. The objective is to set up the stage for another successful 10 years with a consolidated team, vision, and resources to transform our work from a grassroots initiative into a professionally guided structure.

In 2020, we want to transform the Muslim Jewish Conference into the Muslim Jewish Alliance (MJA). To be based in Germany, MJA will be run on the principles set forth by the actors of the 10 annual conferences and the many volunteers who made it possible.

 

We need your help

This is where you come in! Run exclusively by volunteers, and having stayed fiercely independent, the MJC has not received the necessary financial support to sustainably professionalize its operations.

Goal : € 30, 000

Achieving this fundraising goal will allow us to execute a transformational 10th Annual Muslim Jewish Conference. For many of our attendees, this will be their first time out of their home country, and in so many cases, it will be their first engagement with "the other". Our aim has always been to be inclusive - to break down walls of access to dialogue, and to cross beyond socio-economic and political barriers. Your help will make it possible to require no costs for nor participation fees from our attendees.  This permits greater demographic diversity, and allows us to support more participants in their journey to the conference.

Additionally, your donation will help us to fund :

  1. Accommodations for 50 participants and 10 volunteers in Austria for the 10th MJC
  2. Kosher and Halal food for all participants and volunteers for the 10th MJC
  3. Airfare for volunteers as well as participants in need of financial support
  4. Professional conference and workshop materials

The money raised does more than just help us organize our 10th Annual Conference. Both during the conference and afterward, you help us to create a safer space for our participants to engage in community and coalition building, creating lasting bonds, and to forge activist platforms for our alumni where they can work to make dreams reality.

Any excess funds raised above our initial goal will go directly into the efforts to organize the 11th Muslim Jewish Conference, as well as seedfund the most innovative alumni projects in our network.

Any additional funds would be used to establish a professional working structure for the envisioned Muslim Jewish Alliance, which aims to ensure a more broad-reaching and permanent effort in rebuilding and strengthening Muslim-Jewish relations worldwide. 

In summary, we are asking YOU to help us build a future where Muslim-Jewish collaboration becomes the norm instead of a distant dream.  Any donation will have an impact!

 

Other ways you can help

We are aware that a financial donation is not an option for everyone. If you are looking for different ways to support us we welcome your help.

  • Campaign with us

Share our campaign on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn. 

  • Connect us

We are looking for funding organizations and individual donors who believe in creating change through grassroots bridge building. If you know of someone who might be willing to provide some financial support, please let them know about us.

  • Talk about us

We need to spread the news that MJC is uniquely equipped to counter the cycle of hatred between Muslims and Jews around the world. If you know journalists who would be interested in covering our story, please let them know about us.

 

Thank you for joining us in this vision, and for your generosity. 

 

 

We are Change

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Be part of the Change

 

 

Relevant Links

The Muslim Jewish Conference

http://www.mjconference.org/

https://www.facebook.com/MJConference/

MJC official conference movie 2018

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xuuF7eE5zhY

MJC official conference movie 2017 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oNOKpeoTdnc

MJC official conference report 2017

http://www.mjconference.org/media-ftp/reports/MJC2017-report.pdf

MJC official conference reports 2010 - 2016

http://www.mjconference.org/category/reports/

Contact us

info@mjconference.org

story:
Rock Climbing is a sport that contributes to the mental and physical development of kids. In this day and age where parents are trying everything possible to get the kids outdoors and away from their gadgets, climbing offers great opportunities for kids to understand their body better and be comfortable in it. 




Features of the Mini Mighty

The Mini Mighty is a climbing wall that comes in a box ready to install and requires simple tools and minimal expertise to set up. We aim to make this affordable and within the reach of the keen parent who wants their kid to get an early start on one of the most challenging and extreme sport.


Made from aluminium, it's as easy as installing a flat-screen TV!

 
  • Purchase the boxed Mini Mighty of your choice (size, colour or material).
  • Drill holes into your wall after taking the appropriate measurements.
  • Install the brackets provided using the appropriate anchor fasteners for your wall type.
  • Slide the panels of the Mini Mighty into the brackets.
You can install holds that come in the box in any way you like using the allen bolts provided. You can then re-orient or re-position them to make climbs easier or harder to keep your child interested in the sport. The Mini Mighty is compatible with holds available in your local climbing store.
The aluminium walls come in the raw aluminium look or in different colours to go with your home interiors.

Sizes

  • 4 ft (w) x 4 ft (h) - Age group 0-3 years or average height of 2 feet
  • 4 ft (w) x 6 ft (h) - Age group 4-8 years or average height of 3 feet
  • 4 ft (w) x 8 ft (h) - Age group 9 years and above


You can also add the 3rd panel to your 4'x4' Mini Mighty to make it 6' tall and later, add the 4th panel to make it 8' tall. As your child grows, the wall grows with them.


DIY

The plywood version of the Mini Mighty is a fun DIY project - it isn't painted, so you can have fun painting the wall together with your kid. At the same time, it is fully ready to be installed.  


What comes in the box

 Mini Mighty 4' x 4' panels (panels 1 & 2)

 And/ 3rd panel

 And/ 4th panel

 Climbing holds made from wood (hand made by artisans) 

 Wall fixing bracket

  • Allen bolts for each hold
  • Anchor bolts - expansion type and PVT plug type
  • Allen key

Additional holds, frames to make the Mini Mighty self standing, crash pads and additional allen bolts/ keys are add-ons and are available on our website; minimighty.feetoffground.com.

Our story so far and how your contribution will impact the community

We are FeetOffGround, an adventure products and services outfit from Bangalore, India with a vision to be the outdoor brand FROM India and not just IN India. We retail some of the top outdoor brands in the world at our store but also specialise in building artificial rock climbing walls

  • Founded by Aalok Bharadwaj in 2012 with the help of friends and family. Aalok obtained a Master of Science degree from the UNSW, Australia, then worked in a tech startup but never felt fulfilled by it.  He eventually pursued his childhood passion of climbing with one intention: to introduce this sport to others. This, he believed could be achieved by providing the right kind of equipment for being outdoors (hence the retail store) and by building walls so people have access to the sport. Now, the best way to do this was to get kids started really young. This was the birth of the idea for the Mini Mighty.
Your contribution is going to make this unique climbing wall, available to all.


What We Need 

We need help to streamline production to achieve a lower cost of manufacturing, so the consumer benefits from the pricing. 

  • We are looking at raising $35,000. Initially, we will use the funds we raise for bulk purchases of raw materials and production of the Mini Mighty to make them available at local sport shops. 
  • Further, if we manage to raise more than our goal, we would apply for Certification and make the Mini Mighty available via distribution channels in parts of US, Australia, Europe and the Middle East
  • We are already in the process of developing addition panels to add to and make the Mini Mighty more exciting and challenging for adults as well


What You Get

  • For your contributions, we'll give away some of our own branded merchandise
  • Camping mugs, hoodies, self inflating sleeping mattresses, bouldering pads, and the Mini Mighty itself are up for grabs

Risks & Challenges

As with all manufacturing projects, we will have challenges in meeting deadlines around production. We have currently given dates and deadlines keeping in mind these delays. 

  • We have already produced a few units of the Mini Mighty and sold a couple to owners of play homes. So, we know where to get the work done and how long it will take. 

Help us deliver the best ready-to-install personal climbing wall for your kids and get their feet off the ground.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word.

  • If you are a climber and think that this project can help increase the awareness of the sport and bring in better climbers by stating them off young, spread the word now!

story:
Short Summary

On January 12, 2010, Haiti was struck by an earthquake that measured 7.0. I have made two visits to Haiti since May 2014. Since then Haiti has become a place that my heart calls home. The living conditions have yet to improve since 2010 and is beyond heartbreaking.

At the start of the year, my friend Ashley Inabinet and I stayed at Benite Jeune's orphanage. Here, two ladies take care of nine precious girls. Benite Jeune started this orphanage, as well as a church, preschool, primary, and secondary school. During the earthquake his 5 story school came to ruins. He built a new school, and is now expanding it with chemistry labs and computer labs. The kids are fed lunch, which sometimes can be their only meal of the day. To attend this school for an enitre year is only $300. Many kids in the community do not have the funds to attend this school, preventing them from fulfilling some of their life-long dreams. If you wish to sponsor a child, Benite can work with you to find a child in need. 

Haiti is still badly damaged from the disaster and needs your help. By contributing any amount of money you are helping a child dreams come true. 

You can also help by visiting Haiti and building a relationship with its beautiful people. During Easter break and the summer of 2015, Ashley and I are planning to return and bring anyone who wishes to visit this amazing country. The best way to help the people is going there and serving them.

story:
Hungarian translation available: Magyar fordítás az angol szöveg után! A videó rendelkezik magyar felirattal (cc gomb lenyomásával aktiválható).

The main objective of this campaign is to show the world that we are committed to fighting against exclusion and detention.  We aim to draw attention to the rights and the desperate plight of the refugees and asylum seekers as well as to the tragic situation arisen from world politics, which concerns thousands of people even today. We would like to help the refugees staying in our country to find their feet in this part of the world far away from their homes.

One has to accept the fact that the refugees arriving in Hungary left their homes with good cause. They should be treated with respect since they would not join any organizations that intend to take other’s lives. They are not criminals but victims and their escape serves to end violence in the world.

„From Hungary to Egypt, endless regulations and overt intimidation increasingly target civil society. And around the world, brave men and women who dare raise their voices are harassed and attacked and even killed.” Barack Obama

Short-term goals:

The amount flowing from the campaign will be spent on the basic essentials such as food, water, duvet, blanket, pillow,clothes, diaper, baby carriage, shoes, slippers, painkiller, antipyretic, antibiotics, bandage, wheelchair, and crutch.

Long-term goals:

-to make more and more people join us.

-to point out the refugee’s vital role, since multiculturalism is inherent in the world’s most successful countries.

-to draw attention to the desperate plight of the refugees as well as their  inalienable rights.

-to organize programmes which are supposed to facilitate integration.

-to provide basic health-care services for refugee children.

The Hungarian government is doing its best to stir up intense hatred towards the refugees. Accordingly, the Hungarian government has placed manipulative, ambiguous placards all over the country in favour of the refugees’ negative judgement.

The government is planning to make considerable modifications in the law to make the life of the refugees fleeing from persecution to Hungary impossible.

The government does not distinguish between refugees and bracket together those fleeing from persecution, war or violence with those immigrating to Hungary due to economic reasons.

A female student from Szeged has been badly beaten up due to the fact that bald men dressed in black picked a fight with a Hungarian man of mixed race who was thought to be an immigrant. The girlfriend of the mixed-race boy tried to intervene, the attackers did not care about it, and therefore the young girl was also slapped several times across the face. The attackers ran away afterwards. By the way, the biracial boy was born in Hungary; accordingly he is a Hungarian national.

Tímea’s cheekbone broke; there are huge bruises over both of her eyes; her mouth cracked; the wound needed several stitches; some of her teeth nearly fell out. Her broken cheekbone was finally put together. She posted a message on Facebook a few hours before the operation:

“I’m going to recover.”

As was seen above, a girl can be beaten up for no reason in today’s Hungary just because her boyfriend’s complexion is not “purely” white. In addition, a gay activist has also been maltreated. Andrea Giuliano, guy activist from Hungary, has been attacked by unknown offenders; his cheek has been smashed without explanation. He has already received several death threats in connection with his work.  

The victim posted a message on his Facebook page upon the attack: “Help! Somebody’s punched me on the nose; my cheek’s been completely smashed!”

We, humans have always been good at building walls. We erect walls amid genders, social classes, racial and religious beliefs, and sexual orientation. We put up walls instead of building bridges to end discrimination shoulder to shoulder.

The Hungarian government decreed that a barbed wire fence, which is 175 km long and 3 m high, must be erected on the border between Hungary and Serbia, blocking the refugees’ way and their last chance to live under human conditions. The fence will be equipped with NATO-wire; its blades will cause serious injuries to the refugees.

It should not be forgotten that only some of the refugees are so fortunate to be able to flee their war-torn native country. As so often happens, family members sacrifice everything since they sell all of their properties to get enough money so that at least one person can escape the hell they are forced to live in. It is they who arrive to a country believed to be safe after their months-long escape and it is they who will have to face a border enclosed with barbed wire fence.

Asylum seekers have the right to be treated as humans as well as to receive refugee status within the framework of legal and fair procedure. This chance should be given to every human being. Indigent refugees are deprived of this chance by building the fences.

Building the fences will be likely to cost as much as eleven years’ asylum budget of Hungary. Building them is a wrong-headed decision. Erecting walls, beyond its symbolical meaning, can never be a solution to any problem.

It has been proved throughout history that walls encouraging isolation are senseless, and have demanded a lot of needless sacrifices indirectly; however, they have always been demolished.

Zeid Raad al-Husszein declared in front of the UN’s Human Rights Council: “I feel distressed and ashamed of the refugees’ frequent demonization, which is noticeable in several countries whose residents live a peaceful, prosperous and carefree life.”

“Migrants are human beings with the same human rights as we have here. They are not criminals.”

Hungarians throughout history had to flee many times as well. We received help from other countries at the time, which we tend to forget about.

We thank all the nations of the world for taking both our Jewish and non-Jewish compatriots being forced to flee Hungary at the time of the Second World War.

We thank all the nations of the world for taking our refugees during the Hungarian Revolution of 1956, who fled from the Soviet terror and repression in the hope of a better life.

We should be grateful to the countries having taken our refugees.

Albert Einstein, Elie Wiesel, George Soros, Marc Chagall, Rita Ora, Sigmund Freud, Karl Popper, Andy Garcia, Thomas Mann, Milos Forman, Jerry Springer (his parents were German refugees), Claude Lévi-Strauss, Raphael Lemkin, Victor Hugo, Frédéric Chopin, Bela Bartók, Robert Capa.


Kampányunk célja, hogy megmutassuk a világnak, hogy küzdünk a kirekesztés és a fogvatartás ellen! Célunk felhívni a figyelmet a menekültek és menedékkérők jogaira, a menekültek hátrányos helyzetére és a világpolitikának köszönhetően kialakult tragikus helyzetre, mely több millió embert érint napjainkban is. Segíteni szeretnénk a hazánkban élő migránsokat abban, hogy megtalálják helyüket hazájuktól távol a világnak ezen a részén.

El kell fogadnunk, hogy a Magyarországra érkező menekültek alapos okkal hagyták el országukat, tiszteletet érdemelnek azért, mert nem voltak hajlandók olyan szervezetekhez csatlakozni, mely mások életére tőr. Ők nem bűnözők, hanem áldozatok és menekülésükkel azt a célt szolgálják, hogy a világon megszűnjön az erőszak.

„Magyarországtól Egyiptomig vég nélküli szabályozások és nyílt megfélemlítések érik egyre inkább a civil társadalmat. És a világ körül olyan bátor férfiakat és nőket zaklatnak, támadnak, sőt gyilkolnak meg, akik hallatni merik a hangjukat”Barack Obama

Mire van szükségünk? Mire fordítjuk a támogatást?

Rövidtávú céljaink:

A kampányból befolyó támogatásból elsősorban a legfontosabb tárgyi eszközöket szeretnénk biztosítani: élelmiszer, ásványvíz, paplan, takaró, párna, ruhanemű, pelenka, babakocsi, cipő, papucs, fájdalomcsillapító, lázcsillapító, antibiotikum, kötszer, kerekesszék, mankó

Hosszútávú céljaink:

-szeretnénk, hogy minél többen csatlakozzanak hozzánk

-rámutatni a menekültek értékteremtő szerepére, hiszen a világ legsikeresebb országaira jellemző a multikulturalizmus

-felhívni a figyelmet a menekültek hátrányos helyzetére és jogaira

-kampányok szervezése a menekültek fogvatartása ellen

-integrációs programok szervezése a menekültek számára

-a menekült gyermekek számára megfelelő ellátás biztosítása

A magyar kormány intézkedései

A magyar kormány mindent megtesz annak érdekében, hogy az emberekben gyűlöletet keltsen a menekültek iránt. Ennek érdekében a magyar kormány az egész ország területén manipulatív, kétértelmű plakátokat helyezett el a menekültek negatív megítélése érdekében.

A kormány olyan törvénymódosításokat tervez, melyek a legelesettebbeket veszik célba és ellehetetlenítik olyan menekültek életét, akik valamely üldöztetés elől menekültek Magyarországra.

A kormány jelen állás szerint nem válogat menekült és menekült között és összemossa a kényszer, üldöztetés, háború és erőszak elől menekülőket a csak és kizárólag gazdasági okokból migráló emberekkel.

Mi lett az eredménye a kormány kampányának?

Egy szegedi egyetemista lányt megvertek. Az eset úgy történt, hogy fekete ruhás kopasz férfiak belekötöttek egy félvér magyar férfibe, mert azt hitték, hogy bevándorló. A félvér fiú barátnője próbált közbelépni, ami nem érdekelte a támadókat, ezért a fiatal lány kapta a pofonok nagyját, ezután a támadók elfutottak. A félvér fiú egyébként Magyarországon született és magyar állampolgár.

Tímea arccsontja eltört, mindkét szeme alatt zúzódások vannak, szája felrepedt, a sebet több öltéssel kellett összevarrni, kis híján több foga is kiesett. Tímea törött arccsontjait végül sikerült összeilleszteni. A műtét előtt pár órával a Facebookon azt üzente az érte aggódóknak:

„Meggyógyulok!”

Erősödő szélsőségek a melegeket sem kímélik

Amint azt fent láthattuk ma Magyarországon minden ok nélkül megvernek egy lányt csak azért mert a barátja bőrének színe nem „tisztán” fehér. Ezt követően egy melegjogi aktivistát is bántalmazás ért. Andrea Giuliano, Magyarországon élő olasz melegjogi aktivistát ismeretlenek támadták meg, arcát összetörték, melynek okát nem indokolták. Munkájával összefüggésben több halálos fenyegetést is kapott már.

Az áldozat a támadást követően írt facebook oldalára: „Segítség! Valaki orrba csapott, teljesen összetört az arcom!” 

Miért emelünk falakat az emberek közé?

Mi emberek mindig is erősek voltunk a falak építésében. Falakat emelünk a nemek-, társadalmi rétegek-, fajok-, vallási meggyőződések-, szexuális beállítottság között.

Falakat emelünk ahelyett, hogy hidakat építenénk és együttes  erővel győznénk le a megkülönböztetést.

A magyar kormány arról határozott, hogy egy 175 km hosszú szögesdróttal ellátott 3 méter magas kerítést emel a magyar-szerb határon lezárva ezzel a menekültek útját és utolsó lehetőségét arra, hogy normális életkörülmények között élhessenek. A kerítés teljes terjedelmében NATO-dróttal lesz felszerelve, pengéi jelentős sérüléseket okoznak majd a menekülteknek.

Ne felejtsük a menekültek egy része van olyan szerencsés, hogy el tud menekülni háborúval sújtotta származási országából, gyakran úgy, hogy a családtagok az életüket áldozzák értük, mert eladják az összes megmaradt ingóságukat, hogy annyi pénzhez jussanak, hogy legalább egy ember el tudjon jönni abból a pokolból amiben élni kényszerülnek. Ők érkeznek el hónapokig tartó menekülés után egy biztonságosnak hitt országba és ő előttük zárja most le ezzel a kerítéssel a kormány a határt.

A menedékkérőknek joguk van ahhoz, hogy emberként bánjanak velük és ahhoz, hogy egy törvényes és tisztességes eljárás keretében kapjanak menekült státuszt. Ezt a lehetőséget minden embernek meg kell adni. A kerítés a rászoruló menekültektől ezt a lehetőséget elveszi.

A kerítés építése várhatóan annyiba fog kerülni, mint Magyarország 11 évi menekültügyi költségvetése. A kerítés megépítése elhibázott döntés! A falak emelése túl azok szimbolikus jelentésén nem megoldás. A történelem során tapasztaltuk, hogy az elszigetelődést elősegítő falak értelmetlennek bizonyultak és közvetve rengeteg felesleges áldozattal jártak, de végül mind leomlottak.

Mit mond az ENSZ?

Zeid Raad al-Husszein az ENSZ Emberi Jogi Tanácsa előtt akként nyilatkozott, hogy „lesújt és szégyennel tölt el a menekültek gyakori démonizálása, amely számos olyan országban megfigyelhető, amelyek lakosai békében, jólétben és gondtalanságban élnek”

“A migránsok emberek, ugyanolyan emberi jogokkal, mint ami itt nekünk van. Ők nem bűnözők.”

Köszönjük a világnak!

A történelem során mi magyarok is többször kénytelenek voltunk menekülni… akkor segítséget kaptunk más országoktól, ezt mára azonban elfelejtettük.

Köszönjük a világ minden nemzetének, hogy a II. világháború időszakában befogadták a Magyarországról elmenekülni kényszerülő zsidó és nem zsidó honfitársainkat.

Köszönjük a világ minden nemzetének, hogy 1956-ban a magyar forradalom és szabadságharc ideje alatt befogadták menekültjeinket, akik a szovjet terror és elnyomás elöl menekültek egy jobb élet reményében.

Hálával tartozunk azoknak az országoknak, melyek menekültjeinket befogadták.

Ők is menekültek:

Albert Einstein, Elie Wiesel, George Soros, Marc Chagall,Rita Ora, Sigmund Freud, Karl Popper, Andy Garcia, Thomas Mann, Milos Forman,Jerry Springer (szülei német menekültek), Claude Lévi-Strauss, Raphael Lemkin, Victor Hugo, Frédéric Chopin, Bela Bartók, Robert Capa

Hungarian translation available: Magyar fordítás az angol szöveg után! A videó rendelkezik magyar felirattal (cc gomb lenyomásával aktiválható).The main objective of this campaign is to show the
world that we are committed to fighting against exclusion and detention.  We aim to draw attention to the rights and the
desperate plight of the refugees and asylum seekers as well as to the tragic
situation arisen from world politics, which concerns thousands of people even
today. We would like to help the refugees staying in our country to find their
feet in this part of the world far away from their homes.
One has to accept the fact that the
refugees arriving in Hungary left their homes with good cause. They should be
treated with respect since they would not join any organizations that intend to
take other’s lives. They are not criminals but victims and their escape serves to
end violence in the world.
„From Hungary to Egypt, endless regulations and overt intimidation increasingly target civil society. And around the world, brave men and women who dare raise their voices are harassed and attacked and even killed.” Barack ObamaShort-term goals:
The amount flowing from the campaign will be spent on the basic essentials such as food, water, duvet, blanket, pillow,clothes, diaper, baby carriage, shoes, slippers, painkiller, antipyretic,
antibiotics, bandage, wheelchair, and crutch.Long-term goals:
-to make more and more people join
us. 
-to point out the refugee’s vital
role, since multiculturalism is inherent in the world’s most successful
countries. 
-to draw attention to the desperate plight of the
refugees as well as their  inalienable
rights.
-to organize programmes which are
supposed to facilitate integration.
-to provide basic health-care
services for refugee children.









The Hungarian government is doing its best
to stir up intense hatred towards the refugees. Accordingly, the Hungarian
government has placed manipulative, ambiguous placards all over the country in
favour of the refugees’ negative judgement.


The government is planning to make
considerable modifications in the law to make the life of the refugees fleeing
from persecution to Hungary impossible.

The government does not distinguish
between refugees and bracket together those fleeing from persecution, war or
violence with those immigrating to Hungary due to economic reasons.

with a Hungarian man of mixed race who was thought to be an immigrant. The
girlfriend of the mixed-race boy tried to intervene, the attackers did not care

“I’m going to recover.”

death threats in connection with his work.  
The victim posted a message on his Facebook
page upon the attack: “Help! Somebody’s punched
me on the nose; my cheek’s been completely smashed!”





We, humans have always been good at

religious beliefs, and sexual orientation. We put up walls instead of building

The Hungarian government decreed that a barbed wire

Building the fences will be likely to cost as much as

We thank all the nations of the world for taking both

refugees), Claude Lévi-Strauss, Raphael Lemkin, Victor Hugo, Frédéric Chopin,

gyakran úgy, hogy a családtagok az életüket áldozzák értük, mert eladják az
összes megmaradt ingóságukat, hogy annyi pénzhez jussanak, hogy legalább egy
ember el tudjon jönni abból a pokolból amiben élni kényszerülnek. Ők érkeznek
el hónapokig tartó menekülés után egy biztonságosnak hitt országba és ő előttük
zárja most le ezzel a kerítéssel a kormány a határt.
A menedékkérőknek joguk van
ahhoz, hogy emberként bánjanak velük és ahhoz, hogy egy törvényes és
tisztességes eljárás keretében kapjanak menekült státuszt. Ezt a lehetőséget
minden embernek meg kell adni. A kerítés a rászoruló menekültektől ezt a lehetőséget elveszi. 
A kerítés építése várhatóan
annyiba fog kerülni, mint Magyarország 11 évi menekültügyi költségvetése. A kerítés
megépítése elhibázott döntés! A falak emelése túl azok szimbolikus jelentésén
nem megoldás. A történelem során tapasztaltuk, hogy az elszigetelődést
elősegítő falak értelmetlennek bizonyultak és közvetve rengeteg felesleges
áldozattal jártak, de végül mind leomlottak.
Mit mond az ENSZ?
Zeid Raad al-Husszein az ENSZ Emberi Jogi Tanácsa előtt akként nyilatkozott, hogy „lesújt és szégyennel tölt el a menekültek gyakori démonizálása, amely számos olyan országban megfigyelhető, amelyek lakosai békében, jólétben és gondtalanságban élnek”
“A migránsok emberek, ugyanolyan emberi jogokkal, mint ami itt nekünk van. Ők nem bűnözők.”

Köszönjük a világnak!
A történelem során mi magyarok is
többször kénytelenek voltunk menekülni… akkor segítséget kaptunk más
országoktól, ezt mára azonban elfelejtettük.
Köszönjük a világ minden nemzetének,
hogy a II. világháború időszakában befogadták a Magyarországról elmenekülni
kényszerülő zsidó és nem zsidó honfitársainkat. 
Köszönjük a világ minden nemzetének,
hogy 1956-ban a magyar forradalom és szabadságharc ideje alatt befogadták
menekültjeinket, akik a szovjet terror és elnyomás elöl menekültek egy jobb
élet reményében.
Hálával tartozunk azoknak az országoknak,
melyek menekültjeinket befogadták.
Ők is menekültek:
Albert Einstein, Elie Wiesel,
George Soros, Marc Chagall,Rita Ora, Sigmund Freud, Karl Popper, Andy Garcia, Thomas Mann, Milos Forman,Jerry Springer (szülei német menekültek), Claude Lévi-Strauss, Raphael Lemkin, Victor Hugo,
Frédéric Chopin, Bela Bartók, Robert Capa

story:
We are trying to raise funds for Michael Armendariz (the rap artist, "Esé Spook") in order to hire a lawyer for co-counsel in a habeas corpus case.  Why should you care?  Because what happened to him could happen to you.  He was at a bar with friends celebrating the engagement of his best friend from childhood.  They were more brothers than friends.  They decided it was time to leave and were in the parking lot when the two of them were attacked by about 6 people.  They didn’t know who these people were or why they were being attacked, but it was becoming clear that they weren’t going to stop until Michael’s friend was dead.  They were holding Michael down but he finally got away and tried without success to pull the main aggressor off of his friend.   Shots were fired, the man went down.  He died.  Michael didn’t have any idea, but it turned out that the men who attacked them were law enforcement officers.

From there, the law enforcement agencies involved used every trick in the book to send Michael to prison.  They destroyed evidence, planted evidence, didn’t collect evidence that didn’t show the officers in a good light, and gave him a public defender whose main mission was to get the case over with, not to represent Michael.  He was sentenced to 43 years, of which he has served 13 as of now.  We are trying to right this wrong and get Michael the trial he deserves.

Read Michael's Call for Action

story:
A brave Canadian, Rohan Roberts, has filed a Human Rights complaint against police for a violent incident stemming from carding.

Carding is the practice of being stopped and questioned by police for no other reason than the colour of one's skin.

It is wrong. It is racist. And it has got to stop.

Help pay for Rohan's legal bills.


References: CBC article.  Global news. Lawyer Selwyn Pieters.

story:
EN:
Baltic Pride is anannual festival and parade that brings together LGBT+ community and supporters in one of the Baltic capitals – Tallinn, Riga or Vilnius. The parade that will take place in Latvia on June 9th  is very important to us as  organization, because we want to be loud and proud about equality, to have opportunity to express our opinion and to get more people involved in solution of equality questions. So far the LGBT+ rights situation in the Baltics is far from great due to the low engagement of the LGBT community and broader society of our countries.

We believe in value that Baltic Pride brings, therefore we participate in support to the idea of the event and in order to show that Lithuanians who care about equal rights to LGBT+ community stand together with others from Baltic countries.

Workshops to prepare for the parade will be held in Vilnius and Šiauliai. The financial support is needed for materials for poster making, LGBT+ flags and so on. Also money will be spent to cover expences of the trip (renting a bus with driver and fuel)

Financial support will give opportunity for youth from different towns of Lithuania to safely get to the Pride march and to represent their believes.


LT:
Baltic Pride – tai kasmetinis festivalis ir eitynės, suburiančios LGBT+ asmenis ir juos palaikančius paeiliui vienoje iš Baltijos valstybių sostinių – Taline, Rygoje arba Vilniuje. Eitynės, 2018 metais vyksiančios Latvijoje, birželio 9 dieną, mums kaip organizacijai yra labai svarbios, nes norime būti matomesni, atsiranda galimybė išsakyti savo nuomonę, siekti būti lygiomis teisėmis pripažintais bei tikėtis, kad problemos nelygybės klausimais būtų sprendžiamos. Iki šiol LGBT+ teisių situacija Baltijos šalyse yra prasčiausia ir dėl mažo LGBT bendruomenės ir visuomenės įsitraukimo.

Mes tikime eitynių nauda ir dalyvaujame, nes svarbu palaikyti eitynių idėją, o kartu parodyti, kad Lietuvos gyventojai, palaikantys lygias teises LGBT+ žmonėms, prisideda prie Baltijos šalių bendruomenės.

Vilniuje bei Šiauliuose vyks dirbtuvės (t.y. pasirengimas eitynėms). Joms reikalinga parama bus naudojama medžiagoms plakatams, triukšmo atributikai, LGBT+ vėliavoms. Taip pat  lėšos bus skirtos kelionei (t.y. autobuso su vairuotoju nuomai ir kurui).

Parama suteiktų galimybę jaunimui, atstovaujančiam kelis Lietuvos miestus, kuris ne visada turi galimybę savarankiškai, saugiai, su atsakinga bendruomene vykti į renginį ir patirti eitynių džiaugsmą.


Tolerant Youth Association/ Tolerantiško jaunimo asociacija:

http://www.tja.lt

https://www.facebook.com/tja.lt 

https://youtu.be/fXMuVYBat28



Tolerant Youth Association group at the Baltic pride in 2013 /
Tolerantiško jaunimo asociacijos grupė 2016 m. Baltic Pride eitynėse.

Tolerant Youth Association at the Baltic pride 2016 /
Tolerantiško jaunimo asociacijos grupė 2016 m. Baltic Pride eitynėse.

We should be brave to meet a Baltic Pride opposition /
Turime būti drąsūs sutikti eitynių opoziciją.

Tolerant Youth Association group at the Baltic pride in 2010 /
Tolerantiško jaunimo asociacijos grupė 2010 m. Baltic Pride eitynėse.


Bus full of activists going to Baltic Pride 2015 in Riga / Autobusas pilnas aktyvistų vykstančių į Baltic Pride 2015, Rygoje.

story:
Annnnd We're Done!

Thanks so much to everyone who donated to our campaign! Your generosity makes a huge difference and puts us that much closer to meeting our budget needs for the year! As we continue to pursue grants, business donations, and other funding sources, we are still more than happy to continue accepting individual donations of money or in-kind goods! You can learn more about how to donate to Queer Rock Camp here: http://www.queerrockcamp.org/donate/
For those who selected a perk, expect an exciting package in the mail within a few weeks!
Thanks again for your continued support!
- the Queer Rock Camp Collective

Update 4/25: 61% there!

Wow!!!! These last few days have been incredible, with amazing folks from all over continuing to donate both on and off this campaign! From outside donations our total online goal is down to $14,700, which means that as of 7:30pm today this campaign is 61% funded! Getting fully funded in the remaining 24 hours seems wild, but it could totally happen with your support and enthusiasm - please help us keep spreading the word. Ya'll are such amazing rockstars, and we could not do this work without you! 
- the Queer Rock Camp Collective

Update 4/22: Campaign goal now $14,950. We are 45% there!

We'd like to give a HUGE shoutout to everyone who has donated and helped spread the word so far! We are completely honored and excited to have your support. 
We are also thrilled to announce that, because of a few large donations that have come in *outside of this indiegogo campaign*, we are able to move our online fundraising goal down to $14,940. This means that, as of April 22, we are 45% funded! 
Expanding to Seattle has well over tripled our budget this year- renting school space alone is around 6 times more expensive than in Olympia! Every dollar donated helps, and we appreciate your help spreading the word and helping us raise money in our final 4 days of this campaign!
Lots of love & a big YOU ROCK!
- the Queer Rock Camp Collective

Update: Limited Edition 5th Anniversary T-Shirts

Thank you to all our funders so far!! You all ROCK. Check out our limited edition t-shirts that are available with donations of $45+


 

Queer Rock Camp 

Queer Rock Camp is a weeklong music camp for queer, gender variant, gender non-conforming and allied youth (ages 12-21) based in Olympia, Washington. Youth and volunteers come from all over the Puget Sound area, West Coast, and beyond. Campers learn an instrument, form a band, write an original song, and their hard work culminates in a public showcase. Throughout the week, youth participate in workshops focusing on community building, social justice, self-empowerment, and musical techniques. Queer Rock Camp amplifies the voice of a population that is usually silent -- allowing youth to be loud and to express themselves honestly and authentically through music. 

Queer Rock Camp was founded in 2011 with 33 campers from around the Pacific Northwest, and subsequent years have brought continual growth, challenges, and exciting changes! This previous summer we served approximately 50 campers from around the US, and volunteers have come from all over the world to be part of camp. We are a currently a program of Stonewall Youth in Olympia, and are working towards getting independent non-profit status. As one of the first and only music camps for queer youth -- QRC has become a model for a new and exciting form of music programing. 


We're Expanding!

Last year we were flooded with camper applications, and we are so excited to host a brand new session of camp in Seattle to serve a greater number of youth! Seattle has a real lack of queer youth focused programming and we are so excited to bring QRC to the city! Seattle is substantially more expensive in terms of renting space, and transportation. We need our community's help to get us set up in the big city. We plan on using this money to seed our initial camp while we establish ourselves in Seattle and move towards utilizing sustainable sources of funding.  



What We Need

We are asking for $20,000 dollars to help Queer Rock Camp fund sessions in Olympia and Seattle. 

Food: $2000
Supplies: $400
Camp Shirts: $1000
Bus Passes: $200
Trainings and workshops: $550
Music Equipment: $900
Coordinator Stipends (We employ 13 people for these roles): $13,000 
Space Rental Olympia: $1,700
Space Rental Seattle (this is the standard rate of renting space in Seattle public schools): $11,000
Storage: $1,000
Showcase rental: $3000
Host Family Stipends: $800
Administrative (website, non-profit fee, supplies, & copies.... so many copies....) $4700

Total: $40,250

We are crowdfunding for about half of our budget! 


The Impact

"It's like walking in a horrible forest like when I'm outside of Queer Rock Camp and then like going into a beautiful garden" - 2015 Camper

The impact of camp is immense. Queer Rock Camp has created a ripple effect in the lives of many campers and volunteers, with folks going on to empower their own communities with the skills and confidence gained at camp. Youth have started new bands, feminist music festivals, and their own camps as a result of participating in this program. 

Camp has been immensely successful, doubling in size since its first incarnation in 2011. As we expand into Seattle, we are excited to continue to inspire a whole generation of young queer musicians in the North West. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but want to help? 

  • Share the indiegogo campaign on social media!
  • Throw us a benefit party or show
  • Volunteer at camp or host youth
  • Donate equipment
  • Join the organizing Collective and help plan camp
  • Email us at queerrockcamp@gmail.com and take on a specific project




Applications now open

2015 Camp Sessions

Seattle: June 22-27th at Youngstown Cultural Arts Center
Olympia: August 10-15th at Lincoln Options Elementary School

Follow the links to our website to fill them out! 
Apps are due May 1st (campers), and May 10th (volunteers)

http://www.queerrockcamp.org/campers/camper-application/
http://www.queerrockcamp.org/volunte…/volunteer-application/

Email us at queerrockcamp@gmail.com and take on a specific project








Applications now open

2015 Camp Sessions
Seattle: June 22-27th at Youngstown Cultural Arts CenterOlympia: August 10-15th at Lincoln Options Elementary School
Follow the links to our website to fill them out! Apps are due May 1st (campers), and May 10th (volunteers)
http://www.queerrockcamp.org/campers/camper-application/http://www.queerrockcamp.org/volunte…/volunteer-application/

story:
Raise Your Voice Saint Lucia Inc was founded in February 2013 our main purpose to advocate on behalf of the vulnerable women and children who are victims of gender based violence.

Our organization's ultimate goals are to create change within the legislative system to eliminate laws in the civil code, criminal code and domestic violence and child protection act that are discriminatory, unjustified and creates inequality among women and children and improved service delivery within the social services agencies. Our immediate goal is to establish a center which will provide support for women and children who are victims of violence i.e. hotline, victims aid, counseling support services, legal aid, advocacy and support for victims of violence. At present we provide a go to service for over 400 clients as we do not have an administrative center to coordinate our work, this center will provide a centralized location where women and girls can receive services on demand and our organization can cater to many more women and children who are in dire need of support services.

Our Key goals are to provide a safe environment where women and children received support to empower and educate the public about human rights, while supporting and encouraging survivors of violence to report offenses to the relevant officials, and to help them rebuild their lives by providing services from a centralized location which can be accessed at any time. We have embarked on a mission to raise funds to establish the center however the because of the nature of this center the location requires extensive resource mobilization we are now exploring funding opportunities to establish the center to provide extended services to our clients.

We are raising funds to establish a center to provide consolidated and centralized services for women and children who are victims of violence, this center will provide individual and group counseling, legal aid, advocacy services, victims aid and other administrative functions to ensure better services to women and children. As it stands now we have to go to each and every clients to provide the said services as we are not financially capable to maintain rental expenses for a centralized location for our services.

story:
WalletBoss is a worldwide P2P micro-loan platform

WalletBoss is a worldwide peer-to-peer (P2P) micro-loan platform which allows users to lend and borrow money across the globe – interest-free, without commissions and without the mediation of banks or other middlemen. In fact, users do not even need a bank account. This dramatically cuts burdensome costs for the borrowers and empowers them to regain control over their finances. P2P loans give borrowers access to financing that they may not have otherwise gotten approval for by standard financial intermediaries.

For some people, specifically in underprivileged countries or communities, a mere $24 loan from WalletBoss to consolidate loans or pay off high interest “shark” or other loans could make a huge difference and put them back on the right financial track.

In order to jumpstart the model on a global scale and validate this powerful concept, WalletBoss needs people like you to help us launch this important social project.

By donating as little as the cost of 1 cup of coffee you can be part of something that may actually change a family’s life. You become part of a community that cares.

Just to make sure: your money is not an actual donation but becomes part of your digital wallet. You can then use this money to grant loans, which are subsequently paid back to your wallet in weekly payments. As you know, a small amount for you in the western world goes a long way in underdeveloped countries.

A SHORT SUMMARY

One of the most common problems for underprivileged populations is the “shark loan” phenomenon. “Shark loans” are loans with disproportionately high weekly interest rates of a minimum 6%, and up to an incredible 15% a week. “Shark loaners” exploit people who often resort to these loans in desperate financial situations, either to keep a roof over their heads, or keep their small businesses afloat. The skyrocketing interest rates result in borrowers being unable to repay their debts, which spin out of control over a short period of time. This leads to a financial whirlpool, and families become entrenched deeper and deeper into the cycle of debt and poverty without any escape routes, at times being exposed to extreme violence, when unable to repay.

Here is how YOU can make a difference.

Our vision at WalletBoss is to create communities composed of socially conscious people willing to help those in need, bringing together investors with potential borrowers, providing a convenient worldwide on-line platform, with the opportunity to grant and take and moral loans.

In order to jumpstart the model on a global scale and validate the concept, WalletBoss needs people like you to help us launch this amazing project. Just choose the amount you’d like to invest in the project, and from as little as US $2, you can download the app (Click here to Download) and start lending money to those who need it most. The more generous your contribution, the larger amount of families are touched.

Each loan is granted after a thorough screening process of the potential borrowers, to make sure they fit the appropriate low-risk profile, in order to maximize the impact of the lenders’ donations. As a perk, a WalletBoss user can earn token coins which can be changed into cash.

You can start by Download the WalletBoss App - Here and see for yourself how easy, simple, and well built.

A WIN-WIN SITUATION

We are aiming for 10,000 loans of US $24 each to families in Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, Ghana, South Africa, Malaysia and Peru, hoping that in the future the project will evolve to cover more countries.

In order to finance these loans, our project needs 100.000 crowd lenders worldwide, who would invest a minimum amount of US$2 each.

We can guarantee you that your money actually goes to loans, and not into developing the platform, which is 100 % our responsibility. So you win, because your money has the highest social impact possible, and we win because we help you facilitate the process. The families win because they get access to loans which they would not have access to through standard financial instances, which enables them to get back on financial track.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Follow these easy steps:

  1. On the side of this page, you can decide on the amount of money you’d like to invest in the loans, and the number of families you wish to lend money to.
  2. Download the WalletBoss app.
  3. At the end of the campaign, you will receive the amount you have pledged in your digital wallet on the WalletBoss app.

At the end of the campaign, the app will update the loan interface, and the magic is going to happen: you will see the first loan requests and can choose to whom you want to grant loans.

The borrowers repay the loan in 50 weekly payments, directly to your digital wallet.

When you get your money back, you can then reinvest it in a new loan, should you wish to do so, and make an additional difference in the world to another family.

Please join us and become one of the leaders of this social and financial revolution that begins right now and right here! Enough of banks and loan sharks exploiting the poorer people.

HOW ARE WE DIFFERENT?

While other lending platforms apply fees and interest for loans, WalletBoss is a 100% free platform aimed at helping people for NO profit. No fees, no interest, no middlemen skimming off cuts, unlike other P2P loan sites.

When you donate to charities, the foundation manages your money and decides what to do with it, and a substantial part of your money is destined to sustain a big administration apparatus, including salaries of CEO’s.

Another advantage is that with WalletBoss you know who your beneficiaries are, it is not an anonymous pool.

Today's innovative technology allows for efficient P2P (person-to-person) interaction, thus making the necessity of intermediaries redundant, allowing us to help people in need with virtually no cost and expenses while maximizing the impact of your help and loan. We provide an alternative to conventional financing, by eliminating the need for banks and bank accounts.

THE CHALLENGES WE FACED WHILE DEVELOPING THE PLATFORM

Of course, each project faces challenges. We did some comprehensive research to address specific issues in P2P lending that we, at WalletBoss, felt we needed to attend, and came up with creative and solid solutions.

THE CREDIT SCORING ALGORITHM INTERFACE

To handle the subject of uncertainty regarding a borrower's ability to repay a loan, we have developed a psycholinguistics-based algorithm, which creates a psychological profile of the borrowers and rates them according to their evaluated ability to repay debt.

Our algorithms have devised a scale of credit scores that allows lenders to choose the recipient of the loan, assuring the lender that the loan is going to families that genuinely intend and are able to repay them.        

The higher the credit score of an applicant, the higher the likelihood the applicant will repay their debts and loans.

THE OFFER WALL INTERFACE

To enhance a borrower's ability to adhere to the payment schedule, we at WalletBoss developed and integrated an interface that allows users to actually earn money on the platform and aiding in the search for additional financing sources and income. By watching short films, playing games, answering surveys, filling in questionnaires and downloading apps, the borrower generates an additional income that can help repay some of the loan, if not all of it. We call it the OfferWall. It is a kind of rewarding advertising.           

Money earned in the Offer Wall gets credited directly to the Digital Wallet and can be used to repay the loan.

THE BIOMETRIC INTERFACE

Biometric identification decreases and even eliminates the phenomenon of fake identities, which borrowers might create in order to receive multiple loans.

Biometric identification allows for a more comprehensive identification of borrowers, first when the loan is requested, and again once it's released and realized. The biometric recognition is via face and voice.

THE CHAT INTERFACE

To increase the visibility of your loan's actual impact, the app includes a chat interface for direct dialogue between lenders and borrowers, allowing for direct communication with the recipient of the loan, and measure the impact of the loan on an ongoing basis.

If you have multiple recipients, you will be able to create your own personal social circle and become part of a larger family than you could ever imagine.

WE NEED YOU TO HELP US SPREAD THE WORD

Please help us to validate our model by spreading the word among your contacts. This could increase our chances of success, and reach our goals. Remember, for the price of a few cups of coffee, you can help a family in the less developed world get back on track and make an honorable living.

Show us you care, by inviting your contacts on Facebook, Twitter, Whatsapp and other social platforms. We can only do this together, with your help!

Sincerely yours,

Mario, Nurit & Yatir

 

FOR DIRECT CONTACT:

Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions you may have. And don’t forget to share our cause.

We are thankful for your help to make our passion come true.

fatelevich@gmail.com

+972549742750

Or you may add +972549742750 to your WalletBoss chat.
