story:
THIS IS THE PROBLEM

“When living in unsuitable housing people become depressed, quality of life is significantly reduced, physical health is put at risk, relationships with friends and family break down, and thoughts of suicide are fostered” (Aspire 2016)

  • 330,000 accessible homes are required to meet current demand (Leonard Cheshire)
  • There are 1.2 million wheelchair users in the UK today (NHS)
  • Wheelchair users are 4x more likely to be employed when living in an accessible home (Aspire)
  • Someone is paralysed with a spinal cord injury every 8 hours (Aspire)

Living in an inaccessible home may mean wheelchair users are unable to bathe themselves at home, are reliant on a carer when they may not need to be, are unable to leave one or two rooms of the house, and are often unable to leave the house at all.

This means they can’t work, have a high rate of family breakdown because of the pressures they face, have much, much higher home bills and medical equipment costs than they would otherwise. All this brings radical financial and emotional distress. Simply because they don't live in a suitable home.

COMMUNITY SPONSORS HOMES HAS THE SOLUTION

Community Sponsors Homes will help wheelchair users to live independent lives by providing accessible properties to let on the mainstream market.

This will provide wheelchair users suitable homes. As well as show landlords that they can rent wheelchair accessible properties. As such we will transform the wheelchair accessible housing market.

In the future we plan to pilot a new method of providing subsidised rent, as well as a way of rewarding residents with shares in the property. 

We are an innovative social initiative, and the first to be devoted to this issue.

Diane Wallace Scarlet & Mik Scarlet

 

WE'RE READY - PLEASE HELP US TO GET STARTED

By donating to this social initiative, your money will be used to fund the development of the project, including all related research, design and development costs.  

Donate to us today and you will be helping to make a long-lasting impact on the lives of wheelchair users.

 

OUR GOAL IS TO RAISE £30,000

 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? PERKS!

We want to reward you for supporting Community Sponsors Homes. Check out the different perk levels, ranging from £1 to £5,000 on the right hand side of your screen.

Pledge £1 and you will have helped a wheelchair user in the UK to lead a better life in an accessible home. Thank you for supporting such a great project!

Pledge £10 and you will receive a shout-out on our Facebook and Twitter accounts thanking you for your help.  

To see the benefit of this reward please follow us on Facebook and Twitter:

Pledge £25 and your name will be listed on our website www.csh.org.uk thanking you for donating to Community Sponsors Homes.

PLUS

You will receive a thank you shout-out on our Facebook and Twitter accounts.

Pledge £50 and you will receive a personalised video from the team at Community Sponsors Homes thanking you for your generosity. 

PLUS

You will also receive a thank you shout-out on our Facebook and Twitter accounts AND your name will be listed on our website www.csh.org.uk.

Pledge £100 and you will receive a complimentary copy of our exclusive limited edition book ‘Community Sponsors Homes Moving Forward ….. the journey to provide wheelchair accessible homes.” AND your name will be listed in the book.

This commemorative limited edition book will chronicle the journey that Community Sponsors Homes and all their supporters have been on to provide accessible homes for wheelchair users. It will undoubtedly be a real keepsake for your home or office. Show your friends, colleagues, and family how your contribution to Community Sponsors Homes has helped to transform the lives of wheelchair users and their families.

PLUS

You will also receive a thank you shout-out on our Facebook and Twitter accounts AND your name will be listed on our website www.csh.org.uk.

Pledge £500 and you will receive a dedicated & bespoke page about yourself or your company in your copy of the Community Sponsors Homes exclusive limited edition book AND your name will be listed in the book.

PLUS

Your name will also be recorded as a ‘substantial donor’ on our Facebook and Twitter accounts and on our website www.csh.org.uk.

Pledge £1000 and your copy of the Community Sponsors Homes limited edition book will be personalised with your company logo or a quotation of your choice on the front cover. We will also include a dedicated bespoke page about yourself or your company.

PLUS

You will also receive a V.I.P. invite to our next high profile event where you will meet wheelchair user advocates, property experts, social impact investors and supporters of the Community Sponsors Homes initiative.

PLUS

Your name will also be recorded as a ‘substantial donor’ on our Facebook and Twitter accounts and on our website www.csh.org.uk.

Pledge £5000 and we will give you the opportunity to name your very own CSH house. Ever wanted someone to live in a house with your name on it? Now you have the opportunity, you can name one of our accessible homes to show the world how much of an impact you’ve had in improving the lives of wheelchair users. We can arrange a photo with you at the house, and can help with marketing materials for you to share this memento with your network.

PLUS

Enjoy lunch with the founders of Community Sponsors Homes Eleanor Bowden and David Toplas.

PLUS

You will be invited to spend a day with the Community Sponsors Homes team and to meet the resident that you have helped in providing a wheelchair accessible home.

PLUS

You will also receive a V.I.P. invite to our next high profile event where you will meet wheelchair user advocates, property experts, social impact investors and supporters of the Community Sponsors Homes initiative.

PLUS

Your name will also be recorded as a substantial donor on our Facebook and Twitter accounts and on our website www.csh.org.uk.

 

HELP US TO REAP THE BENEFIT OF GIFT AID

We are able to claim Gift Aid on donations made by UK tax payers which adds 25% on to your donation at no cost to you. We will be in touch to find out if you are eligible and, if so, we will ask you to complete a Gift Aid form.

 

WHO IS LEADING COMMUNITY SPONSORS HOMES?

Community Sponsors Homes is a collaborative project founded by two entrepreneurs who have a history of dedication to sustainable social business projects.  

Eleanor Bowden is a responsible business expert who is serial social entrepreneur. Eleanor specialises in innovative business solutions and creating affordable housing at scale.  

David Toplas is a leading property finance expert. David is the Chief Executive of Mill Group, which offers investors innovative and socially responsible investment opportunities.

 

Together Eleanor and David have over 40 years’ experience in their  respective industries. They are well positioned to lead Community  Sponsors Homes and provide accessible homes for wheelchair  users in the UK.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Our key challenge is knowing our customer. There is a lack of research providing specific data about wheelchair users, locations, and private rental housing needs etc. This presents a significant challenge for us in being able to help those that most need our help. We are currently working with charities such as Aspire (https://www.aspire.org.uk) to assist us in collating this valuable information. 

To help us overcome this key risk we are supported by expert input from wheelchair users and their advocates. These include Mike Mackenzie, Chairman of the Poppa Guttman Trust (http://www.poppaguttmanncelebration.org), and Aspire (https://www.aspire.org.uk), the UK’s leading spinal cord injury charity providing short term rental accommodation.

 

WE NEED YOU TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT FOR COMMUNITY SPONSORS HOMES

Crowdfunding on Indiegogo is a great way to begin our movement. Everyone who donates, no matter how much or how little, is important to us. If you can't contribute to our campaign, you can still be a part of the movement to provide wheelchair accessible homes by:

  • Sharing this fundraiser with friends and family. Use the share tools at the top right corner of this page
  • Sharing by word of mouth
  • Joining and supporting our Facebook and Twitter pages

Community Sponsors Homes is an initiative of Community Sponsors Charity (registered charity number 1117391). By donating to this initiative, your money will be first used to fund the development of the Initiative, including all related research, design and development costs and is then intended to be directly or indirectly invested in accessible property. However, please note that Community Sponsors Charity reserves the right to use any funds donated for its general charitable purpose.

story:
We need your help to make healthy food a right for all! Your generous donations will benefit The Real Dill's Charitable Partner, The GrowHaus, in the following ways:

  • $25 provides one week of emergency food staples for a family of two 
  • $50 provides one week of emergency food staples for a family of four 
  • $100 provides one week of emergency food staples for two families of four 
  • $250 provides one week of emergency food staples for five families of four
  • $500 provides one week of emergency food packages for ten families of four

100% of proceeds will benefit The GrowHaus, and The Real Dill is matching up to $10,000 in donations!

Virtual Pickle Party 2020

Every year, The Real Dill has the pleasure of hosting a Pickle Party at our facility, The Dillery, to raise money for our Charitable Partner, The GrowHaus. It's an amazing fundraising event, which draws in a crowd of over 600 people and brings in over $10,000 in donations. It's a one-of-a-kind experience built around celebrating our community for a great cause. We bring in local vendors who serve creative, collaborative cocktails, cider, beer, and Bloody Marys, as well as Plinko, food trucks, live music, lots of pickles, and a fan-favorite spicy pickle eating contest.

We were devastated that we had to cancel our Pickle Party this year due to the pandemic. However, we knew that we had to come up with an alternative plan to bring everyone together in the spirit of community to raise money for The GrowHaus and to support their work of ensuring lasting access to healthy food. And so, our Virtual Pickle Party Fundraiser 2020 was born!

The structure of our Pickle Party looks different from years past, yet our goal remains the same: bring together our community for a great cause! If you're anything like us, you're craving human connection and fun experiences more than ever. We really miss being around our community since we have all been separated for many months. 

The Virtual Pickle Party is the perfect way to come together when we all need it most and make a huge impact for all stakeholders in our community by supporting small businesses, supporting The GrowHaus, and supporting each other! Plus, The Real Dill will match up $10,000 in total donations to benefit this important cause.

We know that we can make a huge difference through this fundraiser, and we appreciate each and everyone one of you and all that you do for us and our community. We miss you, and we look forward to the days when we can party the night away with you again!

The GrowHaus Story

The mission of The GrowHaus is to cultivate community-driven food justice through education and food access. They offer food distribution programming and educational opportunities related to growing and cooking food, as well as overall wellness. The organization serves the Globeville and Elyria-Swansea (GES) neighborhoods, two vibrant neighborhoods in North Denver, rich in culture and tradition. However, residents of GES face barriers to living a healthy lifestyle. There is not one full service grocery store for the 10,000 residents living in GES. Additionally, the heavily industrious neighborhood has been deemed one of the most polluted zip codes in the country. However, residents of Globeville and Elyria-Swansea are incredibly resilient and passionate about supporting their neighbors and ensuring healthy food access.  

The GrowHaus strives to be a community-driven organization, meaning that their goal is to have all programs led and implemented by members of their community or others from similar neighborhoods. They are successful when the youth, families, and communities that they work with are empowered to feed, nourish and strengthen themselves and each other.

The GrowHaus and COVID-19

At their core, The GrowHaus is committed to ensuring healthy food access in Globeville and Elyria-Swansea. In response to the COVID-19 crisis outbreak, The GrowHaus has taken several steps to support residents of GES, ensuring that they are receiving food and have information and resources to support themselves in this difficult moment. At the best of times, accessing food -- especially healthy food -- is difficult for their community. The necessity of social distancing, economic disruption, and health risks make this moment especially challenging. The GrowHaus is acting quickly to overcome these barriers.

At the onset of COVID-19, The GrowHaus launched an emergency food distribution program to support residents. Emergency food packages include a a bag of fresh produce as well as a bag of dry food staples. The GrowHaus has been distributing these food packages every week to over 550 families, providing 2,550 kids and adults with nourishment and comfort. In total, The GrowHaus has distributed the equivalent of over 356,000 free meals. 

Additionally, The GrowHaus is supporting families in Globeville and Elyria-Swansea with classes for adults and at-home learning kits for kids. Classes for adults are all held outdoors, with appropriate safety precautions, and focus on overall wellness, in addition to nutrition. In the midst of COVID-19, our team has also been distributing at-home learning kits to families with kids that provide interactive activities for kiddos to learn about healthy food. 

What We Need 

The GrowHaus needs additional funds to continue providing emergency food to families in the Globeville and Elyria-Swansea community. Please consider making a donation to support their important work, especially during the pandemic, when ensuring rapid response to those in need is more crucial than ever. The Real Dill will be matching all donations up to $10,000 to show our support and solidarity.

Our goal is to raise $15,000 for The GrowHaus, which is more than we ever have in the past. We are counting on our amazing community to rally together and make this our biggest and best fundraiser to date by collecting as many donations as possible. Every dollar helps!

We also reached out to some of our favorite partners to bring you incredible rewards that can be enjoyed locally and virtually. Make a generous donation in exchange for perks such as gift cards, gift packs, tickets to virtual classes, and more. All rewards are priced at double the value of the reward to maximize our fundraising efforts. Once you have claimed your reward, we will contact you to coordinate pickup (either at a physical location or virtually). 

If you have a few dollars to spare, you also have the option of donating without receiving a perk.

Thank you to our incredible partners for your generous donations!

  • 4 Noses Brewing Co.
  • Acreage
  • Baere Brewing Co.
  • Bear Creek Distillery
  • Betterish
  • Bolder Beans
  • Broadway Market
  • Crooked Stave
  • Graze & Provisions
  • Edwards Meats
  • Jojo's Sriracha
  • Odell Brewing Co.
  • Oogie's Snacks
  • PB Love Co.
  • Polidori Sausage
  • Queen City Coffee Collective
  • Ratio Beerworks
  • Rebel Bread
  • Red Camper
  • Savory Spice Shop
  • Seattle Fish Co.
  • Snooze an A.M. Eatery
  • Spangalang Brewing
  • Stanley Marketplace
  • Stanley Beer Hall
  • Stem Ciders
  • Strongwater
  • Teakoe Tea
  • The Spicy Guy Co.

The Impact

  • $25 provides one week of emergency food staples for a family of two 
  • $50 provides one week of emergency food staples for a family of four 
  • $100 provides one week of emergency food staples for two families of four 
  • $250 provides one week of emergency food staples for five families of four
  • $500 provides one week of emergency food packages for ten families of four
  • $5,000 of The Real Dill's $10,000 matching contribution will benefit The GrowHaus' Harvest Week

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow The GrowHaus on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram
  • Sign up for The GrowHaus' mailing list
  • Learn more on The GrowHaus website
  • Sign up to purchase a food box from The GrowHaus!

story:
Fixing a Problem: The People's Legal Café

Life happens. Contracts, divorce, wills, probate court. But what happens if you can’t afford a lawyer? Do you know the law well enough to represent yourself in the complex world of legal matters? For many Canadians, legal representation is just too expensive, and legal information is too hard to find or too complex to fully understand.

 

Innovative Solution

The nonprofit Canadian Rights and Freedoms Centre, partnering with three Nova Scotian regional public library systems, has developed an innovative solution - affordable legal assistance for those who wish to represent themselves in civil and family matters.

 

                                                       

 

The People's Legal Cafe as a Social Enterprise

The People’s Legal Café, founded by the Canadian Rights and Freedoms Centre, is a social enterprise that will provide affordable and simplified legal services. Surpluses generated by the Legal Cafés will flow back to the People’s Legal Café, Canadian Rights and Freedoms Centre and the partnering public libraries to help the social good.

 

Friends of Democracy: Public Libraries

Libraries actively support literacy and computer skills. A perfect fit for the People's Legal Café! The Canadian Rights and Freedoms Centre has been working in partnership with the Pictou-Antigonish Regional Library, the Public Library of Colchester- East Hants and the Cumberland Public Libraries since 2017 developing the components of the website and fundraising. The Legal Café  will have their storefronts in the public libraries.

 

Making Life Simple: The Legal Café Website

You will go to the website. Answer some questionnaires and the forms are completed for you! People's Legal Café paralegals and lawyers will provide in-person or telephone support to review the completed court forms produced on the website.

 

Legal Fees or Maybe Not

Then review your forms with a People's Legal Café paralegal or lawyer before filing them with the court. Fees are on a sliding scale – users pay based on level of income. For users with low income, services are free.

 

                                                      

               

 

A Collaborative, Respectful Legal Culture

The goal of the People's Legal Café is to support customers to legally respond in ways that are  effective, respectful and collaborative. Legal Café lawyers assist customers to represent themselves in legal matters;  to resolve their own conflicts. Customers learn to communicate in ways that de-escalate their conflict.

 

 

We’ve already started!

We’ve already started! We’ve raised over $20,000 for this project, and development is underway on the family court forms  and the People's Legal Café website. We’ll be ready to launch a Beta version of the website in the summer of 2019.

 

Short term goal

We want to raise $5000 to hire a summer student to apply for grants to continue creating the People's Legal Café website. Any extra funds raised by this campaign will allow us to engage an IT summer student to assist with the website design and implementation. 

 

                                                     

 

JESS SIMM, student at University of Kings College, Halifax, Nova Scotia, will be hired with the funds raised from this Indiegogo Campaign.  Jess volunteered and helped us set up this Indiegogo website for the Centre.

Then What?

Jess Simm, our summer student, will be responsible for completing grant applications for the project and organizing other fundraising activities. Ultimately, completing the online application for the People's Legal Café will cost approximately $150,000.  

 

Who we are

The Canadian Rights and Freedoms Centre has no paid staff other than our summer students. We are a band of volunteers who believe in the power of a good idea to make positive change. Here are some of our our board members and other volunteers:

 

RALPH MARTIN (President), raised on a Mennonite farm, is the founder of the Organic Agriculture Centre of Canada and is a Professor and  former Loblaw Chair in Sustainable Food Production at University of Guelph. He has also been trained in peacemaking circles by Kay Pranis.  

                                                      

 

 

MICHAEL BEALS (Vice-president) is a poet and a student at Dalhousie University, majoring in journalism and psychology. He is also a second class certified stationary engineer and sings in the choir of his church. He is passionate about restorative justice, and upholding the common humanity that unites us.

                                                    

 

 

JOY D. CALLAHAN (Corporate Secretary), our quintessential soccer mom, is the winner of Sport Nova Scotia Ricoh Awards for Volunteer of the Year - Soccer. While her son played elite Soccer with the provincial team and at high school Division 1, she managed 10 provincial teams for Soccer Nova Scotia. She now turns her interest to access for justice in the family courts.

 

                                                     

 

 

MYRA LUCIA (Treasurer) lives in Middle Sackville, Nova Scotia and has worked in the banking Industry for 21 years. She believes in community, giving back and being a global citizen through her volunteer work with organizations such CISV and Inspiring HOPE.

 

 

 

BIBHAS VASE (Board Member) hails originally from the fair island of Newfoundland. He is a criminal defence attorney currently working in British Columbia on prison justice and civil forfeiture cases. He is passionate about protecting human rights, large and small, including the corrosive incremental erosion that can happen through legal bureaucratic action and inaction. 

 

 

LISA TERYL is senior legal counsel with Teryl Scott Lawyers Inc. and a human rights attorney. She is contracted by the Centre to supervise the implementation of the People's Legal Café. She authored the book Nova Scotia Law: Everything You Wanted To Know But Couldn’t Afford To Ask (Pottersfield, 2002). In 2015, Lisa was an honoree at an Extraordinary Alumnae lunch, Schulich School of Law at Dalhousie University, Halifax, Nova Scotia. 

 

 

External Support

Supporters of the People's Legal Café include:

  • Associate Chief Justice, Nova Scotia Supreme Court, Family Division, Lawrence l. O’Neil
  • Former Chief Justice of Nova Scotia, Michael MacDonald
  • Dalhousie Legal Aid Service
  • Osgoode Hall Law School, York University
  • Schulich School of Law, Dalhousie University
  • @Nova Scotia Community Technology
  • Teryl Scott Lawyers Inc.
  • Brookshire Law Office
  • Be the Peace Institute
  • Nova Scotia Barristers Society
  • Texas Bar and Grill Singers (allowing us to use our campaign video's "I'm Billing Time" song: www.thebarandgrillsingers.com)

 

Show the Love...

Providing legal services that are collaborative, affordable, just and sustainable is a huge undertaking! Here are some ways you can show your support for the People’s Legal Café:

  • Make a contribution: Donate what you can to help us reach our funding goal!
  • Share: Get the word out about our project and help others get involved by sharing our campaign on social media.          

Play Ball!

With your support, we can equalize the justice playing field for all Canadians, starting in Nova Scotia. The People’s Legal Café - fair access to affordable, simplified legal services through our public libraries.

Please donate today if you can!

story:
Hello there,

I am Gokalp from Turkey, as a 30 years old Master's degree holder, I have been working for over 6 years.

Now I am asked to join to army for 5 months unpaid or 15 months paid by 300$/month no matter if I will lose my job or be unable to my debts during that period without earning a dime.

If one wants to shorten my mandatory service to 1 month, I am asked to pay 2500$/person to the government.

Notice that minimum wage in Turkey is 200$/month meaning one has to survive for one year on oxygen only to pay off his freedom. Please consider there are already 350.000 people applied for shortening their military service and at least twice as much could not due to financial crisis in Turkey which caused devaluation of  our currency by 70% in one year.

As an anti-war person, I do not want to go to army for a second but it is MANDATORY, so I have to collect the amount to pay off my freedom.

My target is to save as many anti-war people as possible, thus any additional donation will be used for other people as me and proved and shared through official documents incl. bank invoice and official application forms, finally a thank you note signed by the person saved by your donations.

Thank you a lot for supporting us.
Gokalp

story:
Why I reach out to you:

Thank you for showing up! The Lebanese LGBTIQ community is facing a humanitarian crisis amplified by COVID-19 and we’d like to reach out to all of you to support members of our community that are unable to pay their food, rent, and other basic needs. Let’s come together and counter this economical and health crisis with solidarity and action. We’d like to invite you to support the LGBTIQ community in Lebanon with a small donation and this is why:

While everybody (who can) is struggling to stay at home during this pandemic and maybe even suffering mentally, members of the LGBTIQ community are facing even increased hardships: Due to the economical crisis that is hitting Lebanon, thousands have lost their jobs during the recent months. In a country that systemically represses and discriminates LGBTIQ people, an own livelihood meant a scale of independence from discrimination and rejection of families. Being lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender is criminalized per law in Lebanon which punishes „unnatural sexual intercourse“. Prior to the lockdown, community centers and organizations provided vital services that became unaccessible with Covid-19 during the past weeks. Having nowhere else to turn now, some LGBTIQ folks are forced to decide between returning to their families and risking rejection and domestic violence or struggling on their own and becoming homeless, not being able to pay for their basics like food, rent, and medicine - all exacerbated by a skyrocketing inflation.

 

How your donation will help:

The Lebanese NGO Helem advocates for the rights of LGBTIQ people across the Arab World and is currently engaged in providing the most basic needs. However, with funding running out for many organizations worldwide, Helem is struggling to continue their vital services. Yet, the calls for help that the NGO received from members of the LGBTIQ community in Lebanon have more than doubled in the past months.

​Every 10 USD will contribute to providing food and/or medicine for an individual for up to two months. 

With this small donation you will contribute to a direct relief for individuals who will receive food, medication, and/or emergency health interventions.  We are in this together, but we don’t have equal access to resources and support networks. Even the smallest amounts will help, for in solidarity we shall get through this crisis.

None of the people managing this emergency fund (and none of their household members), nor NGO employees will receive any money from this emergency fund. ​All funds will go directly to relief efforts. Helem will provide a full financial and narrative report to any and all donors with receipts and verification. Together we will keep you updated about where exactly your money goes.

If you prefer to donate offline, please send a direct message, so we can provide you with all the details. Thank you!

For any questions about the campaign or any questions about Helem, please contact us here below.

Thank you everyone and please stay safe and healthy!

story:
Represent your Historically Black College and University and Help Prepare 300 Care Packages for Homeless Families.

Join the National Black United Front, HBCU Alum and current HBCU Students as we prepare 300 care packages for homeless women and their families at the Harriet Tubman Women’s Shelter.

Let’s show the DMV Community what HBCU pride and values are all about, by giving back to the community.

Volunteers are asked to donate $10 towards the preparation of the care packages.


Questions That Need Answers:

What should I wear?
Wear attire that represents an HBCU or you can cop the signature #FeedTheHood Shirt

How do I get there?
You can drive and there is free parking in the parking lot or on the street
The closest metro stop is Anacostia. From there you can ride share or take the W8 bus to Martha’s Table.

What should I bring?
You can make a donation or you can bring some of the following items:

Baby Powder
Toothbrushes
Toothpaste
Lotion
Female Deodorant
Bars of Soap
Feminine Hygiene Products
Washcloths
Shampoo
Shower
Socks

story:
Unbelievable Tragedy has Hummelstown, Pennsylvania. Officer LISA MEARKLE has shot and killed unarmed man DAVID KASSICK. As many people from the Hummelstown area have noted, this police officer has been known to harass and otherwise abuse her authority imposing upon the residents of Hummelstown.

An innocent family like yours or mine has had a loved one taken away for answers that leave many doubts. This happened in their own backyard, this is OUR backyard. Enough is Enough! The time to act is now!

If you live in Hummelstown and you would like to make your testimony against the corrupted Officer Lisa Mearkle, please pm this page or if you would like to make it heard and known post on the wall.

We will do our best as one to ensure that justice is found. EVERYBODY GET IN HERE. DO WHAT IS RIGHT.



ALL FUNDS WILL GO TO THE FAMILY OF DAVID KASSICK.  THANK YOU.

story:
Aerial Lab came into being in 2009 through the efforts of Dr.Prasatporn Wongkamchang. The lab has cooperated with KCR Flying Camera Team which is the most famous aerial photography in Thailand to conduct research in robotics and unmanned aerial systems(UAS).

Since 2013,  KCR Team has joined with CH. Karnchang(Lao) Public Company Limited and KCR team have so many drone flights in Laos. After that, KCR Team realizes UXO is a huge problem that Lao people suffer for more than 40 years.  

From this problem, Aerial Lab and KCR begin to start a project to do a research in the sensor unexploded ordnance (UXO) detection system for unmanned aerial systems(UAS).

 

 

Thailand and Laos have had bilateral relations for the most part of history. We share a common border and both states have an interest in making the Mekong River a "river of true peace and friendship".

By our relations, we create many mega projects together and the Xayaburi Hydroelectric Power Project (XHPP) is one of the mega project that is a construction of weir on Mekong River in order to rise up the water level without water diversion from Mekong River

As our team have joined the Xayaburi Hydroelectric Power Project (XHPP) in Laos, we have opportunities to connect with local people in villages and we have seen the difficult way of life in landmine along UAVs operations. Moreover, we realize that they have suffered from UXO (unexploded ordnance) and there are a lot of problems in their living lives.

Communication

We can communicate well with Lao people, because Thai language is similar to Lao language, We can also understand how they suffer from UXO by our deep heart. Besides, some local people ask us to help them as innocent eyes with hopes after they saw our UAVs flight over their areas.

Now we yearn for to help them as our UXO Drone project, we start to survey in local area and plan to expand landmine as much as we can.

 

Stretch Goals

Help us for humanities and expand across Laos.

 

For a Pilot Phase

 

Digital Journal

http://www.digitaljournal.com/pr/3215869

The Laotian Times

http://www.laotiantimes.com/2017/01/28/innovati...

Release Wire

http://www.releasewire.com/press-releases/intro...

 

Aerial Lab and KCR Flying Camera Team is an organization which runs an unmanned aerial systems (UAS) operator since 2008 in Thailand. Through over 10,000 hours of total flight time, our team have various experiences in UAS such as high-altitude balloons, fixed wings and multicoppers. We also cooperate with RTAF (The Royal Thai Airforce) in many UAS projects that make us gain much experience with a strong team.

Since 2013, our team have chances to join Xayaburi Hydroelectric Power Project (XHPP) in Laos. This project is conducted by CH. Karnchang(Lao) Public Company Limited that has the purpose of establishment to execute the mega project construction in Laos.

 

Why do our team start UXO Drone Project in Lao?
1.    Lao is a small developing country is the heavily bomb in the world that they are suffer more than 40 years. 
2.    Lao need natural secured land back in order to harvest and develop to agriculture for their lives
3.    We have drone flights for 4 years in Laos, so we are so much familiar with Lao people and geography. Besides, We can also communicate to local people, Lao government, Lao EOD with smooth progress because we have a similar language.
4.    It is convenience to travel to Lao in many routes as Thailand and Lao share border along Mekong river. 

Why do UXO Drone will give more effective solution?

The current systems are operated by humans and use animals. It is dangerous and takes a risk. UXO Drone will help the systems faster and safer for humans and animals.

Why do we need multispectral sensors for UXO Drone in the third phase?

We need multispectral sensors for the advance step as the multispectral camera has potential to collect data across the electromagnetic spectrum. Usually it includes light that is visible and invisible to the human eye. Through the using of filters (3-6 filters), multispectral sensors capture, within broad and separate bands, the light reflected off the surface of vegetation and other objects. Given that not all objects absorb light the same way or absorb it differently under certain conditions, the amount of light they reflect, known as their spectral signature. So we can distinguish UXO from others.

Why do we need Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) Technology for UXO Drone in the forth phase?

In the hardest situation of UXO, it is very hard to detect it by usual way. SAR is a high technology that can solve this problem, because SAR give us precisely data, high-resolution images of objects and terrain. SAR systems can effectively operate during the day, at night, and in low-visibility conditions such as clouds, fog, smoke, and precipitation it can attach to UXO Drone (quadcopter) with a light weight.

http://www.imsar.com/pages/capabilities/sar.php

Are we going to remove UXO by this drone?

We will not be removing or triggering any unexploded ordnance (UXO) with this platform. This unmanned aerial system will only be used to map and identify the impact craters from unexploded ordnance (UXO).

Do our team need permission from local authorities to fly UXO drone?

Yes. in the areas where we will fly to start a pilot project all required approvals from Lao government

Why does UXO Drone pilot project is set up?

It is essential to prove to Lao government that UXO Drone as a new technology can give the a better solution.

As a big area of landmine and lots of tons of unexploded ordnance (UXO), we need your support to set up an expertise team and further research and development of UXO Drone. In a pilot phase, we will use UXO Drone that we have developed as a prototype in Luangprabang province which has the UXO visit center that we can contact.  We will map, analyze and summarize all data in different conditions that take places. After that we will work with Laos’ EOD to plan in removing unexploded ordnance (UXO).

story:
Click Here for English

 En breve

FM ALAS es una Radio Comunitaria de la Patagonia sostenida de manera participativa desde hace 30 años.

Nos hemos convertido en un actor preponderante de la identidad regional así como un medio confiable en el que circulan las voces de la comunidad.

Somos también un factor escencial en los procesos sociales y la defensa de los Derechos Humanos y de la Naturaleza.

Somos una organización horizontal, no jerárquica, sin fines de lucro, y en este momento todos y todas aportamos nuestro trabajo ad honorem. Somos una radio autónoma, apartidaria, autogestiva, autocrítica, solidaria, laica y pluricultural. Hoy somos una de las radios más escuchadas de nuestro pueblo, El Bolsón, de una injerencia a la par con la radio estatal y las comerciales.

El nido propio, $89,100 por la 89.1 MHz

La casa que alquilamos hace 2 décadas está en venta. Antes de fin de año la tenemos que comprar, o en su defecto comprar otro lugar y construir nuestra radio. De cualquier modo, el tiempo apremia y necesitamos la ayuda de todos y todas. Cualquier aporte, del monto que sea, es una ramita de nuestro nido, del nido de toda la comuniad. Todo lo recaudado va directamente a la compra de esta casa, o en el caso de comprar otro lugar, a comprarlo y realizar la mudanza.

Quienes somos

Cuando la mediatización constante sigue acelerando y se pierde la referencia de qué es confiable, sabemos que podemos confiar en nuestras radios comunitarias porque son nuestras. FM ALAS no tiene oyentes sino radioparticipantes. Nos conocemos, nos relacionamos, y no hay límite entre quién habla y quien escucha porque todos y todas podemos hacer las dos cosas. En nuestra zona el internet todavía no está al alcance de todos (sobre todo en la población rural) y la radio sigue siendo el medio preferido de mucha gente para enterarse de lo que necesita saber.

Sostenemos una defensa irrestricta de los derechos humanos y de los bienes comunes. Y ante todo hacemos posible que las voces que no aparecen en los medios comerciales y estatales salgan al aire. En ALAS hacen programas:

  • las asambleas socioambientales
  • los usuarios del servicio de salud mental del hospital
  • las organizaciones de derechos humanos
  • las comunidades mapuches
  • colectivos feministas y por la diversidad sexual
  • estudiantes secundarios y universitarios
  • agricultores familiares
  • personas con discapacidad
  • los niños y las niñas
  • los adultos mayores
  • conjuntos de músicos locales, y muchísimos más.

 

Pero no sólo jugamos a hacer radio. Nos encargamos también producir periodismo de calidad que disputa un territorio en el debate público, sobre todo cuando los medios dominantes esquivan las problemáticas de la población.

Por eso en los últimos años FM ALAS ha sido un nexo crucial para un sinfín de movimientos sociales en nuestra región, como para nombrar sólo algunos:

  • Resistencias a proyectos megamineros que amenazan nuestras tierras y fuentes de agua
  • Resistencias al gatillo fácil, los abusos policiales y la desaparición de personas
  • Ni una menos, movimiento en contra de la violencia machista
  • Reivindicaciones del pueblo mapuche, y sus recuperaciones territoriales
  • Resistencias a megaloteos y corrupción en el manejo de tierras públicas
  • Reclamos por el libre acceso a los lagos y los ríos
  • Reclamos por los derechos de los/las estudiantes

En varias ocasiones, cuando sucesos de nuestra región trascendieron a nivel nacional o internacional, muchísimos medios de diversos lugares han recurrido a FM ALAS para saber qué pasa en la zona y así nuestro trabajo periodístico llegó más allá de las fronteras regionales.

Apostamos al debate y la participación activa. Consultamos las diversas fuentes para llevar al aire distintas miradas sobre los hechos relevantes. Producimos recorriendo las calles y conscientes de ser parte de la comunidad que relatamos.

Somos miembros de la Asociación Mundial de Radios Comunitarias, con quien trabajamos en la producción de un programa informativo nacional. Además somos miembros fundadores de la red de la red de medios alternativos, comunitarios y populares “Enfoques”, que entrelaza doce medios de la Patagonia norte en un informativo regional y transmisiones especiales.

 

 

Cómo sostenemos nuestro trabajo

Sostenemos la radio principalmente a través del trabajo solidario en nuestro Salón de Usos Múltiples, donde hacemos funciones culturales de todo tipo (conciertos, teatro, talleres, charlas.) No sólo sostiene la radio económicamente sino que es una de las salas culturales principales de nuestro pueblo. Por el SUM pasan todos los artistas locales, y además invitamos a tocar en la Comarca a otros como Raly Barrionuevo, Chango Spasiuk, Arbolito, Falta y Resto, Yusa, María Creuza, Leo Masliah, Teresa Parodi, Baglietto y Vitale...

El SUM de ALAS albergó también a Eduardo Galeano, Berta Cáceres, Nora Cortiñas, y tantos otros que vinieron a aportar su palabra a nuestra comunidad. Además lo usamos para capacitar a todos y todas quienes quieran aprender a hacer radio, desde lo técnico hasta lo creativo y lo periodístico.

Ahí hacemos empanadas para las peñas con ingredientes que aportan radioparticipantes. Juntamos manzanas y las prensamos para tener jugo casero y natural en nuestro buffet. E infinitas cosas más que nos mantienen volando hace 30 años. No nos financia nadie, y logramos estar al aire todos los días de este modo cooperativo y solidario; sabemos muy bien realizar mucho con poquísimo dinero.

 

Los detalles:

Ahora ese trabajo que nos sostiene en el día a día ya no alcanza. Hoy para seguir haciendo que la comunicación sea un derecho al alcance de todos, necesitamos una casa propia. Nuestra sede actual que alquilamos está en venta. Con la ayuda solidaria de muchísima gente podremos comprarla para que no tenga dueño, para que las voces de todos y de todas vuelen libremente.

¿Porqué no seguir alquilando?

Como colectivo tomamos la decisión de comprar la casa y no intentar alquilar en otro lugar porque:

  • así la comunidad se asegura que su radio perdure en el tiempo
  • ya no somos sólo una radio, queremos seguir nuestro trabajo cultural en el SUM, lo cual no sería posible alquilando una construcción pequeña sólo para estudio de radio, y no hay disponibles salones con las características necesarias para que funcione nuestra sala
  • el alquiler se ha vuelto una tarea difícil de sostener, y sólo lo logramos gracias a pagar un monto bien por debajo del valor del mercado. Empezar a alquilar en un lugar nuevo tendría un costo excluyente para nosotros en lo cotidiano.
  • una radio y una sala requieren de una infraestructura importante, las mudanzas son difíciles y muy caras; hoy el mercado inmobiliario es muy volátil y no podemos arriesgar tener que seguir mudándonos según los azares del mercado

Con un empujón fuerte de todos y todas podemos llegar a hacer realidad nuestro sueño del nido propio. Si alcanzamos nuesta meta de US$89,100 que representa nuestra frecuencia de 89.1 MHz cubrimos el primer pago de la mitad del valor de la casa, y tendríamos 2 años más para pagar la otra mitad.

¿Hay un Plan B?

Si no recaudamos ese monto antes de fin de año, nuestra segunda opción es comprar otro terreno sin construir más económico y luego sumar lo necesario para la construcción de una nueva radio con su SUM. Es decir, aunque no alcanzamos ese primer objetivo, igual nos sirve. Y cuanto sea lo recaudado, habrá una segunda etapa de financiamiento, o para completar la compra de la casa o para construir el edificio nuevo. Tenemos muchas manos hábiles entre nosotros, tenemos la plena confianza de que la mano de obra será nuestra y sólo hará falta comprar los materiales.

Y tomen nota: la cifra que ven en esta página es sólo una parte de lo que recaudamos. Esta campaña sirve más que nada para los que están lejos. Ya la población local está aportando un montón directamente a la radio sin pasar por Indiegogo, por ende el número que ven aquí es en realidad más alto de lo que parece. Al momento de lanzar esto aquí, ya tenemos US$10,000 y seguiremos actualizando ese número también.

Si querés aportar y no podés a través de esta plataforma, visita nuestra página www.fmalas.org.ar donde figuran otras vías de contribución.

 

 

¿Qué recibís vos?

Respecto a las recompensas ("perks") lamentablemente no podemos enviar cosas físicas fuera del país, por eso nos hemos limitado principalmente a cosas no materiales y que invitan a que nos conectemos y nos conozcamos, no sólo intercambiar dinero y cosas.

El impacto de tu solidaridad

Sabemos que para muchos que leen estas palabras desde otras partes del mundo, la Patagonia es un paisaje lejano y desconocido con el que tal vez no tengan ninguna relación. Pero hoy en día es una de las fronteras donde la maquinaria de un sistema injusto que quiere devorar todo se choca con otro modo de imaginar al mundo. En ese frente estamos nosotros.

Aquí todavía hay más bosques que ciudades

más agricultura que monocultivos

más artesanos que centros comerciales

más ciclistas que semáforos

más encuentros que conectividad

más radioparticipantes que oyentes

Tu aporte solidario ayuda a que siga siendo así.  Que nuestro micrófono sigue al aire para quien lo necesite.

Otras formas de ayudar

Ayudanos a difundir esta campaña, con las herramientas de Indiegogo arriba, en tus redes sociales, por mail, por mensajito telefónico, hasta con tu boca! Te acordás cuando la gente hablaba con sus amigos en vez de sólo leer sus posteos? Nosotros seguimos apostando al poder de la voz humana. Comentale a tus amigos mientras patean una pelota o andan en bicicleta, mientras toman un mate en tu living o buscan a sus hijos en la escuela.

Es aún mejor si en vez de pasar sólo el link, agregás palabras tuyas explicando cómo nos conocés y porqué te parece valioso que ALAS tenga su nido.

 

Por cualquier consulta, escribir a

fmalaselbolson@gmail.com

Y no olvides de visitarnos en:

www.fmalas.org.ar

www.facebook.com/fmalas891

 

 

English

 

Who We Are

Where some think the internet democratized access to information, ALAS has been doing just that since 1987. As Argentina threw off its military dictatorship in the '80s, the need for community-based media became an imperative, and radio has long been the preferred way of staying informed here. Today, as the media landscape gets increasingly saturated and confusing, it gets even harder to know who to trust and what to believe. We know we can rely on our community radio stations because they're ours.

 

ALAS has no “listeners,” but rather radio-participants. Our sources are our community, our microphone is available for anyone who needs it, and over years of hard work we have earned a broad listenership and wide-ranging impact. We know each other, we relate to each other, and there is a healthy back-and-forth between those who speak and those who listen because all of us make sure to do both.

 

We don't run a radio to amplify our own voices and spread our own opinions, but rather to make sure others can do so, especially those who the mainstream media ignores. We tell stories no one else does.

We maintain an unconditional defense of human rights and of the commons, what others would call “natural resources,” too often pillaged from areas like ours that the powerful see as far-off colonies to be plundered.

 

On ALAS, there are programs produced by:

 

  • indigenous Mapuche communities
  • patients of the public mental health services
  • environmental justice assemblies
  • human rights organizations
  • high school and college students
  • feminist and LGBTQ collectives
  • family farmers and subsistence herders
  • people with disabilities
  • children and the elderly
  • local musicians
  • and many, many more

But we are not hobbyists just out to give everyone a chance to get their voice on the air. It is our mission to speak truth to power and to do quality, thoughtful journalism that stakes out territory in the public conversation, especially when powerful interests keep the mainstream media away from the real issues.

That's why in recent years ALAS has been a crucial piece of organizing myriad social movements in Patagonia, including (but by no means limited to):

 

  • resistance to large-scale open-pit mining projects that would destroy our water sources and landbase
  • resistance to police brutality and killings (particularly of young people) and forced disappearances
  • the nationwide “Ni una menos” campaign to combat violence against women
  • defense of indigenous land rights and even Mapuche communities reclaiming land stolen by foreign multinationals (link al video)
  • resistance to landgrabs and corrupt dealings on public lands
  • fighting for our constitutionally guaranteed access to all bodies of water, in our area flagrantly broken by multibillionaires like Joe Lewis or Ted Turner who have privatized public lakes and rivers
  • working on behalf of political prisoners and fighting abuses within the justice system

On many occasions, when events in our area draw national attention, many other media depend on ALAS as a trusted source to get the story out. Not just other community media like us, but also mainstream nationally syndicated newspapers, radio, and TV.

 

We aim to foment healthy debate, not ideological antagonism, and keep our eyes on the goal of finding shared means to ensure a healthy and just future for everyone, for coming generations and for the land we live on.

We are members of AMARC, the World Association of Community Radios, and along with the other AMARC member stations in Argentina, we produce a national weekly news service. We also are the founders and headquarters of “Enfoques”, a network of 10 community radios across Patagonia that join forces to produce a regional news bulletin, as well as frequent special transmissions that often share the airwaves of all 10 stations.

How We Stay on the Air

We cover our costs primarily through our cultural center, which not only sustains the radio station but is another pillar of our work in its own right.  We have live events on average 3 nights per week, from concerts and film screenings to theater, book presentations, talks and debates. Nearly every local artist plays shows on our stage, and we have also produced shows by well-known national and international performers such as Raly Barrionuevo, Chango Spasiuk, Arbolito, Leo Masliah, Teresa Parodi, Baglietto y Vitale, Falta y Resto (Uruguay), Yusa (Cuba), María Creuza (Brasil), Hernán Gamboa (Venezuela) ...

Our stage welcomed Eduardo Galeano, Nora Cortiñas, Berta Cáceres, and many other highly respected scholars and speakers.  We also run workshops to train people in all aspects of radio work, from technical operations to creative production and journalism.

We prepare food with ingredients donated by radioparticipants (what other stations might call "listeners"), and sell it at our events.  We gather apples in the fall and press pure apple cider, so we can sell healthy, natural foods we made ourselves at our buffet.  These and so many other things are what have kept us aloft for the last 30 years.  Nobody funds us, and we broadcast every day of the year thanks to cooperative solidarity; we are extremely good at achieving a lot with few material resources.

 

The Details: $89,100 for 89.1 MHz

The building we've been renting for the last 20 years has been put up for sale. To stay here, by the end of 2017 we need to buy it, or instead, buy a piece of land on which to build our definitive radio and cultural center. Either way, time is short and we need all the help we can get to achieve a permanent home. All funds collected will go directly to purchase either our current building or another piece of land for our future home.

 

Why not keep renting?

As a collective, we have made the decision to attempt to buy this building and not attempt to rent elsewhere because:

  • that way we are assured ALAS will continue into the future
  • we are not just a radio station, and our cultural center is a key part of our mission. there is nowhere to rent that would have the necessary infrastructure for that, and renting a small building for just a radio studio would mean losing half our mission
  • in recent years rent has skyrocketed and we are only barely able to keep up thanks to paying well below market rates. Beginning a new rental today would be so prohibitive as to shut us down.
  • a radio and a cultural center with a full stage are serious infrastructure; moving them is an enormous and very expensive task; we can't afford to risk having to move every few years at the whims of the rental market.

With one extra effort right now we can make our dream of a permanent home a reality. Our goal of $89,100 represents our broadcast frequency of 89.1 MHz, and also covers the down payment of half the price of this building (actually 90k, but close enough...)

Plan B

If we don't manage to collect that amount by the end of the year, our second option is to buy another plot of land in town with whatever funds we raise, and our second stage will gather the resources to build our new building, complete with radio and cultural center. That's why even if we don't reach our initial goal, it's still worthwhile and a huge step forward. And no matter what we collect, there will need to be a second phase of fundraising, either for future payments on our current building or for the materials to construct a new one.

Our community is full of skilled hands ready and willing to help, from architects and engineers to carpenters, masons, and painters. If we end up building from scratch we are fully confident that we can cover all labor costs through the solidarity we thrive on every day, and only materials will need to be purchased. Again, we really know how to make a little go a long way.

Also, take note: This Indiegogo campaign is only one part of our strategy. Our local community has already given us a push in direct contributions, futhermore, in Argentina electronic payments like this are not as common, and many people are using direct bank transfers to support us. This Indiegogo campaign is to reach people beyond our valley. The number you see above is much less than what we already have. As of campaign launch, when you see $0 above, we have already collected $10,000. We will keep you updated as our offline total also increases.

What you Get

Because we cannot ship physical objects overseas, we have made all of our perks immaterial things that connect you to us, not just exchanging money and goods.  You will also be a radioparticipant, and for the perks that involve actually calling you up on the air, this can happen in Spanish, English or French (and maybe Japanese, TBA)

 

Your Impact

We know many of you are reading this from other parts of the world, and Patagonia may seem like a far-off landscape you have no relationship to. But today it is one of the frontiers where an omnicidal system that tries to devour everything in its path bumps up against another world that is still possible, where land and life are not treated as merchandise. On those frontlines is where ALAS hoists its flag, right up our antenna and out over the airwaves. The world power centers treat places like Patagonia as a distant source of raw materials. But we live here.

As we said in our film,

Here there are still more forests than cities,

more agriculture than monocropping,

more artisans than shopping centers,

more cyclists than traffic lights,

more gatherings than “connectivity,”

more radio-participants than mere listeners.

Help us keep it this way.

 

Other Ways to Help

Spread the word.  Use all the tools Indiegogo provides to share this campaign, use your social media, your email, and even your mouth!  Remember back when people actually spoke to each other instead of just reading each others postings? Tell your friends about us while you throw a Frisbee or bike down the trail, while you chat over tea in your living room or babysit each other's children.

Contact like-minded media and put them in touch with us.  We love talking with other community-powered radios, TV stations, and newspapers even when we're not running this campaign.

And don't forget to visit us at:

www.fmalas.org.ar

www.facebook.com/fmalas891
story_txt:
Click Here for English 
 En breveFM ALAS es una Radio Comunitaria de la Patagonia sostenida de manera participativa desde hace 30 años.Nos hemos convertido en un actor preponderante de la identidad regional así como un medio confiable en el que circulan las voces de la comunidad.Somos también un factor escencial en los procesos sociales y la defensa de los Derechos Humanos y de la Naturaleza.Somos una organización horizontal, no jerárquica, sin fines de lucro, y en este momento todos y todas aportamos nuestro trabajo ad honorem. Somos una radio autónoma, apartidaria, autogestiva, autocrítica, solidaria, laica y pluricultural. Hoy somos una de las radios más escuchadas de nuestro pueblo, El Bolsón, de una injerencia a la par con la radio estatal y las comerciales.El nido propio, $89,100 por la 89.1 MHzLa casa que alquilamos hace 2 décadas está en venta. Antes de fin de año la tenemos que comprar, o en su defecto comprar otro lugar y construir nuestra radio. De cualquier modo, el tiempo apremia y necesitamos la ayuda de todos y todas. Cualquier aporte, del monto que sea, es una ramita de nuestro nido, del nido de toda la comuniad. Todo lo recaudado va directamente a la compra de esta casa, o en el caso de comprar otro lugar, a comprarlo y realizar la mudanza.
Quienes somosCuando la mediatización constante sigue acelerando y se pierde la referencia de qué es confiable, sabemos que podemos confiar en nuestras radios comunitarias porque son nuestras. FM ALAS no tiene oyentes sino radioparticipantes. Nos conocemos, nos relacionamos, y no hay límite entre quién habla y quien escucha porque todos y todas podemos hacer las dos cosas. En nuestra zona el internet todavía no está al alcance de todos (sobre todo en la población rural) y la radio sigue siendo el medio preferido de mucha gente para enterarse de lo que necesita saber.Sostenemos una defensa irrestricta de los derechos humanos y de los bienes comunes. Y ante todo hacemos posible que las voces que no aparecen en los medios comerciales y estatales salgan al aire. En ALAS hacen programas:
las asambleas socioambientales
los usuarios del servicio de salud mental del hospital
las organizaciones de derechos humanos
las comunidades mapuches
colectivos feministas y por la diversidad sexual
estudiantes secundarios y universitarios
agricultores familiares
personas con discapacidad
los niños y las niñas
los adultos mayores
conjuntos de músicos locales, y muchísimos más.
 Pero no sólo jugamos a hacer radio. Nos encargamos también producir periodismo de calidad que disputa un territorio en el debate público, sobre todo cuando los medios dominantes esquivan las problemáticas de la población.Por eso en los últimos años FM ALAS ha sido un nexo crucial para un sinfín de movimientos sociales en nuestra región, como para nombrar sólo algunos:
Resistencias a proyectos megamineros que amenazan nuestras tierras y fuentes de agua
Resistencias al gatillo fácil, los abusos policiales y la desaparición de personas

Ni una menos, movimiento en contra de la violencia machista
Reivindicaciones del pueblo mapuche, y sus recuperaciones territoriales
Resistencias a megaloteos y corrupción en el manejo de tierras públicas
Reclamos por el libre acceso a los lagos y los ríos
Reclamos por los derechos de los/las estudiantes
En varias ocasiones, cuando sucesos de nuestra región trascendieron a nivel nacional o internacional, muchísimos medios de diversos lugares han recurrido a FM ALAS para saber qué pasa en la zona y así nuestro trabajo periodístico llegó más allá de las fronteras regionales.Apostamos al debate y la participación activa. Consultamos las diversas fuentes para llevar al aire distintas miradas sobre los hechos relevantes. Producimos recorriendo las calles y conscientes de ser parte de la comunidad que relatamos.Somos miembros de la Asociación Mundial de Radios Comunitarias, con quien trabajamos en la producción de un programa informativo nacional. Además somos miembros fundadores de la red de la red de medios alternativos, comunitarios y populares “Enfoques”, que entrelaza doce medios de la Patagonia norte en un informativo regional y transmisiones especiales.  Cómo sostenemos nuestro trabajoSostenemos la radio principalmente a través del trabajo solidario en nuestro Salón de Usos Múltiples, donde hacemos funciones culturales de todo tipo (conciertos, teatro, talleres, charlas.) No sólo sostiene la radio económicamente sino que es una de las salas culturales principales de nuestro pueblo. Por el SUM pasan todos los artistas locales, y además invitamos a tocar en la Comarca a otros como Raly Barrionuevo, Chango Spasiuk, Arbolito, Falta y Resto, Yusa, María Creuza, Leo Masliah, Teresa Parodi, Baglietto y Vitale...El SUM de ALAS albergó también a Eduardo Galeano, Berta Cáceres, Nora Cortiñas, y tantos otros que vinieron a aportar su palabra a nuestra comunidad. Además lo usamos para capacitar a todos y todas quienes quieran aprender a hacer radio, desde lo técnico hasta lo creativo y lo periodístico.Ahí hacemos empanadas para las peñas con ingredientes que aportan radioparticipantes. Juntamos manzanas y las prensamos para tener jugo casero y natural en nuestro buffet. E infinitas cosas más que nos mantienen volando hace 30 años. No nos financia nadie, y logramos estar al aire todos los días de este modo cooperativo y solidario; sabemos muy bien realizar mucho con poquísimo dinero. Los detalles:Ahora ese trabajo que nos sostiene en el día a día ya no alcanza. Hoy para seguir haciendo que la comunicación sea un derecho al alcance de todos, necesitamos una casa propia. Nuestra sede actual que alquilamos está en venta. Con la ayuda solidaria de muchísima gente podremos comprarla para que no tenga dueño, para que las voces de todos y de todas vuelen libremente.¿Porqué no seguir alquilando?Como colectivo tomamos la decisión de comprar la casa y no intentar alquilar en otro lugar porque:
así la comunidad se asegura que su radio perdure en el tiempo
ya no somos sólo una radio, queremos seguir nuestro trabajo cultural en el SUM, lo cual no sería posible alquilando una construcción pequeña sólo para estudio de radio, y no hay disponibles salones con las características necesarias para que funcione nuestra sala
el alquiler se ha vuelto una tarea difícil de sostener, y sólo lo logramos gracias a pagar un monto bien por debajo del valor del mercado. Empezar a alquilar en un lugar nuevo tendría un costo excluyente para nosotros en lo cotidiano.
una radio y una sala requieren de una infraestructura importante, las mudanzas son difíciles y muy caras; hoy el mercado inmobiliario es muy volátil y no podemos arriesgar tener que seguir mudándonos según los azares del mercado
Con un empujón fuerte de todos y todas podemos llegar a hacer realidad nuestro sueño del nido propio. Si alcanzamos nuesta meta de US$89,100 que representa nuestra frecuencia de 89.1 MHz cubrimos el primer pago de la mitad del valor de la casa, y tendríamos 2 años más para pagar la otra mitad.¿Hay un Plan B?Si no recaudamos ese monto antes de fin de año, nuestra segunda opción es comprar otro terreno sin construir más económico y luego sumar lo necesario para la construcción de una nueva radio con su SUM. Es decir, aunque no alcanzamos ese primer objetivo, igual nos sirve. Y cuanto sea lo recaudado, habrá una segunda etapa de financiamiento, o para completar la compra de la casa o para construir el edificio nuevo. Tenemos muchas manos hábiles entre nosotros, tenemos la plena confianza de que la mano de obra será nuestra y sólo hará falta comprar los materiales.Y tomen nota: la cifra que ven en esta página es sólo una parte de lo que recaudamos. Esta campaña sirve más que nada para los que están lejos. Ya la población local está aportando un montón directamente a la radio sin pasar por Indiegogo, por ende el número que ven aquí es en realidad más alto de lo que parece. Al momento de lanzar esto aquí, ya tenemos US$10,000 y seguiremos actualizando ese número también.Si querés aportar y no podés a través de esta plataforma, visita nuestra página www.fmalas.org.ar donde figuran otras vías de contribución.  ¿Qué recibís vos?Respecto a las recompensas ("perks") lamentablemente no podemos enviar cosas físicas fuera del país, por eso nos hemos limitado principalmente a cosas no materiales y que invitan a que nos conectemos y nos conozcamos, no sólo intercambiar dinero y cosas.El impacto de tu solidaridadSabemos que para muchos que leen estas palabras desde otras partes del mundo, la Patagonia es un paisaje lejano y desconocido con el que tal vez no tengan ninguna relación. Pero hoy en día es una de las fronteras donde la maquinaria de un sistema injusto que quiere devorar todo se choca con otro modo de imaginar al mundo. En ese frente estamos nosotros.Aquí todavía hay más bosques que ciudadesmás agricultura que monocultivosmás artesanos que centros comercialesmás ciclistas que semáforosmás encuentros que conectividadmás radioparticipantes que oyentesTu aporte solidario ayuda a que siga siendo así.  Que nuestro micrófono sigue al aire para quien lo necesite.Otras formas de ayudarAyudanos a difundir esta campaña, con las herramientas de Indiegogo arriba, en tus redes sociales, por mail, por mensajito telefónico, hasta con tu boca! Te acordás cuando la gente hablaba con sus amigos en vez de sólo leer sus posteos? Nosotros seguimos apostando al poder de la voz humana. Comentale a tus amigos mientras patean una pelota o andan en bicicleta, mientras toman un mate en tu living o buscan a sus hijos en la escuela.Es aún mejor si en vez de pasar sólo el link, agregás palabras tuyas explicando cómo nos conocés y porqué te parece valioso que ALAS tenga su nido. Por cualquier consulta, escribir afmalaselbolson@gmail.comY no olvides de visitarnos en:www.fmalas.org.arwww.facebook.com/fmalas891   English

Tell your friends about us while you throw a Frisbee or bike down the trail, while you chat over tea in your living room or babysit each other's children.Contact like-minded media and put them in touch with us.  We love talking with other community-powered radios, TV stations, and newspapers even when we're not running this campaign.And don't forget to visit us at:www.fmalas.org.arwww.facebook.com/fmalas891

story:
OUR STORY

The UK Child Sex Abuse People's Tribunal is an independent grassroots movement that raises awareness on child sex abuse and aims to stop injustice that has been associated with child sex abuse in the United Kingdom. 

The people who are behind the UKCSAPT can be found on our website: www.ukcsapt.org.uk and our current activity on twitter @UKCSAPT. 

We are all volunteers who believe that every child deserves to have their human rights protected.  While many people believed we would not make it this far, it is these ideals that have kept us going.

PLEASE HELP

Our panel of independent experts are currently writing a report in order to bring the issues surrounding child sex abuse to light and to encourage fair and frank discussion regarding the issue.

We are raising money because we want to launch the report in a public sphere in February 2016. The report will give concrete and realistic recommendations on what everyone in the UK can do to protect children. We hope that it will also serve as a model to other countries in the world struggling with this issue. The only way we can do that is through the help of generous people. The UKCSAPT has made it this far because of voluntary donations. 

Any kind of donation would be helpful to our campaign. If you cannot afford to donate money, please consider an in kind donation or spread the word about our campaign.

story:
Reaching the UK isn't the end of the struggle

When refugees and other migrants reach the UK, they face a hostile environment. Without help, many will be forcibly sent back to the wars, persecution and misery they have fled.

We're crowdfunding to produce a vital guide that will help save lives

The Right to Remain Toolkit is a unique resource that will help people to find sanctuary in the UK. This is an opportunity for you to get involved with a practical solidarity project. This is why it is necessary...

Over 60% of asylum applications refused

 The Toolkit will help people to find advice, and to get involved in their case and overcome the barriers to justice.

30,000 locked up in detention centres

The Toolkit will help people to prepare, prevent, get help
and get out of detention.


Legal Aid no longer available

The Toolkit will help families to understand their rights and fight for justice.

Over 6,000 refused asylum seekers are destitute

The Toolkit will help people to get back into the legal system,
back into society, taking action for justice.


The Toolkit: information for action

Our Toolkit will help people to understand and navigate the complex legal system, find support and solidarity, overcome the barriers to justice, fight for their rights and secure the right to remain.

It's an essential resource, and we will distribute it free to groups all across the UK who are supporting refugees and migrants.

We know this project will work: we did it before. You can help us do it again.


An urgent appeal

We first produced a Toolkit in 2013. It was a massive success - we could hardly keep up with demand. Since then, legal changes mean that community groups across the UK, supporting asylum seekers and other migrants day-in, day-out, need a brand new Toolkit... and they need it urgently.

Cuts to Legal Aid have seen free immigration legal services reduced by 50%. Every day, refugees and migrants are being refused, threatened with deportation, in desperate need of help.

Despite the outpouring of public support for migrants seeking sanctuary, the "refugees welcome" movement, the UK government is introducing further measures to make it even more difficult for people to reach safety in the UK, and new laws to make life, and the legal process, harder to get through.

With your help, we can publish this resource, and open up access to support for thousands of people to get through the system, to find safety, establish their rights, and rebuild their lives.


What We Need & What We Will Do

The Toolkit will be an online resource, constantly updated with the latest legal information, but the community groups in our networks need the printed books too. To publish the web resource and print 1,000 books, will cost £10,000.

  • Your donation will be used to research and produce - in plain language and always up to date - essential legal and procedural information, and a unique guide to taking action for the right to remain.
  • If we reach our target, we will produce a brand new, user-friendly web resource, and print 1,000 copies of the 100+ page book, for free distribution to community groups across the UK.
  • If we do not reach our target, we will still be able to make a difference. The more funds we raise, the more people we can reach. We may have to hold off on the book printing until the funds are secured, but every penny raised in this appeal will go towards producing the Toolkit.


About Right to Remain

Right to Remain has been supporting groups and individuals seeking justice in the immigration and asylum system for 20 years. The organisation is managed by a voluntary committee of refugee and migrant experts-by-experience, academics and activists, and we employ just two workers: our strength is in the network of community groups we support, a growing movement for migration justice.

You can support the growth of this movement by helping us to produce this vital Toolkit.

We first produced a Toolkit in 2013, and it has been an indispensable resource. The website quickly reached 10,000 hits per month, and we printed 2,000 books to distribute free to community groups across the country - we couldn't keep up with demand. There have been many changes to the system since 2013 - massive cuts to Legal Aid, new legislation and changes to the immigration rules.

We desperately need to produce and distribute a new updated, bigger and better Toolkit, to assist people struggling under the new system.


What people said about the original Toolkit:

"incredibly comprehensive and accessible” ... “gives you the tools to fight injustice"

"I had no lawyer. I had to represent myself in the courts. I would never have got my papers without the Toolkit"

"Just wanted to say how useful we have found the Toolkit: it is such an invaluable resource to be able to talk through with asylum-seekers what to expect” 

"I must thank you for your toolkit. When someone first arrives in our city, a member of our organisation (who has been through the interviews) will talk the person through what it will be like. With the loss of legal advice services on immigration and the asylum process, it makes a big difference."


    Other Ways You Can Help

    You may not be able to contribute financially to this appeal, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • You can help to get the word out - make some noise about the campaign!
    • Spread the word - on Facebook, Twitter, use the Indiegogo share tools, and ask your friends to share too.
    • Do a collection with your friends, community group, your place of worship, your trade union, at your workplace, university, college or school.

Other Ways You Can Help You may not be able to contribute financially to this appeal, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  You can help to get the word out - make some noise about the campaign!

story:
Who is Tyree?

In April 2015, Tyree Carroll, a 22 year-old Black man, was profiled and stopped for riding his bike the wrong way on a one way street, was swarmed and threatened with tasering, and was beaten by Philadelphia police officers who then arrested him and charged him with assault! It was caught on video. None of the police officers have been arrested, suspended, fired or otherwise disciplined.

Concerned about justice for Tyree, family members came together with other community members and the Justice4Tyree campaign was born. Attorneys were contacted, press conferences were held, rallies were organized and as the beating of Tyree went viral, there was an initial burst of interest on the part of the media. There is still no justice for Tyree and his family. We are letting the police, DA and Mayor know that the community has Tyree’s back and will not give up. 


Tyree's Grandma Nancy Carroll

What is needed now

After the campaign won his release on bail, Tyree was re-arrested on trumped-up charges on November 15, in likely retaliation from some of the same police officers who beat him. We urgently need to raise funds for his bail to get him out: a total of $3200 just to cover bail for both arrests. Tyree, who suffers from severe asthma, and is traumatized and injured as a result of the beating, is presently housed in a county jail  known for its inhumane and unhealthy conditions.

We are  demanding that the police officers involved in the beating and/or present at the scene be publicly identified,  investigated for previous incidents, placed on leave without pay immediately, and if found guilty be removed from law enforcement. .  

This case, like so many others, screams out for justice –NOW! But grassroots campaigns for justice and police accountability are expensive undertakings – in terms of time, energy, emotional trauma, bureaucratic delays for requested information and of course money.  Money is always needed for attorneys, court filings, fees to rent space for community meetings, flyers, phone meetings, transportation costs for family members, etc. Our total goal is $4,000. 

Can we count on you?  Please contribute $100, $50, or whatever you can afford – every cent will go towards seeing justice done for Tyree and his family!

Will you please join with us to demand Justice 4 Tyree?

For more information and to join the campaign or help in other ways, please contact us:

justicefortyree@gmail.com  Phone: 215-848-1120 
Facebook group bit.ly/justice4tyree

Thank you,

Nancy Carroll, Tyree's grandmother
Margaret Prescod, national coordinator | 323-646-1269 
Prof. Dorothy Roberts, University of Pennsylvania, local spokesperson | 
215-573-2155

#Justice4Tyree  #TyreeCarroll  #RodneyKingAgain #FreeTyree  
Tweet:  #NotOneMore to @PPDCommish


March from the site of the beating to police station

Justice for Tyree Campaign includes Black Lives Matter Movement, Every Mother is a Working Mother Network, Fight for Lifers West, Free Charmaine Committee, Global Women’s Strike (GWS), Hands Up United/Ferguson (St Louis), Human Rights Coalition, Jasmyne Cannick journalist & blogger, Jewish Voice for Peace – Philadelphia, Justice for the Dallas 6 Campaign, Let’s Get Free, María E. McCabe Director of Social Justice and Community Ministry of the Unitarian Universalist Church of the Restoration, Nana Gyamfi attorney for BLM/Los Angeles, Payday, Peacehome Campaigns, Phila Coalition for REAL Justice, Showing Up for Racial Justice (SURJ), Women and Trans Prisoner Defense Committee, Women of Color in the GWS Co-sponsored by: The Center for Returning Citizens, Decarcerate PA, International Concerned Family and Friends of Mumia Abu Jamal, North Philly Peace Park, Parkhouse Studios, Trayvon Martin Organizing Committee, Up Against the Law Legal Collective
