We work with severely traumatized individuals and staff self-care is key.” ~ Brent Pace, LCSW, Clinical Director, Utah Health and Human Rights (UHHR)  (UHHR is a direct service and advocacy agency that promotes the health, dignity, and self-sufficiency of refugees, immigrants, asylum seekers, and asylees who have endured severe human rights abuses, including torture and severe war-related trauma. ) “GreenTREE Yoga is an organization that is making a positive difference in the lives of individuals in our community, And with funds to develop the “Train the Trainer” program they will be able to do so much more. The program is comprehensive and sustainable… and incorporates cultural considerations to ensure successful implementation,”  ~ Rosemarie Hunter, Ph.D. LCSW Direction University Neighborhood Partners, U of Utah Risks & ChallengesWe have completed a successful pilot project. We have received funds to continue to expand the program in 2017.  We have agencies interested in partnering with us. As we raise more money, we can provide more services to these very stressed agencies. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can’t contribute funds, please considering using the Indigogo Share Tool to let others know about our efforts to provide support to both refugees and those who provide key programs.Thank you so very much for whatever support you can provide to us.Please enjoy FREE yoga breaks at our website: greentreeyoga.org FREE link.  Breaks for home, office, schools, and special needs children!

story:
Summary Overview

Resist Assist is a new cause/company that I am creating for people throughout the US that cannot stand the current political climate but don't have time to get involved to call their senators, house of representatives, and other elected officials on a regular basis. Resist Assist provides personal assistants to call elected officials on your behalf to make sure your voices are being heard today, for a better tomorrow. 

Vision of Our Impact:

Together we can rise up and fight for what is right. Fight for equality, each other & standing up for those that can't fight for themselves (usually due to having less privilege). Together we can stop injustice, restore balance, and bring sanity back to our Democracy.

Passion is Fueling this Effort

I am passionate about launching an activism based business. I marched with people all over the world on Jan 21st to say that our voices will NOT be silenced. I believe in fundamental rights to equality, loving who you love, the right to have control over your own body - these are all fundamental human rights that no one or no government should be able to take away because of how we were born (gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or any other condition seen as "other/less than”). Furthermore, I believe human rights extend to everyone regardless of where we were born or what your religion is.

Who I am:  My name is Logan, I am a successful entrepreneur who gives over 20% of my profits to charity every year (since 2007). I am a trusted startup advisor with previous experience as a corporate executive and I have an MBA. Besides giving generously to charity I volunteer my time and serve as a board member for LGBTQ organizations.

Why This Matters So Much To Me Personally

It is extremely important to me to get Resist Assist funded to help amplify people’s voices so that their elected representatives actually *hear* them. Resist Assist will help People like my mother who expressed that she was frustrated when she tried to call one time but couldn’t get through. She then proclaimed she doesn’t have time to make phone calls every week, even though she’s retired! 

The conversation with my mother was my true “ah ha” moment to create Resist Assist to enable more people to have their voices heard in this frightening political climate. I deeply believe it is our patriotic duty to voice our dissent when our government takes un-American actions, actions a majority of people disapprove of. When our government passes unjust laws, it is our responsibility to let them know that We, the American People, are outraged by their governance. This is how democracy works. By funding Resist Assist, we will create a whole new way to get the voice of dissent (read: voice of reason) heard louder than ever before. My goal is to have Resist Assist empower thousands of more Americans to have their voices heard by their elected representatives. 

As a member of the LGBTQ community in Austin, Texas, I am deeply passionate about LGBT rights, women’s rights, and human rights. I truly believe launching Resist Assist will help ensure these types of fights for equality will a better chance of prevailing when more open minded people can have their voices heard.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $50k to get this project fully up & running to be able to be around long term, it is going to be a long 4 years and we will need a sustainable way to have our voices be heard

Funds will be used for the following:

  • Hiring personal assistants in Austin to make phone calls on your behalf    
  • We are committed to creating US based jobs and we will never outsource overseas
  • We will pay our employees a fair, living wage from Day 1
  • Hire Web Developer to create website & mobile app to make it easier to use our service
  • Buying Apps/Software for making/tracking hundreds of calls a day and servicing hundreds of our clients
  • Buying Equipment - headsets, potentially more computers, 
  • Buying Server Space - paying additional fees for additional security & handle website traffic 

What you will get:

Highest quality service to make sure the elected officials (whom you select) hear your voice loud & clear about the top 3 issues you care about most

 Perks:

  • $5 Moral Support - thank you email & you’ll be added to our newsletter list
  • $10 Get It Started - Swag only: Small Sticker with “Resist” Design mailed to you + thank you email & you’ll be added to our newsletter list
  • $20 Grassroots - Swag only: Bumper Sticker with “Resist” or “Resistance” Design (tbd) mailed to you + all lower level perks
  • $25 Mini Resistance - Swag only: Magnet with Thomas Jefferson quote design “When injustice becomes law, resistance becomes duty.” mailed to you + all lower level perks
  • $40 Modest Resistance - Swag only: T-Shirt with Thomas Jefferson quote design “When injustice becomes law, resistance becomes duty.”, made of soft ring spun cotton, sizes S-XL. For larger shirt sizes there will be addt’l shipping cost +$2 2XL, +$3 3XL, +$4 4XL. + all lower level perks

>>>>>>All Perks below include our Resist Assist service<<<<<<

  • $49.99 Resistance Member - 1 Month ResistAssist Service with 3 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose. *No t-shirt*. + All Mini Resistance level Swag Perks
  • $86.86 Resistance Member Plus - 1 Month Standard ResistAssist Service with 3 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose + Plus T-shirt! T-Shirt with Thomas Jefferson quote design “When injustice becomes law, resistance becomes duty.”, made of soft ring spun cotton, sizes S-XL. For larger shirt sizes there will be addf’l shipping cost +$2 2XL, +$3 3XL, +$4 4XL. + All Mini Resistance level Swag Perks
  • $99.99 Full Resistance Member - 1 Month UPGRADED ResistAssist Service with 6 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose. *No t-shirt*. + All Resistance Member level Swag Perks
  • $135.99 Full Resistance Plus Member - 1 Month UPGRADED ResistAssist Service with 6 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose + Plus T-shirt! T-Shirt with Thomas Jefferson quote design “When injustice becomes law, resistance becomes duty.”, made of soft ring spun cotton, sizes S-XL. For larger shirt sizes there will be addf’l shipping cost +$2 2XL, +$3 3XL, +$4 4XL. +All Full Resistance level Swag Perks
  • $299.99 6months Resistance Member - 6 Months of Standard ResistAssist Service with 3 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose + Plus T-shirt! + All other Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks
  • $599.99 12months Resistance Member - 12 Months of Standard ResistAssist Service with 3 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose + Plus T-shirt! + All other Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks
  • $600 6months Full Resistance Member - 6 Month of UPGRADED ResistAssist Service with 6 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose + Plus T-shirt! + All other Full Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks
  • $1,200 12months Full Resistance Member - 12 Months of UPGRADED ResistAssist Service with 6 calls made weekly on your behalf to your elected officials that you choose + Plus T-shirt! + All other Full Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks
  • $2,500 Grand Resistance Member (service & ads) - 12 month of UPGRADED ResistAssist Service + Banner Ad space on ResistAssist.com site for 12 months+ All other 12months Full Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks
  • $5,000 Jumbo Resistance Member - 6months remote personal assistant - 6months of remote personal assistant time 3hrs a week, 12 month of UPGRADED ResistAssist Service included in those hours + All other 12months Full Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks
  • $10,000 Supreme Resistance Member - 12months remote personal assistant - 12months of remote personal assistant time 3hrs a week, 12 month of UPGRADED ResistAssist Service included in those hours + All other 12months Full Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks
  • $50,000 Ultimate Resistance Member - Austin Only - 12months personal assistant - 12months of in person - Austin Area Only - personal assistant time 10hrs a week, 12 month of UPGRADED ResistAssist Service included in those hours + All other 12months Full Resistance Member Plus level Swag Perks

 

Potential Challenges

  • Best Case Scenario - Tons of people funding us & signing up for our service! 
  • Scaling quickly will be a challenge but a manageable one
  • Hiring - we are plugged into several networks of people to tap into a workforce of passionate people
  • Where to put all the people? We are currently looking into the possibility of renting commercial space and or having employees work from home via specialized software to keep calls logged & tracked.
  • Only getting partial funding:
    • Calls on Schedule promised WILL be delivered, operations after completion will likely cease
    • Who will call: myself & my partner will make the calls on your behalf ourselves. We will hire part time help for additional personal assistants if funds allow.
    • Most likely we will not be able to take on additional clients later on
    • Rewards: will still be fulfilled as promised if we raise at least $10k but it may take a little longer to send
    • Website: Simple website will stay, additional development such as an app will not be done

Sharing our project Helps too!

We know not everyone is in a place to contribute financially. All we ask is that if you like our idea - please SHARE it with your friends and family in person & on social media. Please share with your friends and family, or anyone you think may be inspired by this project.

Please e-mail us at  resistassist@gmail.com with any questions.

Thank you!! We appreciate your help & support!!

story:
Wie funkioniert die Kampagne?

Bis Ende Februar läuft die Spendensammelaktion. Jeder Euro hilft: Themensupports von 20,- bis 50,- Euro für Beratung, Lesben, Kultur oder Parties sind genauso möglich wie Einzelsupports von 5,- bis 1.000.- Euro als Spende, für 1 m2 Boden, für einen Barhocker oder für eine gemütliche Lounge-Ecke.

Was sind die Ziele und wer die Zielgruppe?

Von einem Kellerlokal in der Goethestraße übersiedelt die HOSI in das Erdgeschoß in der Schillerstraße. Die Beratung wird in einem großen, abgetrennten Raum angeboten und bietet damit den nötigen persönlichen Freiraum für Gespräche und Hilfestellungen. Das Büro bietet Platz für Projektplanungen und gute Arbeitsbedingungen für die ehrenamtlichen MitarbeiterInnen. Die Infothek steht allen Interessierten offen (SchülerInnen, Studierende, Eltern, ….)

Neben der inhaltlichen Arbeit – Beratung, Begleitung, Information – ist die stärkere Einbindung von Frauen, von Jugendlichen und MigrantInnen die große Herausforderung. Mit dem niederschwelligen Angebot eines freundlichen Zentrums soll ein offener Freiraum für jedeN geschaffen werden.

Angesprochen werden einerseits Lesben, Schwule, Bisexuelle, Transgender und noch in der Coming-Out-Phase befindliche Personen. Aber auch Angehörige und solidarische FreundInnen, die an einem offenen Ort Kommunikation und persönlichen Austausch suchen, sind jederzeit willkommen und erhalten die Unterstützung der HOSI.

Warum sollte man dieses Projekt unterstützen?

Das HOSI-Zentrum ist die wichtigste Anlaufstelle für Lesben, Schwule, Bisexuelle, Transgender in Oberösterreich. Hier können gemeinsam Ideen entwickelt und Projekte verwirklicht werden.

Die HOSI bekommt keine fixen laufenden Subventionen, daher ist jedes Mitglied, jedeR SpenderIn, jedeR SupporterIn eine wichtige finanzielle Stütze für den Verein.

Das neue  Zentrum bietet auch Möglichkeiten für junge KünstlerInnen, ihre Arbeiten zu präsentieren. Diese neue Drehscheibe wird auch Kommunikationspunkt für die Koordination mit anderen Organisationen und Community-Angeboten in Linz und Oberösterreich sein.

Die neuen Räume vor der Renovierung und mit Stand vom 3.12.2017

Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung?

Die Räume werden vom Vermieter generalüberholt, das Geld wird daher für weitere notwendige und zweckspezifische Umbauarbeiten oder Inneneinrichtungen verwendet (siehe Einzelsupports). Für konkrete Projekte der HOSI können mit den Themensupports bestimmte Aktivitäten umgesetzt werden. Die SupporterInnen werden auf der Website (www.hosilinz.at) und im Barbereich sichtbar dargestellt werden.

Die Aussenfassade ursprünglich, jetzt mit neuen Fenstern (Stand: 3.12.2017)

Wer steht hinter dem Projekt?

Seit 35 Jahren ist die Homosexuelle Initiative (HOSI Linz) die Interessenvertretung für Lesben, Schwule, Bisexuelle und Transgender-Personen in Oberösterreich. Mehr noch: Sie ist

  • Anlaufstelle bei sozialen, persönlichen, rechtlichen und medizinischen Problemen,
  • Sprachrohr für die Anliegen der gleichgeschlechtlich l(i)ebenden Menschen in Oberösterreich und
  • Ansprechpartner für Politik, Medien und Zivilgesellschaft.

Damit ist die HOSI Linz nicht nur der drittälteste lesBiSchwule Verein in Österreich überhaupt, sondern auch einer der aktivsten. Die HOSI Linz kann mit geeigneten Angeboten für Lesben, Schwule und TransGender-Personen aufwarten. An die 2000 Menschen lassen sich von der HOSI Linz regelmäßig Informationen zusenden, lesen PRIDE, das lesbisch-schwule Österreichmagazin, das die HOSI Linz 1991 ins Leben gerufen hat. Viele jugendliche Lesben, Schwule, Bisexuelle, Transgender und Intersexuelle haben in den vergangen Jahren an den Jugendangeboten der HOSI Linz teilgenommen und wurden hierbei in ihrem Coming Out bzw. im Erwachsenwerden unterstützt.
Das alles ist nur möglich, weil sich unzählige Lesben, Schwule und Transgender in der HOSI Linz ehrenamtlich engagieren. Das geht von der Mithilfe beim Kuvertieren von Aussendungen, über die Vorbereitungen für Veranstaltungen und das Engagement in Teilgruppen (Jugend, Frauen) bis hin zu Funktionsausübung im Vorstand.

FAQ

Kann ich die HOSI Linz auch ohne Kreditkarte oder PayPal unterstützen? 

Ja, klar. Du kannst den Wunschbetrag/Support unter Angabe des Namens, der E-Mail-Adresse und ggf. den Supportbeitrag auf folgendes Konto überweisen: 

Konto der Homosexuelle Initiative Linz (HOSI Linz) bei der VKB Bank
Kto.-Nr. 10711174 // BLZ: 18600
IBAN: AT761860000010711174 // BIC: VKBLAT2L
Wir werden den Beitrag gern berücksichtigen und dich auf Wunsch auch namentlich erwähnen. Bei Fragen: ooe@hosilinz.at

Kann ich die HOSI-Linz mit Kreditkarte hier auf der Crowdfunding-Plattform unterstützen? 

Du kannst mit Kreditkarte deine Unterstützung bezahlen: Einfach in der rechten Navigation einen „Perk“ (Themensupport oder Einzelsupport) auswählen und auf "Diesen Perk bekommen" klicken. Danach kannst du mit Kreditkarte zahlen. Fertig!

Wieso ist hier einiges auf Englisch?

Rechts unten auf dieser Seite kann man zwischen Englisch und Deutsch wählen. Je nachdem, welche Sprache dort eingestellt ist, wird man durch Indiegogo navigiert, auch durch den Bezahlvorgang. In manchen Fällen stellt sich die Seite automatisch auf Deutsch um, andernfalls bitte einfach nach unten scrollen und selbst auf Deutsch umstellen.

Aber auch Angehörige und solidarische FreundInnen, die an einem offenen Ort Kommunikation und persönlichen Austausch suchen, sind jederzeit willkommen und erhalten die Unterstützung der HOSI.Warum sollte man dieses Projekt unterstützen?Das HOSI-Zentrum ist die wichtigste Anlaufstelle für Lesben, Schwule, Bisexuelle, Transgender in Oberösterreich. Hier können gemeinsam Ideen entwickelt und Projekte verwirklicht werden.Die HOSI bekommt keine fixen laufenden Subventionen, daher ist jedes Mitglied, jedeR SpenderIn, jedeR SupporterIn eine wichtige finanzielle Stütze für den Verein.Das neue  Zentrum bietet auch Möglichkeiten für junge KünstlerInnen, ihre Arbeiten zu präsentieren. Diese neue Drehscheibe wird auch Kommunikationspunkt für die Koordination mit anderen Organisationen und Community-Angeboten in Linz und Oberösterreich sein.Die neuen Räume vor der Renovierung und mit Stand vom 3.12.2017Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung?Die Räume werden vom Vermieter generalüberholt, das Geld wird daher für weitere notwendige und zweckspezifische Umbauarbeiten oder Inneneinrichtungen verwendet (siehe Einzelsupports). Für konkrete Projekte der HOSI können mit den Themensupports bestimmte Aktivitäten umgesetzt werden. Die SupporterInnen werden auf der Website (www.hosilinz.at) und im Barbereich sichtbar dargestellt werden.Die Aussenfassade ursprünglich, jetzt mit neuen Fenstern (Stand: 3.12.2017)Wer steht hinter dem Projekt?Seit 35 Jahren ist die Homosexuelle Initiative (HOSI Linz) die Interessenvertretung für Lesben, Schwule, Bisexuelle und Transgender-Personen in Oberösterreich. Mehr noch: Sie ist
Anlaufstelle bei sozialen, persönlichen, rechtlichen und medizinischen Problemen,
Sprachrohr für die Anliegen der gleichgeschlechtlich l(i)ebenden Menschen in Oberösterreich und
Ansprechpartner für Politik, Medien und Zivilgesellschaft.
Damit ist die HOSI Linz nicht nur der drittälteste lesBiSchwule Verein in Österreich überhaupt, sondern auch einer der aktivsten. Die HOSI Linz kann mit geeigneten Angeboten für Lesben, Schwule und TransGender-Personen aufwarten. An die 2000 Menschen lassen sich von der HOSI Linz regelmäßig Informationen zusenden, lesen PRIDE, das lesbisch-schwule Österreichmagazin, das die HOSI Linz 1991 ins Leben gerufen hat. Viele jugendliche Lesben, Schwule, Bisexuelle, Transgender und Intersexuelle haben in den vergangen Jahren an den Jugendangeboten der HOSI Linz teilgenommen und wurden hierbei in ihrem Coming Out bzw. im Erwachsenwerden unterstützt.Das alles ist nur möglich, weil sich unzählige Lesben, Schwule und Transgender in der HOSI Linz ehrenamtlich engagieren. Das geht von der Mithilfe beim Kuvertieren von Aussendungen, über die Vorbereitungen für Veranstaltungen und das Engagement in Teilgruppen (Jugend, Frauen) bis hin zu Funktionsausübung im Vorstand.FAQKann ich die HOSI Linz auch ohne Kreditkarte oder PayPal unterstützen? Ja, klar. Du kannst den Wunschbetrag/Support unter Angabe des Namens, der E-Mail-Adresse und ggf. den Supportbeitrag auf folgendes Konto überweisen: Konto der Homosexuelle Initiative Linz (HOSI Linz) bei der VKB BankKto.-Nr. 10711174 // BLZ: 18600IBAN: AT761860000010711174 // BIC: VKBLAT2LWir werden den Beitrag gern berücksichtigen und dich auf Wunsch auch namentlich erwähnen. Bei Fragen: ooe@hosilinz.atKann ich die HOSI-Linz mit Kreditkarte hier auf der Crowdfunding-Plattform unterstützen? Du kannst mit Kreditkarte deine Unterstützung bezahlen: Einfach in der rechten Navigation einen „Perk“ (Themensupport oder Einzelsupport) auswählen und auf "Diesen Perk bekommen" klicken. Danach kannst du mit Kreditkarte zahlen. Fertig!Wieso ist hier einiges auf Englisch?Rechts unten auf dieser Seite kann man zwischen Englisch und Deutsch wählen. Je nachdem, welche Sprache dort eingestellt ist, wird man durch Indiegogo navigiert, auch durch den Bezahlvorgang. In manchen Fällen stellt sich die Seite automatisch auf Deutsch um, andernfalls bitte einfach nach unten scrollen und selbst auf Deutsch umstellen.

story:
Last year in history class we discussed the awful hardships of refugees around the world. Feeling inspired, I went home and customized bracelets and sold them around my school. I picked different shades of blue for each bracelet to signify hope for the refugees. While selling bracelets I raised around $650-$700 and I thought I needed to take this to the next level; online. Selling bracelets and collecting donations has been a wonderful way of seeing people give back to our world. Although I know I can't fix everything for the refugees, I'm trying to head in the right path.

Some people in the United States do not give refugees a consideration or the help they need because they aren't from the same country. Even though they aren't from the U.S, this does not mean they aren't humans just like us. There is so much tragedy all over the world and its time we did our part, our generation needs to step up. There are 65.5 million refugees around the world that need our help!

Let's take a step forward and move towards blue

story:
In 2010, I was teaching English in Sapa, a small town in northern Vietnam. That's where I met May, Pang and their friends, who sold handicrafts to tourists in the streets. 

After I left Sapa, 5 of those 10 girls were kidnapped and trafficked into China. 4 of the girls, including May and Pang, were "lucky" to have been forced into marriage with Chinese men; the 5th girl was sold into prostitution. 

They were 15 years old. 

In 2013, I returned to Asia with the seemingly impossible hope of finding the missing girls. After an intense and risky 5-month investigation, I did actually find May and Pang in distant parts of China. 

By that time, both May and Pang had given birth in China. Still only teenagers, each was forced to make the heartbreaking choice between her daughter and her own freedom.

For the past six years, I've given everything I have to raise awareness of the global human trafficking crisis, which claims over 40 million victims around the world. 

Most victims are women sold for sex, and millions are only girls. How would you feel if your sister or daughter simply vanished, never to be seen again? 

Awareness is the crucial first step towards change.

May and Pang's story has now been released as a feature documentary, 'Sisters for Sale'. 

The story already reached millions of people (via CNN, Newsweek, TEDx, VICE, etc) before the film was even finished. 'Sisters for Sale' has now premiered at two international film festivals, and won awards at both. 

We didn't make 'Sisters for Sale' to win awards, but to share a vitally important message with you. That's why we've chosen to take the film out of the festival circuit, and share it with you today. 

For a very limited time, you can watch 'Sisters for Sale' for just $1 - in English, French, German, Hmong, Italian, Spanish or Vietnamese. 

The most difficult part of our journey is behind us. We found both May and Pang, and gave them the freedom to determine their own futures. 

We have a unique and very powerful story which can make a very real difference against the global human trafficking crisis - now we just need to share it. 

There's *so much* to 'Sisters for Sale' that we just couldn't fit into the film. 

We're now planning to tour the documentary to engage people personally with the facts of human trafficking, and are working to expand 'Sisters for Sale' as a book and podcast. 

We want to use the story to support Alliance Anti-Trafic and Blue Dragon Children's Foundation, two amazing organisations who rescue kidnapped girls and help protect other girls at risk. 

But we can't do it without you. 

We're already giving a huge amount of time and energy to this work, and now we need your help. We've put together some great rewards to thank you for your support. 

This is your chance to see the film, get the gorgeous original soundtrack and large, high-quality film poster, plus three alternate poster designs, the script, and the numbered, limited-edition rescue map. 

We also have a very special sneak-peek at the 'Sisters for Sale' book - even in the opening chapters you'll understand just how much of this incredible story was left untold in the documentary! 

You can make a very real difference in protecting young women right now. Every dollar will be dedicated towards fighting human trafficking.

If you can't support our work financially, please share our campaign and let your friends know what we're doing! 

Check out the 'Sisters for Sale' documentary trailer here, and learn more below:

"I was utterly blown away by this documentary... 'Sisters for Sale' is something that everybody would benefit to see. Seriously." - Nora Dunn, AKA The Professional Hobo

"Incredible... I think my perspective of the world changed forever. This is exactly why I supported you." - anonymous supporter

"So powerful. I'm writing my Master's thesis on bride trafficking, but all the reports and studies in the world can't capture the humanness of Sisters for Sale." - Jennifer Wells-Qu, Equality Now

"This film is an absolute must-watch. Amazingly heartbreaking story." - Simone Taylor, supporter

"I have seen the film, and all I can say is that each and every one of you needs to watch it and get behind this incredible work." - Benjamin Cooper, supporter

"Thank you for your courage, your tenacity, and your willingness to do something beyond just talk about the tragedy that is human trafficking – I applaud you." - Donnie Featherston, supporter

"If I can’t do it myself, I should at least support someone with the heart, guts and brains who can." - Lucas Thacker, supporter

story:
Hello, everyone!

My name is Anna Johnson, and I am a junior at Warren Wilson College. I am planning for a really exciting study abroad trip in India this spring! The program is titled Sustainable Development and Social Change - right up my alley for my passion for environmental and social justice work. Here's the program page if you'd like to learn more: https://studyabroad.sit.edu/program/spring-2020...

I've done most of the grunt work already: applying for the course (and getting accepted!), filling out all the paperwork, getting all the vaccinations, and figuring out all the financial requirements. At this point, with my federal aid and some amazing scholarships by SIT, I have nearly everything covered for my trip! However, I would really love your help with one little thing. My flight!

Although I have already purchased my flight to the program site in the magnificent city of New Delhi, I am still left with the payment of my returning flight in May. Any little bit will help me tremendously! Of course, I would love to share pictures/videos/postcards of my incredible experiences in India!

Spring semester is quickly approaching, and I am more than thrilled to board that plane! Even if a donation is not on your agenda, I would love to hear from you, and am more than willing to share with you my plans and adventures for while I'm away.

Thank you to everyone who has encouraged me to take bold chances and pursue my passions! We are building a more equitable and sustainable world- I just know it.

 

Much love and blessings,

Anna

story:
We are Global Hope Rescue and Rehabilitation Centre. As well as housing, our former street boys receive all needs necessary to live a healthy childhood: education, food, clothing, time to play, love, counselling and mentorship at a bare minimum. It has taken time, dedication and funding to get to where we are today. If we want to continue to grow, buying land brings the ability to provide so much more and to ensure these boys not only survive but get the opportunity to thrive. 

From little things, big things grow.

In 2012, Joseph Njoroge started a football club with a handful of street boys, as from personal experience he understood and empathised with the challenges street children face. From there Joe rented one room where the boys could sleep, shower and eat to escape the dangers of living on the streets of Nairobi. Fast forward 7 years to 2019 and Joe's small football club is now a rescue and rehabilitation centre housing at least 110 former street boys at a time, rescued from all over Kenya.

Our greatest challenge currently is that we have run out of space and the house is becoming unsafe for our boys so we need your help in raising money to buy and build the home they need and greatly deserve.

Without Global Hope and the support of our incredible supporters, many of these boys would still be living on the streets in unimaginable conditions if not dead. Each child has an incredible life story entailing resilience and strength from traumatic and devastating experiences. 

From taking drugs so they do not feel cold at night to rummaging through piles of rubbish to find food; our boys some as young as 10 years old have had experiences that no child deserves to face.

There isn’t a boy at the centre who doesn’t have a brother, cousin or friend that has died from street life either from starvation, overdosing on drugs, mob justice or being beaten to death by police in an effort to ‘clean up the streets’. 

There are a huge number of street children in Kenya, and as Global Hope is one of the only centres in the country rescuing and rehabilitating street boys it is an endless struggle. On a daily basis, we are informed of street boys facing near death experiences and children showing up to the gate with nowhere else to go, yet we are completely OUT OF SPACE.
We cannot fit more in, already there are 3-4 boys in a single bed sharing a single blanket. Our rented buildings are all damaged and leak when it rains, making it difficult to eat meals, do homework and play games.

The compound we currently reside in is too small for our needs and as we rent, every dollar we are forced to spend on repairs and maintenance feels like money wasted; not to mention our daily stress of being evicted if the landlord decides to demolish or sell. 

After many stressful days and sleepless nights, the Founder and the volunteers have come to the conclusion that the only option is to purchase land so that we are able to construct our own buildings.

Our biggest and most difficult issue is we do not have money; some months it’s difficult to purchase food or pay school fees so without your help purchasing land is not an option for us.

That’s why we are calling for support from all over the world, we know we can’t achieve our dream of purchasing land without your help and although it’s a big ask, the thought of all our boys becoming homeless, returning to the streets and facing the possibility of death is more than we can bare so we are COMMITTED to raising money for land.

Some nights we sleep 6 or 7 boys to a single bunk bed, every morning we wake to prepare for school at 4am as we have one shower and one toilet that 110 children share and we live next to a sewage-contaminated river exposing all of us to typhoid and cholera; these diseases spread quickly and are deadly. 

We have found land, an incredible 1.5 acres just out of Ngong town and not far from our current centre for 15 million Kenyan shillings or $150,000 USD. For us, this amount of money is daunting and more than we’ve ever seen in our lifetimes, yet we are hopeful when we break it down: 150 people assisting to raise $1,000 or 300 people raising just $500 each in the 6 months seems absolutely achievable.

The landlord has agreed to hold the land for 6 months ONLY to give us time to fundraise. Kenya is developing quickly, and other countries are buying huge amounts of land causing prices to rise quicker than ever. If we don’t act now, the possibility of owning our own land only becomes more difficult. 

We have all worked too hard to get to where we are, to only get this far.

Please help us to ensure we can continue supporting our boys and many more street children for years to come. Every single dollar is so greatly appreciated!

If you would like more information or are interested in assisting us to fundraise for land in a bigger way, please contact the Founder Joe Njoroge at globalhoperescuecentre777@gmail.com or the Australian Director Maddi Kent at maddi@eviegrace.org

Most donations are tax deductible, please contact info@eviegrace.org to receive a receipt.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
• This year, Streetwise Opera ran With One Voice, the first summit for international organisations working with the homeless and the arts. WAYout was invited to attend, and created a beat which one of our musicians, Mash P, wrote and sang the chorus to 'Have You Ever Thought About?' . It's a song about homelessness addressed to world leaders. WAYout set up a makeshift studio at the venue and invited participants of the summit to contribute. Homeless people from Brazil, Peru, USA, Canada, India and other European countries took part; including Booth Centre, Dallas Street Choir, Bea Gardener , Riffraff, Theatre of the Oppressed NYC, Uma So Voz and Urban Voice Project so far. Others wanted to take the beat home and rehearse something and then send it.
  • We need your help to bring those contributions together and finish it and produce a video, to raise awareness of homelessness and support our hub in Sierra Leone. 
  • WAYout is 10 years old and has worked with over 4,000 street and disadvantaged youth in Sierra Leone offering free training and facilities in music, filmmaking and the arts. We empower and give voice and provide skills that enable many to get work. WAYout was started by Hazel and Michael Chandler in response to the 70% unemployment in youth in Sierra Leone ten years ago and their own recognition and belief in the arts as a way of reaching young people who have been on the streets for years.
  • We've seen the life-changing benefits we can bring to street youth.  The WAYout studio is a safe haven replacing hopelessness, judgement and stigma with purpose, creativity, acceptance, training, homes, opportunity, facilities and inspiration.
  • The finished track will both raise awareness and challenge attitudes about homelessness around the world; be great promotion for the amazing work happening Internationally; and raise awareness and support for what WAYout does.

HOW MUCH?

We want to raise £3000. This will be to gather up the recordings from around the world (cover their costs to send), mix and master the track and create a video for promotion. It will be used to raise awareness internationally to challenge the image of street and homeless people, and support our ongoing work. If we raise more than £3000, we will support WAYout's work and contribute to the organisations taking part.

BACKGROUND

"WAYout changed my life and music saved me. I was ashamed on the streets. Everyone rejected me but now I am a photographer and musician with a future" - Nathaniel Sesay aka Mash P who wrote this song.

The WAYout Story so far...

WAYout was founded in Sierra Leone in 2008 by Hazel and Michael Chandler. It came out of a documentary Hazel was making about street youth in Kenema and was set up to offer free training and facilities in media, music and arts to street and disadvantaged young people. Many were ex combatants and most were traumatised by the conflict and alienated from community and education.

We have worked with over 4,000 street and disadvantaged youth since then.

There was already a body of research about the power of the arts to engage and change lives but nothing quite prepares you for seeing that first hand. Long term, disengaged street youth could keep their cool and define what they wanted to do through music and movies; learning specific skills but also things like communication, literacy, co-operation, empathy and team work without even realising it. Again and again we have seen them reconnect with family or community after years apart, gain self esteem through creativity, develop the confidence to start or return to education or get jobs and find self respect and a sense of their own identity and ability. The magic happens the moment they go from hanging out and doing something because it is cool and they've nothing better to do, to the realisation that they could, perhaps, be somebody and achieve something. Then they get stuck in and start learning; proving to their communities, families and themselves, that they count, after years of being told they will never amount to anything.

WAYout has an open door policy and we encourage new members to find what they are good at rather than push them through a set pattern of training. We also offer grants to members who have been coming for at least six months and are serious about learning, to find them homes, for travel to reconnect with family or to return to education.

Our home -is a building in a compound that houses the two recording studios funded by the Joe Strummer Foundation, the photoshop room, two editing rooms and a dedicated women's room with a large outdoor space for teaching, dancing or rehearsing. We also have a smaller base in Kissi Town, the old refugee camp which is home to 22,000 people and still has no electricity supply or water.

WAYout members have made award winning films from comedy to awareness raising documentaries on subjects like Ebola, Illegal Fishing, FGM and women's rights- reaching audiences of hundreds of thousands. This year we produced our first feature film "The Choice" which is getting into international festivals. We also had an exhibition of photographs by members in London and produced our first poetry book "Written Off".

In the studio we have recorded over 2000 tracks and 12 albums. The Black Street Family, once notorious gangsters, have completely changed their image through having access to a free studio to record their music.

1040 course certificates have been awarded to WAYout members

85 members have been found homes whilst others have received travel or education grants.

Some WAYout members now have jobs as senior editors, camera operators and presenters at all three National TV stations and some successfully work freelance.

We have had award winning volunteers come out and offer training in writing, filmmaking, editing, music, producing, photoshop, photography, radio production and animation and now WAYout members pass on that knowledge and do a lot of the training.

Frank Turner visited WAYout and will return in January 2019 and is now a patron. "It's the only aid group that helps them self realise...and gives real, vital value to their lives."

In return we have some great perks- signed books from patron Nick Hornby and signed albums from patron Frank Turner and thank you photos from WAYout members.

We are a 100% charity- meaning every pound goes to the work we do. And you can help even if you cant donate, by passing this on to friends and colleagues.

Our patrons are comedian/writer Mark Thomas, actor Ellen Thomas, musician Frank Turner and writer Nick Hornby. 

Thank you to all your support, from all of the WAYout members.
story_txt:
This year, Streetwise Opera ran With One Voice, the first summit for international organisations working with the homeless and the arts. WAYout was invited to attend, and created a beat which one of our musicians, Mash P, wrote and sang the chorus to 'Have You Ever Thought About?' . It's a song about homelessness addressed to world leaders. WAYout set up a makeshift studio at the venue and invited participants of the summit to contribute. Homeless people from Brazil, Peru, USA, Canada, India and other European countries took part; including Booth Centre, Dallas Street Choir, Bea Gardener , Riffraff, Theatre of the Oppressed NYC, Uma So Voz and Urban Voice Project so far. Others wanted to take the beat home and rehearse something and then send it.
We need your help to bring those contributions together and finish it and produce a video, to raise awareness of homelessness and support our hub in Sierra Leone. 
WAYout is 10 years old and has worked with over 4,000 street and disadvantaged youth in Sierra Leone offering free training and facilities in music, filmmaking and the arts. We empower and give voice and provide skills that enable many to get work. WAYout was started by Hazel and Michael Chandler in response to the 70% unemployment in youth in Sierra Leone ten years ago and their own recognition and belief in the arts as a way of reaching young people who have been on the streets for years.
We've seen the life-changing benefits we can bring to street youth.  The WAYout studio is a safe haven replacing hopelessness, judgement and stigma with purpose, creativity, acceptance, training, homes, opportunity, facilities and inspiration.
The finished track will both raise awareness and challenge attitudes about homelessness around the world; be great promotion for the amazing work happening Internationally; and raise awareness and support for what WAYout does.

HOW MUCH?
We want to raise £3000. This will be to gather up the recordings from around the world (cover their costs to send), mix and master the track and create a video for promotion. It will be used to raise awareness internationally to challenge the image of street and homeless people, and support our ongoing work. If we raise more than £3000, we will support WAYout's work and contribute to the organisations taking part.
BACKGROUND
"WAYout changed my life and music saved me. I was ashamed on the streets. Everyone rejected me but now I am a photographer and musician with a future" - Nathaniel Sesay aka Mash P who wrote this song.
The WAYout Story so far...
WAYout was founded in Sierra Leone in 2008 by Hazel and Michael Chandler. It came out of a documentary Hazel was making about street youth in Kenema and was set up to offer free training and facilities in media, music and arts to street and disadvantaged young people. Many were ex combatants and most were traumatised by the conflict and alienated from community and education.
We have worked with over 4,000 street and disadvantaged youth since then.
There was already a body of research about the power of the arts to engage and change lives but nothing quite prepares you for seeing that first hand. Long term, disengaged street youth could keep their cool and define what they wanted to do through music and movies; learning specific skills but also things like communication, literacy, co-operation, empathy and team work without even realising it. Again and again we have seen them reconnect with family or community after years apart, gain self esteem through creativity, develop the confidence to start or return to education or get jobs and find self respect and a sense of their own identity and ability. The magic happens the moment they go from hanging out and doing something because it is cool and they've nothing better to do, to the realisation that they could, perhaps, be somebody and achieve something. Then they get stuck in and start learning; proving to their communities, families and themselves, that they count, after years of being told they will never amount to anything.
WAYout has an open door policy and we encourage new members to find what they are good at rather than push them through a set pattern of training. We also offer grants to members who have been coming for at least six months and are serious about learning, to find them homes, for travel to reconnect with family or to return to education.
Our home -is a building in a compound that houses the two recording studios funded by the Joe Strummer Foundation, the photoshop room, two editing rooms and a dedicated women's room with a large outdoor space for teaching, dancing or rehearsing. We also have a smaller base in Kissi Town, the old refugee camp which is home to 22,000 people and still has no electricity supply or water.
WAYout members have made award winning films from comedy to awareness raising documentaries on subjects like Ebola, Illegal Fishing, FGM and women's rights- reaching audiences of hundreds of thousands. This year we produced our first feature film "The Choice" which is getting into international festivals. We also had an exhibition of photographs by members in London and produced our first poetry book "Written Off".
In the studio we have recorded over 2000 tracks and 12 albums. The Black Street Family, once notorious gangsters, have completely changed their image through having access to a free studio to record their music.
1040 course certificates have been awarded to WAYout members
85 members have been found homes whilst others have received travel or education grants.
Some WAYout members now have jobs as senior editors, camera operators and presenters at all three National TV stations and some successfully work freelance.
We have had award winning volunteers come out and offer training in writing, filmmaking, editing, music, producing, photoshop, photography, radio production and animation and now WAYout members pass on that knowledge and do a lot of the training.
Frank Turner visited WAYout and will return in January 2019 and is now a patron. "It's the only aid group that helps them self realise...and gives real, vital value to their lives."
In return we have some great perks- signed books from patron Nick Hornby and signed albums from patron Frank Turner and thank you photos from WAYout members.
We are a 100% charity- meaning every pound goes to the work we do. And you can help even if you cant donate, by passing this on to friends and colleagues.
Our patrons are comedian/writer Mark Thomas, actor Ellen Thomas, musician Frank Turner and writer Nick Hornby. 
Thank you to all your support, from all of the WAYout members.

story:
Can a T-Shirt Lead to an Impeachment? 

It seems far-fetched, doesn't it? 

But then again, President Nixon was brought down by some little cassette tapes, so you never know.

This administration is only a month old, yet the corruption is already rampant and brazen. President Trump's myriad conflicts of interest related to his business dealings grow more serious by the day. We also now have a scandal brewing over the administration's potential involvement in Russian interference in the presidential election, evidence of which has been been corroborated by both the FBI and CIA.

Under these extraordinary circumstances, the case for impeachment is absurdly strong, especially considering that the Trump administration just finished unpacking their stuff. 

Our nation cannot afford 4 years of a president who has no respect for the fundamental principles that serve as the bedrock of our Republic, such as the separation of powers and the rights enshrined in the First Amendment to our Constitution. 

People are asking whether the President CAN be removed from office. He most definitely can be. Congress has that power.  At the moment, however, many members of Congress see the president as more of a political asset than a liability. As long as that is the case, the unfortunate reality appears to be that President Trump will continue to serve in the Oval Office regardless of how many impeachable offenses he commits.

Our nation's procedural pipes are clogged up on Capitol Hill.

Congress needs a plumber. 

Get Out of Our House is that plumber.

We, the People, have the power to unclog the pipes of our Democracy. We will do so ramping up pressure of members of Congress through postcards, calls, and protests. We will flood the offices on Capitol Hill with demands that the necessary steps be taken to get the President out of the White House.  

Yes, this seems like an ineffective way to get a president removed from office. But as The Indivisible Guide, a helpful document written by congressional staffers, has made clear, these activities make the lives of people in Congress more difficult, and members of Congress pay attention to the things that make their lives more difficult. 

Contributing to this campaign isn't about buying a t-shirt or a pile of postcards to send to Congress. It's about buying IN to a movement. 

Because getting the t-shirt (our uniform of the Resistance) and the postcards (a tool of the Resistance) isn't the END of your involvement. It's the BEGINNING. Join the campaign, and we're going to help you USE the resources at hand to bring about the change we want to see in our nation.

We're not looking for consumers, but collaborators. 

This movement has the potential to achieve the unthinkable. Never in American history has a unified mass Resistance contributed to the impeachment of a President of the United States. 

But we've never had a president so ripe for impeaching, have we? 

With each citizen who stands up to be counted among those calling for President Trump to Get Out of Our House, we inch closer to achieving that end. 

Pressure will build on the White House. Pressure will build on Capitol Hill. 

Our moment is now. 

Where do you stand? 

 

With Your Support...

Your support here helps us do the following: 

  • Produce the thousands of shirts and 100,000+ postcards destined for Capitol Hill over the next 90 days.
  • Contribute to protests already planned and organize our own rallies targeting members of Congress vulnerable to challengers in their upcoming re-election campaigns. 
  • Lobby members of Congress directly to persuade them to pursue the President's impeachment. 
 

Our Asks for You

If you support our cause and believe it's worth contributing to, thank you. Here's how you can help:

  • Share our Campaign across social media.  #Getoutofourhouse #nomoreyears #impeachtheman
  • Place an order. It helps spread the message and do more of this work. 
  • Contact 3 people directly about also joining our cause. 

This Indiegogo page is simply the beginning of our campaign. 

If you believe that this goal is both worthwhile and necessary for the health of our Republic, we thank you for your support, your shares, and your attention.

story:
Our Family is determined to fight for justice. Taking this case to the Supreme Court may only give a slim chance to change my mother's deportation outcome, but it will leave a stepping stone for many others caught in the same situation. The well intended Motor Voter Law is entrapping non-citizens into registering to vote, and voting, and as a result causing deportations. We need your help to change this. ​

It is a rare circumstance to have the opportunity to present a case in front of the Supreme Court. This gives us hope that our actions will make a difference- with your help.​

My name is Connie Fitzpatrick and I am here on behalf of my family. I am here for my mother, for her children, and for her grandchild... but especially for my mother's ten-year fight towards justice.

My family and I came to the US in 2001, legally. My mom, Margarita Del Pilar Fitzpatrick, has always maintained a legal status while in the US. She has recently lost her US Permanent Residence as part of the deportation procedures. She now holds a working permit while she awaits a decision by the US Supreme Court as to whether they will consider her case. My sisters and I are U.S. Citizens, and so is my niece. We are active members of our communities and respect the rule of law.

Education has always been a priority in our home. While raising three daughters as a single parent, my mom worked and attended college simultaneously. She eventually earned her degree and has served as a Registered Nurse in the State of Kansas and Virginia for the past three years and nine months. She has been accepted to the Doctor of Nursing Practice program in hopes of becoming a Family Nurse Practitioner and working with underserved populations. Unfortunately, due to the circumstances, she had to decline that offer. My mother has taught us to work hard for our dreams and that there is a possibility for everything. “Si Se Puede” (Yes we can) she would always say. She has also taught us to be just, to be active in our communities and to speak up... even when it is hard to do so. Like right now.

She has fought towards justice for ten years and is now one step away from appealing to the Supreme Court. Our family, our community, and many others have made great efforts to take her case this far. As of today, Wednesday May 3, 2017 we only have 30 days to raise $37,000. This money makes it possible to pay the costs of renown immigration lawyer Richard Hanus as well as the costs of filing with the Supreme Court. (We have chosen to raise $39,960 to cover Indiegogo related fees).

This is what happened:

In 2005, just a few years after arriving in the U.S. and while renewing her driver's license at an Illinois state DMV, my mother was registered to vote as a part of customary protocol established by the 1993 National Voter Registration Act, which federally mandates that this service be offered to all patrons of the DMV regardless of their citizenship status. To make matters worse, this same law forbids DMV officials from discouraging anyone from registering, even clearly ineligible folks, like my mother, who should never have been asked to register to vote in the first place.

In fact, there are currently no procedural distinctions made between citizens and non-citizens during this federalized recruitment procedure. This means that, under this law, non-citizens are engaged and welcomed into the voter registration process as if they are citizens of the United States. This explains how, despite providing clear disclosure to the official that my mother was not a U.S. citizen, she was still recruited to fill out a voter registration form.

She was puzzled by the situation but was quickly given the form to fill out which did not provide a way to identify herself as a permanent resident and not a citizen.  When she asked if this was legal and whether she was supposed to register, the DMV official advised her “it’s up to you”.  As a result of not being provided with the only correct answer – which was NO, my mother understood the official’s words as permission to proceed to register. From there, as a result of filling out this form, she was unknowingly unlawfully making a claim to be a U.S. citizen. My mother eventually received a confirmation letter that she was allowed to vote.  In the end, my mother believed that the DMV official knew the law better than her and would never mislead her or offer her an opportunity to commit an unlawful act. Well, the DMV official did mislead her, and because of that she faces immediate deportation.

Fortunately there is hope for change – This federalized process of soliciting non-citizens to register to vote was called into question by the Keathley v. Holder case of 2009, where a legal alien in a similar position successfully fought off deportation. In 2017 my mother appealed her case under the Seventh Circuit Court. Though her case was denied, it give us a step towards appealing to the Supreme Court.


We only have a short time to raise funds to cover Supreme Court filing fees, including the service cost of immigration lawyer Richard Hanus. Please help us with any amount you can so that we can make an appeal and keep families together.

I have made this video not just for my family, but also for awareness of how the 1993 National Voter Registration Act, also known as the Motor Voter Law, affects the lives of non-citizens. Together we can make a difference.

Attached below are brief publications that illustrate the faulty process of voter registration solicitation at DMVs, and other important public documents.

 

Links:

NBC National News Coverage:
http://www.nbcnews.com/nightly-news/peru-native-who-voted-illegally-two-u-s-elections-now-n746721

Application for Stay of Removal- Law Offices of Richard Hanus - US Department of Homeland Security I.C.E, Margarita Fitzpatrick
http://issuu.com/conniefitzp/docs/skm_c65817042401430

United States Court of Appeals For the Seventh Circuit- Margarita Fitzpatrick, Before Easterbrook, Williams, and Sykes, Circuit Judges. 2017
http://issuu.com/conniefitzp/docs/rssexec.pl

Seventh Circuit Federal Court Hearing- audio recording, Margarita Fitzpatrick. January 17, 2017
http://media.ca7.uscourts.gov/sound/2017/rs.15-2204.15-2204_01_17_2017.mp3

Accidental Voters and Disproportionate Immigration Consequences—Richard Hanus
http://www.usavisacounsel.com/articles/2506.htm

 

Two new Perks have been added to our fundraiser! 

1) Justice For Margarita - Poster (large $300)

Original artwork by Dave Loewenstein. Each print will be one of a kind; hand cut stencils, spray paint, on artist paper.

2) Justice For Margarita - Poster (small $20)

Original artwork by Dave Loewenstein. A smaller version of the original "Justice For Margarita" porter. This will be printed on artist paper (11/17inches) and delivered to you by July of 2017.

story:
She's Worth It Initiative

 

Who is Camille Stone and

what's that book, "This Woman's Worth", about?

 

Hi, I’m Camille Stone, author of “This Woman’s Worth” and advocate for Women’s Empowerment!  I  I made the decision to write a book and start a journey of helping other women to realize their worth because of my own life experiences. It took me till the age of 38 to figure out who I truly was and who I wanted to be. I had not yet realized my worth and was living life on the defensive. The day the idea for ‘This Woman’s Worth’ took hold of my heart, I was pregnant with my, now, 2 year old son and I was still a very broken woman. I looked at my mess of a life and said, “I want more and I know I can have it!” So I wrote! 

I had to figure out how to connect with women across the nation...the audience that my book, "This Woman's Worth" speaks to. I wasn't sure how to do that...then I realized crowdfunding is my answer!

What's Our Mission & Ultimate Goal??

empowering women to understand their worth, heal their spirit and inspire life through motivational enlightenment.

I began this journey to effectively connect with women nationwide to aid in their healing process and show them they are worth so much more than the life they've chosen!! Many women truly do not know their worth, have never been exposed to anything better, and see no real chance for a beautiful existence! It is my mission to help other women realize the WARRIOR-ESS within herself!

 

The 'She's Worth It' Initiative, will enable me to provide my book for FREE to many of the 200,000 women that are incarcerated and to women in the 1500 women's shelters across the U.S!

 

Support our efforts along this journey and join me to make this campaign a success!!


Lets make a difference!!!


• 201,000 Women are Incarcerated in the U.S. - 80% are Mothers of Minor Children & 90% Experienced Sexual Violence

• Approximately 3.5 Million Women in the United States are beaten in their homes each year by their husbands, ex-husbands, or male lovers

• 600,000 Fatherless Families and 1.35 Million Children experience homelessness each year - DOMESTIC VIOLENCE IS MOST OFTEN THE CAUSE!!
 

THIS IS A CRISIS OF EPIDEMIC PROPORTIONS!!

 

Funding Goals

My initial goal is $10,000.  This will allow me to send out 1000 books to women across the U.S. that need to know their WORTH!  This is a significant starting point in our efforts to touch the lives of not only WOMEN but their CHILDREN as well!  Let’s face it, when mommy is doing well, it will inevitably have a positive impact on her children.  

However, the more money that’s raised is simply more books sent out and more lives touched!  No matter how little or how much money comes in, it will translate to books for women! 

 

The person you truly are; the person you were created to be is and always was WRITTEN IN STONE!

-Camille Stone        

I’m so excited…we have awesome rewards to share!  

The World doesn't reward perfectionists.  It rewards those that gets things done!

-Anonymous                 

I know from experience how hard it is to believe in yourself after suffering from abuse.  Sexual abuse began in my life at the age of 3.  Those events created the belief within me that was I was not good enough for wonderful things in my life.  I chose unhealthy relationships, made bad choices, and made a mess of my life for a long time.  Yes, those were all my choices but my life began to change when Mom gave me a book in 2006 that began to reshape my thinking and ultimately change my life.  I wonder where I would be today had Mom not invested in me with the gift of a book! 

    

  

  

 

   

 

The She’s Worth It Initiative will touch lives the same way mine was.  A woman that is feeling lost will begin to rise up on the inside.  She will begin to see herself in a different light and start asking herself questions of “What if?” and “Why not ME?”  Her perspective will shift and life will look more like possibilities and less like sadness & pain. 

 

Hurdles & Challenges

 

Reaching out to each prison and learning their process for receiving books is one of the biggest challenges we face.  Every prison’s process is different.  My team and I have been working to make those connections and determine the amount of books needed for each facility. 

Another challenge is locating all the shelters in the U.S.  Oftentimes, the location of shelters is kept confidential.  There are 1500 shelters so we have our work cut out for us.    

However, we are a determined group of crazy people on a mission to change the persona that women are the weaker sex!  On the contrary…

WOMEN ARE THE MOST POWERFUL CREATURES ON EARTH!

We need your help…not just your money!  Even if you cannot donate, please share our message and help us to create a buzz!  Just remember, your efforts will affect the life of someone needing to know she’s not alone!  We love her and we know that

SHE IS WORTH IT!!
story_txt:
She's Worth It Initiative Who is Camille Stone andwhat's that book, "This Woman's Worth", about? Hi, I’m Camille Stone, author of “This Woman’s Worth” and advocate for Women’s Empowerment!  I  I made the decision to write a book and start a journey of helping other women to realize their worth because of my own life experiences. It took me till the age of 38 to figure out who I truly was and who I wanted to be. I had not yet realized my worth and was living life on the defensive. The day the idea for ‘This Woman’s Worth’ took hold of my heart, I was pregnant with my, now, 2 year old son and I was still a very broken woman. I looked at my mess of a life and said, “I want more and I know I can have it!” So I wrote! I had to figure out how to connect with women across the nation...the audience that my book, "This Woman's Worth" speaks to. I wasn't sure how to do that...then I realized crowdfunding is my answer!What's Our Mission & Ultimate Goal??empowering women to understand their worth, heal their spirit and inspire life through motivational enlightenment.I began this journey to effectively connect with women nationwide to aid in their healing process and show them they are worth so much more than the life they've chosen!! Many women truly do not know their worth, have never been exposed to anything better, and see no real chance for a beautiful existence! It is my mission to help other women realize the WARRIOR-ESS within herself! The 'She's Worth It' Initiative, will enable me to provide my book for FREE to many of the 200,000 women that are incarcerated and to women in the 1500 women's shelters across the U.S! Support our efforts along this journey and join me to make this campaign a success!!Lets make a difference!!!• 201,000 Women are Incarcerated in the U.S. - 80% are Mothers of Minor Children & 90% Experienced Sexual Violence• Approximately 3.5 Million Women in the United States are beaten in their homes each year by their husbands, ex-husbands, or male lovers• 600,000 Fatherless Families and 1.35 Million Children experience homelessness each year - DOMESTIC VIOLENCE IS MOST OFTEN THE CAUSE!! THIS IS A CRISIS OF EPIDEMIC PROPORTIONS!! Funding GoalsMy initial goal is $10,000.  This will allow me to send out 1000 books to women across the U.S. that need to know their WORTH!  This is a significant starting point in our efforts to touch the lives of not only WOMEN but their CHILDREN as well!  Let’s face it, when mommy is doing well, it will inevitably have a positive impact on her children.  However, the more money that’s raised is simply more books sent out and more lives touched!  No matter how little or how much money comes in, it will translate to books for women!  The person you truly are; the person you were created to be is and always was WRITTEN IN STONE!
-Camille Stone        I’m so excited…we have awesome rewards to share!  The World doesn't reward perfectionists.  It rewards those that gets things done!-Anonymous                 I know from to know she’s not alone!  We love her and we know thatSHE IS WORTH IT!!

story:
Wear The String for Peace 

There is no doubt that hatred, racism and violence against anyone that's "different" is at a crisis level globally. The String represents a strong rejection of this behavior, and that's the effort I'm hoping to start with your help! Tempers are quick, guns are everywhere, children are dying, fathers are being incarcerated, mothers are being abused. We can't hear the cries because of the noise. Wear The Peace String as a quiet stand against the anger.

I've been a Graphic Designer my entire career. I've worked for a variety of organizations that allowed me to produce amazing designs for sports teams, events, theme parks and television shows. This endeavor however, is my most passionate. Sometimes it's not how loud you speak, but what you say, so please help me say it. Join me in the quiet war. I would love to see people wearing the String and acknowledging each other as they go by with their own String. Eventually I would love to have owners of a String join "Peace Pals" which connects each person who registers on the website with someone else who owns a String. This will begin to form the network that can bring about change!

What you can help achieve 

I'm hoping that the funding provided here will enable us to produce finished Strings, set up  the website, print collateral (postcards, stickers and flyers) to bring awareness, and cover the costs of registering the brand and trademark. We are hoping that eventually we will also have Tees and bracelets available for sale on the website.

What you receive for helping us

I will be including t-shirts, original paintings, and Strings in the Perks Packages. T-shirts are designed using the main colors of the string in a bold pattern on the front. My paintings will be 12"x12", acrylic/mixed media on canvas and consistent with the Peace String brand. No two will be alike even though similar. Bold and graphic these are meant to connect with the spirit and represent the diversity that makes us beautiful!

The beginning.                      The process.                           The finish.

The Impact

Over time my wish is to have The String influence our approach to each other and help teach tolerance. If we become ambassadors of Peace we can change negative attitudes a little at a time. Peace String hopes to become involved in community efforts and we will be donating a percentage of the proceeds from this effort to a Charity that shares a similar mission. I am researching charities that focus on young adults, one that provides support for their challenges, losses, and victimization. I think a Charity that empowers its young people so that they can share strength with their peers, is essential to making progress.

Challenges

I am dedicated to making this work! You take chances to make a change and I believe we can all do this together. I know there will be challenges along the way but I know that people want this, and it will be worth every phone call, gallon of gas, plea for assistance, every frustration I may face, if in the end we have people wearing a String that provokes peaceful conversations, and diminishes fear. Risks are everywhere, that's why we need to build a strong community of "Stringers"

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially at this time, then please just talk about us, send your friends over here to help. Post this on FB, as anything is something. Please watch for The Peace String website that will be coming soon. Emails will be sent out to gather shirt sizes as Perks are allocated.Thank you!

story:
The Queer Facilitator Course

Many LGBTQIAs don't even know what embodiment is, but we're changing that - and helping change the lives of LGBTQIAs in Russia for the better. For the past 3 years we have been working with Mark Walsh, director of the Embodied Facilitator Course. He has done charity workshops for the LGBTQIA community and helped us set up a 3-month embodied training programme for our community.

"I've started noticing my body: how I am, what I am doing..." - S.

"I can tap into self-care before I start burning out" - N.

"I feel like I have given myself permission to be" - A.

These are all things participants have said and that we would like to carry to the rest of our community.

In 2019 we want to offer the "Queer Facilitator Course" to 15 activists - that's twice as many people as last year and it's a lot of work. We'll need 1,500 GBP (1700 EUR) to cover rent, admin, and trainer costs. It would make a huge difference because the activists invited on the course are already doing massive work with the LGBTQIA community here.

Training up our own embodied facilitators

By the same token, we can't keep relying on invited trainers, no matter how good they are. We need to train up our own facilitators who know the LGBTQ context from their personal experience. Many LGBTQ activists in Russia dedicate a great portion of their lives to serving our community and do not have the financial means to enroll on a long-term programme.

The embodiment course in Russia has agreed to train LGBTQ activists on a by-donation basis, so every 1,000 GBP allows us to send 1 activist on a year-long programme. After they complete the programme, they will be able to give back to the community by providing charity workshops.

If we have 5 certified embodied facilitators who are also activists, we can ensure 1 embodiment event for LGBTQs every week that is accessible to everyone from our community. Also, since we're not relying on just one activist, we know we're not putting them in a situation of potential burnout.

Building an embodied LGBTQ+ community in Russia

We believe that this work is of great value. Being an LGBTQ person in Russia can be numbing. We believe that becoming more embodied will lead to a stronger, thriving community. That's why we've started the "Queer Facilitator Course" and we need your help to extend this work to more LGBTQ activists in Russia and eventually train up our own embodied facilitators who have a personal experience of what it means to be LGBTQ. Here's what you can help us do:

  • a 3-month embodiment programme for the LGBTQIA community in Moscow
  • embodiment workshops for the LGBTQIA community
  • embodied training for specialists working with the LGBTQIA community
  • training and certification for up to 5 LGBTQIA activists

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for reading this far, you are great! Even if you can't contribute financially, we would appreciate it if you could share this campaign and help more people learn about it.

We'll be glad to answer your questions, just email us at resurs.moscow@gmail.com

Best regards,

Julie Esse, Mark R. and the "Resource LGBTQIA Moscow" team

story:
A safe life for all children!

 

NSANSA Village Community Development Mission  is a nonprofit and non-government organization that seeks to help street children of Zambia with education and a better living standard and by that enrich the community. We started Nsansa Group in 2014 by building a shelter for orphans and street children. We cooked food three times a day to replace the drugs they took when living in the streets to relief them from hunger. We developed the organization by adding programs like feeding program in the streets, skills training and basic classes. The organization is mostly run by local Zambian staffs who are eager to help vulnerable people including orphans and street children in their community.

Our main goal is to help as many street children as we are capable of and to provide a bed,  love and care, basic education, and job trainings.

We do outreach in the streets of Lusaka, Zambia, two times a week and it includes medical help for the ones in need. The program not only helps distracting the children for taking drugs and gives them nutrition, it also includes interaction and attention which they lack as they do not have a family.

After providing meals, their face is completely changed, smiles appear and they gradually open their heart to us. We wish to do the feeding program more often so relief the children from hunger and violence.

We also educate them about the consequences of drug abuse and knowledge about prevention of HIV / AIDS infection, which is a big problem in the streets. Furthermore we sometimes have discipleship in the streets where the children can find comfort when praying with an adult.

 

Our Rescue Program

Currently it is primarily our own staff and a few sponsors who finances almost everything, therefore we need sponsors and donations to expand and develop the organization to rescue more children and to send more children to school. Many of our children at Nsansa have been here for many years and need sponsor to continue to education so they can pursue and perhaps achieve their dream!

Most staff-members use their own salary to feed the rescued children which is very unstable and not progressing. Therefore we need your help mos street children! You can make a single donation through this fund or become a sponsor for only $1 a day - with this you send a boy to school, give nutritious food, new clothes and a safe environment AND you make room for another street child at our base camp in Lusaka. For more questions check contacts below.

Become a sponsor or make a single donation!

 

Contact us

Please visit our Facebook page and please know what we are working on to protect our vulnerable people including orphans and street children.
https://www.facebook.com/nsansavillage/

About other ways of helping our program, please check our official website.
https://nsansagroup.com/

story:
There are hundreds of thousands of refugees risking everything to escape a future without hope and even death in their war ravaged countries, including Syria, Libya, and other countries. The world is facing one of the greatest humanitarian crises of our time. There are 59 million refugees in the world, 12 million displaced from Syria alone, fleeing war, famine and poverty.


Aid organizations are stretched to their limits. The scale of the problem is testing their traditional methods. This is where technology can help.


The Refugee Aid App can be the single source of information and resources and the single interface for the organizations to make their resources available.



For NGOS - simple interface to post and send notifications to refugees
based on their location.  The communication and content publishing system will give them access to the system so they can easily get appropriate help to people where they are.


For refugees - critical resources available to them where they are, by city and country or by geolocation.


For the rest of us - a way to help!
We need donations to our IndieGoGo campaign to help hire part time staff
to interact with NGOs, charities and refugees.


The App and Communication Management System are 90% built - we can launch in 2 weeks. Digital Fan Clubs is providing all of the technology infrastructure and development resources and will maintain the app on an on-going basis. As a technology company with an existing platform, we can get this out in the hands of those who need them quickly and efficiently. This campaign proceeds will cover launching and maintaining the app and platform for 6 months. All  part time positions to manage the app and relationships with partners, NGOs and charities.In 6 months we can hand the system over to a non-profit to manage. 


We have the support of two of the world's largest aid organizations and will be launching with a minimum of four with aid in areas with the largest concentrations of refugees.


Who we are:

Shelley Taylor, serial digital entrepreneur and founder of Digital Fan Clubs.

Serene Hamzawi: business development specialist across multiple industries, with over 20 years of experience and a vast network. 

Francesca Zotta: refugee and migrant project manager, with 8
years experience in project development.
