story:
Short version: Raised within the strictures of Islam, facing the constant stress of war and political upheaval, my experiences of oppression, tyranny, and the darkness that can pervade the human soul was the genesis of my own maturation process. Although my process is yet ongoing, the time has come to share my experiences so that you, too, may choose to embark upon your journey. This work offers deeper insight into our shared experiences, touching on trauma, nutrition, movement, mythologies, and gender identities, in an attempt to reveal - and better prepare you for - the path toward the inexorable confrontation with our unconscious-selves. Watch the Video above this page. (For more videos check out: http://changiz.com)

CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO TOWARD THE FOLLOWING:

_ Marketing, website building, branding, editing the book, book tour, illustrations, publishing, acquiring book agent, online courses, videos, extra research and contingency. 

 

Long version: For over five years Changiz has dedicated himself to decoding the inexorable process of individuation & maturation that remains the most salient feature of our human condition. “Mature Up” represents Changiz’s efforts to explore such wide-ranging features of our shared human experience as initiation, trauma, diet, movement, demythologization, symbolism, and gender identity, in an attempt to expose readers to a more productive approach to what he sees as an inevitable confrontation with our unconscious-selves.

The novelty of Changiz’s perspective offers readers an as-yet-to-be-explored coalescence of these shared experiences. Changiz’s project represents a collective product that explicitly acknowledges its place, perched firmly upon the broad shoulders of many of history’s greatest thinkers, such as Marie-Louise Van Franz, Joseph Campbell, Carl Jung, Moshe Feldenkrais, Robert Bly, Jean-Paul Sartre and many others who have devoted their lives to searching for the truth of human experience.

“Mature Up” offers readers a chance to more deliberately, and effectively, embrace a conscious individual evolution and collective maturation of humanity, as we desperately hurtle ourselves toward an inescapably uncertain future. Changiz’s principle goal is to shine light upon the crucial components that comprise the very essence of every human being.

Changiz provides readers with the tools needed to skillfully navigate the minefield of interpersonal transformation, by guiding them through his own, ongoing, maturation process. Originally migrating from Iran to the United States at the age of twenty-five, he details for his readers the struggles he underwent as he confronted his own failings in the face of having to rapidly adapt to a stark contrast of cultural contexts.

Broadly, “Mature Up” explores the depth of the unconscious, and more specifically our “subconscious neurocontructs”, positioning these features of human experience as the driving force behind all conventional motifs, be they biological, neuroscientific, mythological or environmental in nature. The reader will learn new ways of looking at timeless ‘human dramas’ such as evil, religion, love, infatuation, craftsmanship, and the nature of the human mind. Changiz challenges the reader by posing to them fundamental questions, such as ‘how can humans potentially transform one another through a cross-pollination process of conscious evolution, aiding each other’s quest to effectively deconstruct our long-held and cherished narratives of power and manipulation?’ And ‘how can we explore the deeper recesses of our minds while using movement or our craft as a modality of discovering and ultimately transforming our subconscious neuroconstructs?’

The purpose of this work is to bring awareness to our historically destructive misinterpretations of preconceived associations that exist within certain contexts in our lives. Alongside this aim, “Mature Up” seeks to inspire within us a new collective interdependency so that we have the skillset to confidently move through this world, embracing the hard conversations and inevitability of conflict, while avoiding the perpetuation of generational abuse and trauma.

In short, “Mature Up” sheds a new light on the age-old story of humanity and the trials and tribulations that will continue to demarcate the uniqueness of our shared experiences.
story_txt: Short version: Raised within the strictures of Islam, facing the constant stress of war and political upheaval, my experiences of oppression, tyranny, and the darkness that can pervade the human soul was the genesis of my own maturation process. Although my process is yet ongoing, the time has come to share my experiences so that you, too, may choose to embark upon your journey. This work offers deeper insight into our shared experiences, touching on trauma, nutrition, movement, mythologies, and gender identities, in an attempt to reveal - and better prepare you for - the path toward the inexorable confrontation with our unconscious-selves. Watch the Video above this page. (For more videos check out: http://changiz.com)CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO TOWARD THE FOLLOWING:_ Marketing, website building, branding, editing the book, book tour, illustrations, publishing, acquiring book agent, online courses, videos, extra research and contingency.  Long version: For over five years Changiz has dedicated himself to decoding the inexorable process of individuation & maturation that remains the most salient feature of our human condition. “Mature Up” represents Changiz’s efforts to explore such wide-ranging features of our shared human experience as initiation, trauma, diet, movement, demythologization, symbolism, and gender identity, in an attempt to expose readers to a more productive approach to what he sees as an inevitable confrontation with our unconscious-selves.The novelty of Changiz’s perspective offers readers an as-yet-to-be-explored coalescence of these shared experiences. Changiz’s project represents a collective product that explicitly acknowledges its place, perched firmly upon the broad shoulders of many of history’s greatest thinkers, such as Marie-Louise Van Franz, Joseph Campbell, Carl Jung, Moshe Feldenkrais, Robert Bly, Jean-Paul Sartre and many others who have devoted their lives to searching for the truth of human experience.“Mature Up” offers readers a chance to more deliberately, and effectively, embrace a conscious individual evolution and collective maturation of humanity, as we desperately hurtle ourselves toward an inescapably uncertain future. Changiz’s principle goal is to shine light upon the crucial components that comprise the very essence of every human being.Changiz provides readers with the tools needed to skillfully navigate the minefield of interpersonal transformation, by guiding them through his own, ongoing, maturation process. Originally migrating from Iran to the United States at the age of twenty-five, he details for his readers the struggles he underwent as he confronted his own failings in the face of having to rapidly adapt to a stark contrast of cultural contexts.Broadly, “Mature Up” explores the depth of the unconscious, and more specifically our “subconscious neurocontructs”, positioning these features of human experience as the driving force behind all conventional motifs, be they biological, neuroscientific, mythological or environmental in nature. The reader will learn new ways of looking at timeless ‘human dramas’ such as evil, religion, love, infatuation, craftsmanship, and the nature of the human mind. Changiz challenges the reader by posing to them fundamental questions, such as ‘how can humans potentially transform one another through a cross-pollination process of conscious evolution, aiding each other’s quest to effectively deconstruct our long-held and cherished narratives of power and manipulation?’ And ‘how can we explore the deeper recesses of our minds while using movement or our craft as a modality of discovering and ultimately transforming our subconscious neuroconstructs?’The purpose of this work is to bring awareness to our historically destructive misinterpretations of preconceived associations that exist within certain contexts in our lives. Alongside this aim, “Mature Up” seeks to inspire within us a new collective interdependency so that we have the skillset to confidently move through this world, embracing the hard conversations and inevitability of conflict, while avoiding the perpetuation of generational abuse and trauma.In short, “Mature Up” sheds a new light on the age-old story of humanity and the trials and tribulations that will continue to demarcate the uniqueness of our shared experiences.

story:
Meet Neha

This illustrated children’s book, lovingly crafted by the team over the past year, provides a beautiful, engaging and informative introduction to the condition of statelessness, endured by more than 15 million people around the world, with a child being born stateless every 10 minutes! 

The book tells the story of Neha, an ordinary 12-year-old girl with an extraordinary problem. Neha, her sister Nikita and their mother are from Nepal. But there is something wrong. They are not treated the same. They cannot sit important exams or travel abroad. Their mom constantly has to fight for their right to belong. But then something amazing happens.

Neha – with the help of some magic coins – is able to travel the world. She visits new countries, makes new friends and learns about nationality and statelessness.

Through her adventure, she pieces together bits of the puzzle about her own nationality. She learns how

  • those who should have a nationality are denied it,
  • those who would have a nationality cannot prove it, and
  • those who do have a nationality can lose it.

Neha and her friends also learn more about the struggles faced by stateless children around the world. And importantly, what they can do to challenge statelessness and demand that every child have a nationality!

 

Help us make a difference!

The book is designed to help children explore not just how nationality works and what role it plays in our day-to-day lives, but also build their understanding of the rights they hold as children. The beautifully textured illustrations of Dian Pu complement the poignant photographs of Saiful Huq Omi and Greg Constantine and the original artwork of stateless children to bring the story to life.

The end product is a wonderful teaching, learning and awareness raising resource – made all the better by our plans to develop an accompanying website of additional materials, activities and a related teachers guide. What’s more, the book is currently being made available in four languages! English, French, Spanish and Dutch.

Now we need your support, to share this book with others! We want to place copies of the book in the hands of teachers and pupils, parents and children, policy makers and journalists. Those with nationality and without, all around the world, with a special focus on countries where many children face statelessness. We want to develop the accompanying website and teachers guide. And most importantly, we want this book to make a real difference. We believe it can educate and inform children and adults alike about statelessness. But more than this, it can instil a deeper commitment among young and old to come together to act against statelessness!

Please help us with this by contributing to this CROWDFUNDING campaign. Your contribution will help us to...

  1. Print more copies for distribution among children and adults in key target countries such as Serbia, the Dominican Republic, Malaysia, South Africa, Kenya, the Netherlands, Nepal and the UK.
  2. Develop the accompanying website and teaching resource.
  3. Publicise the book and get it into the hands of policymakers, human rights advocates, UN officials, and others who can make a difference in the human rights situation of stateless children and adults around the world.

 

Who are we?

We are the Institute on Statelessness and Inclusion (ISI), an indepdendent non-profit organisation founded, in the Netherlands, in late 2014 with the mission to promote inclusive societies by realising and protecting the right to a nationality. Ensuring that everyone enjoys a nationality, is necessary for promoting and fulfilling other human rights, reducing poverty and inequality, and countering discrimination and intolerance. 

Helping to ensure that children are included and enjoy a nationality is particularly important. From a young age, stateless children are aware of the disadvantage and discrimination they face. Statelessness can not only prevent children from exercising their rights (to education, to healthcare, etc), but it can also has a significant and lasting impact on a child’s sense of belonging and self-worth. This is why realising the right of every child to a nationality is a key focus of our work and we have created this book to help us work to achieve this.

For more information about the Institute, see www.InstituteSI.org

 

Together we can make a real difference!

We strongly believe that The Girl Who Lost Her Country will be a valuable resource in the effort to raise awareness about statelessness and advocate for change. But don’t take our word for it. Here is what the experts say – children’s writers, academics and UN specialists!

  • Neha’s story is rich, wrenching, and illuminating. This is a necessary book. - William Alexander, winner of the American National Book Award

  • This marvellous book addresses one of today’s most egregious and elusive human rights challenges with admirable clarity and energy.  It provides a powerful tool for educators, for youth advocates and for young people eager to understand how a basic lynchpin of human belonging can be denied to millions of people today. - Jacqueline Bhabha, Professor of the Practice of Health and Human Rights, Harvard University

  • This book is an entertaining – and educational – introduction to statelessness for children. Neha’s journey clearly highlights the struggles Stateless children and their families can face. It helps children learn about their rights, and how they can help. - Kerry L. Neal, Child Protection Specialist, UNICEF

Most importantly, here is how Neha and her sister Nikita responded when they read the book!

We are immensely happy and so grateful to you all for this amazing book. We have lived as stateless for so many years, and more than we sisters, our mother has fought a lot. Through this book we feel like her call for fighting this injustice will be reached worldwide and more understanding hearts will join in.

We would like to thank the writer in particular for allowing us (stateless children around the world) to an avenue to dare to dream, of breaking the chain and fly beyond borders. We believe this will certainly bring hope and encouragement to all the stateless children to achieve their dreams and go far and beyond. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope very much that you will be able to contribute something towards our campaign. As you will see from our rewards structure, we are counting on both big and small contributions to help us reach our target. However, we understand that for some of you, a financial contribution is not an option. The good news is, whether you financially contribute or not, there are other ways in which you can help!

  • Share this campaign among your social networks!
  • Follow us on Twitter and Facebook, and direct your contacts to the campaign.
  • If tweeting, use the hashtag #HelpTheGirlWhoLostHerCountry
  • Also use the Indiegogo sharetools!

Thank you for your support and for joining the global movement to address statelessness! We leave the last word to Neha and Nikita Gurung – the wonderful sisters whose story inspired us to write this book!

Inclusive World- That’s all we want and wish for.  I hope this is where we all are walking towards…and I directly appeal all the readers, let’s walk this path of equality together, hand in hand. After all ‘We All Belong to This Home called Earth’

story:
WHY UnBroken and why ME?? 

My name is Samantha Gerson, and I am a survivor of Institutional Abuse and Conversion Therapy. At age 12, I came out of the closet as gay, and started dealing with a lot of inner turmoil. I ran away from home and found myself in life threatening situations. Rather than get help from home, I was kidnapped from my high school, and taken to a remote part of Utah where I spent the next nine months enduring physical, emotional and sexual abuse at a "residential treatment center." Day 1, I was stripped of my clothes, and my identity. I quickly learned that the only way out was to play the system. I came out of treatment in much worse condition than I went in, only to find out there was no one waiting on the outside to help me. 

 

Watching my friends from my institution die by suicide, get locked up for crimes, or live a life of addiction, made me realize something needs to change. I pursued a career in Social Work so I could help young survivors like I once was. As an LMSW, I work with survivors of all kinds, but knowing this $6 billion industry is going nowhere, I know it's time to make space for these survivors. These youth need counseling, vocational services and legal support, before they turn into another statistic. This non-profit, is the crux of my life's work, and will help to end this epidemic before another generation must endure this torture and trauma. 

 

Your contributions will allow me to hire consultants around the US so that no survivor must struggle due to lack of funds. We will be able to access youth all around the country, and help them beat the odds. This funding will pay for our thorough, confidential software, and allow a staff of three to dedicate their full attention to this cause. This funding will also pay for liability insurance, so that no one is mistreated or wrongly accused. Our goal is to be the solution to an epidemic that has existed since the 1800's. 

 

What We Need & WHY?

Today our goal is to hit 1.5 million in donations. This will pay specifically for the following:

1) Complete internet software that is HIPAA compliant, user friendly, and systematically thorough.

2) An app for adolescents who are in dire need of services.

3) Liability insurance to start contracting with consultants across the US.

4) Ability to pay the consultants so no survivor has to think about $$ when seeking help.

5) Salary for the three staff that will dedicate their full time/lives to making UnBroken a national success.

6) The full launch of NFP status, in both CA and NYS. 

If we don't reach our goal, this is our priority list and will be paid for as we receive the funds. Our goal is to get this software going so we can reach the most youth accessible. Whether we reach our goal or not, we plan to be in full effect by the next fiscal year. 

 

YOUR IMPACT!

Institutionalized youth, specifically, those who underwent conversion therapy, leave institutions in worse condition. Instead of receiving care, they are traumatized, and come out in a bad state. GLBT youth are 4x as likely to commit suicide as their peers, and those that undergo Conversion Therapy are 6x more likely. 85% of survivors either kill themselves, end up in jail or on drugs. There is no solution for this population, and they need care.

All survivors of institutional abuse are my target. Over 3,000 institutions have been named as abusive, this year alone. This population include survivors of religious cults, privatized "teen rehabs" and conversion therapy clinics. Currently, I work (pro bono), in a clinical nature, with 15 survivors and this number continues to increase as my social media presence increases.

By providing trained and competent counselors and lawyers for the survivors of these horrific places, we are able to reroute the teen's trajectory. Instead of being a statistic, we can help these youth lead a healthy and functional lifestyle, instead of succumbing to the trauma they endured. Youth have human rights, and the lawyers will be able to fight for them. 

YOU are making this POSSIBLE

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand everyone cannot donate today. Sharing this page means just as much. Spreading the word and educating others are a huge part of our cause. Please use Indiegogo share tools to help spread this to your community. MAKE SOME NOISE!

story:

Score A Friend is a registered 501(c)(3) Nonprofit Organization. Donations are tax deductible.    Our Federal EIN is 46-4058677

story:
*Please find text in Finnish bellow* 

 

 

We are fighting against one of the biggest challenges which teenagers are facing in Ghana, poor sexual health. A huge amount of adolescents aged between 12 - 19 have faced issues like early and unintended pregnancies, HIV/AIDS/ sexually transmitted Infections and sexual abuse. With YASH project, we aim to bring sexuality education to local schools and organisations in Ghana with the goal to increase their human sexual rights for information and equation and therefore significantly increase their sexual health.

Our crowdfunding goal is 5000€ but as it is a flexible goal we are happy if we achieve a goal of 2000€ which enables us to create the updated study materials and organise YASH education in schools and afternoon programs. The more money we get the more schools and organisations we are able to take on board. Organising comprehensive YASH program for one institution costs around 600€.

YASH is an art based sex education project delivering sex education in multiple different ways for the most vulnerable adolescents in our planet. We concentrate in urban slum areas in Africa starting from Ghana’s Capital city’s Accra’s neighborhoods Nima and Jamestown.

We are looking to educate school students and teachers in primary schools, vulnerable adolescents who don't go to schools in afternoon programs in cooperation with local NGOs as well as organise sex education workshops in the project areas among the professionals from healthcare, social work, politics and education. We have created the study materials for the program in cooperation with a local organisation using trusted research methods and by testing the materials in practice. Throughout the time we have modified the materials to serve  the needs of these local communities. 

 

                                                               

1. We believe the change starts with empowering individuals and vulnerable communities . YASH offers support and guidance for the most vulnerable adolescents in our planet to give them stronger life skills for their future and to enable their human sexual right to information and education. YASH involves the local communities in every step of the project.  YASH does always cultural research about every community it works in and aims to respond to their individual needs.  YASH's core value is to be community-orientated by working directly on the grassroot level with the local families and professionals.

2. High-quality education is the most important thing driving the healthy development of our humanity. Communities, where sex education does not exist, are often struggling with problems such as teenage pregnancies, school dropouts, sexual abuses, and poor sexual and reproductive health. Sex education is the number one prevention tool for these issues. 

3. Sexuality education promotes sustainability. In the neighborhoods we chose to run YASH in we have rapidly growing populations while the living conditions are remaining poor. Reproductive health plays a big role in increasing these people’s life quality. When a big percentage of girls drop out of school at an early age it creates a bigger gender gap with an impact on the whole economy of the country. 

 

 

 

 

With the first YASH project in 2017, we created the first versions of all the YASH education materials, educated 120 children in a primary school, organised one workshop to train 5 teachers to use our sex education materials  and organised an 8 weeks long afternoon program for 12 adolescents.

The money we are raising this time goes to the creation of the study material and to the project operational costs, like transport, internet, electricity and classroom rental. Salaries will not be paid and all the workforce in the project will work voluntarily. 

Organising comprehensive YASH program for one institution costs around 600€.  The amount of money we are able to raise in this crowdfunding will have an immediate impact on how many organisations we will be organising YASH project for. Our crowdfunding goal is 5000€ but as it is a flexible goal we are happy if we achieve a goal of 2000€ 

We will go to organise YASH project in as many institutions as the budget allows us. These institutions are primary schools and local organisations working with adolescents. 

 

Each institution we work with will:

1. Receive our study curriculum and study materials.

2. We will organise workshops for the professionals in these institutions and l walk them through how to use the materials step by step

3. We will organise comprehensive YASH education project for their students

4. Follow up and help them to continue organising sexuality education in the future.

Our main goal is to implement comprehensive sexuality education in these institutions permanently. 

 

 

 

                                                                                                                                 

 

Karolina Lahti: Bachelor of social services, a  visual artist  and the founder of the YASH project. While my career has kept me involved with art and videography, my studies brought me to Ghana for the first time in 2017, where I worked on my Thesis on sexual education in cooperation with SCEF, a local NGO focused on the same topics. As my work evolved, we decided to test what we learned in the local schools and organisations and that is how, following very successful results, YASH was born. 

Eugene Ufoka: Bachelor of social services, human rights activist and project manager of the YASH project. I'm born in a small coastal city called Tiko in the southwest of former British Southern Cameroons. I'm passionate about making the world a better place. I m committed in the mission to achieve a more fair and equal society closing the gender and race inequalities in the world.

Paul Semeh: Bachelor of social science, the founder of the Street Children Empowerment Foundation and the main partner for the YASH project in Ghana. I founded and lead the Street Children Empowerment Foundation (SCEF) in Ghana and I am passionate about Safeguarding, human rights, and human development-related areas.

 

 

 

 

YASH is aiming to achieve high goals in 6 months' time with a relatively low budget.  YASH is prepared to extend the project for a couple more months if needed without needing a bigger budget. 

YASH is a development cooperation project, working within different cultures. When cooperating between  different cultures there is always a risk for misunderstandings, especially when dealing with difficult topics such as sexuality. YASH is designed with cultural sensitivity to respect the local culture and will try to avoid harmful misunderstandings and cultural conflicts by simply listening, reflecting, collecting feedback, and keeping calm in difficult situations. 

Follow us in Instagram, Facebook or visit our website. Karolina Lahti is also more than happy to reply to any questions you may have. You can schedule a Skype call with her or reach out through an email karolina@lina.media

 

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Teksti Suomeksi * 

Suomenkieliseen videoon pääset täältä 

 

Yksi suurin haaste joka vaikeuttaa nuorten elämää Ghanassa on heikko seksuaaliterveys.  Länsi Afrikassa 12–19-vuotiaiden nuorten keskuudessa varhaiset tai tahattomat raskaudet, HIV / AIDS / sukupuolitaudit ja seksuaaliset hyväksikäytöt ovet yleinen syy peruskoulun keskeytymiseen.

YASH on taidelähtöinen seksuaalikasvatus projekti jonka tavoitteena on tarjota kokonaisvaltaista seksuaalikasvatusta kaikkein haavoittuvimmassa asemassa oleville nuorille. YASH projekti keskittyy vähävaraisiin kaupunkialueisiin aloittaen Afrikan mantereelta, Ghanan pääkaupungista Accrasta, Nima ja Jamestown nimisistä kaupunginosista, mahdollistamalla nuorille heidän seksuaalioikeutensa tietoonja kouolutukseen  ja siten kohentaa merkittävästi heidän seksuaaliterveyttään.

Tämän joukkorahoituskamppanijan tavoite on 5000€  mutta sen ollessa joustava tavoite olemme tyytyväisiä, jos saavutamme 2000€ tavoitteen, jonka avulla voimme viimeistellä uusimmat versiot oppimateriaaleistamme ja järjestää YASH-koulutuksen kouluissa sekä iltapäiväohjelmissa. Mitä enemmän rahaa saamme, sitä enemmän kouluja ja organisaatioita pystymme ottamaan projektiin mukaan. YASH- projektin järjestäminen  yhdelle instituutiolle maksaa noin 600 euroa.

Kouolutamme oppilaita ja opettajia peruskouluissa, koulujärjestelmän ulkopuolelle jääneitä  haavoittuvassa asemassa olevia nuoria iltapäiväkerhoissa,  sekä järjestämme seksuaalikasvatustyöpajoja terveydenhuollon, sosiaalityön, politiikan ja koulutuksen ammattilaisten kanssa. Olemme luoneet ohjelman oppimateriaalit yhteistyössä paikallisen organisaation kanssa käyttämällä luotettavia tutkimusmenetelmiä ja testaamalla materiaaleja käytännössä. Olemme päivittäneet materiaaleja jatkuvasti palvelemaan paikallisten yhteisöjen tarpeita.
 

 

 

1.Koska se voimaannuttaa haavoittuvia yhteisöjä. Uskomme, että muutos alkaa yksilöiden voimaannuttamisesta. YASH antaa tukea ja opastusta haavoittuville nuorille tarjoamalla elämäntaitoja tulevaisuutta varten ja mahdollistamalla nuorten oikeuden saada tietoa ja koulutusta seksuaaliasioista. YASH käyttää taidetta, koska se on loistava työkalu käsitellä arkaluontoisia seksuaalisuuteen liittyviä aiheita. Taideharjoitukset antavat nuorille uusia ilmaisutyökaluja, jotka voivat olla erittäin voimaannuttavia nuorille, jotka joutuvat ratkaisemaan vaikeita kysymyksiä jo varhaisessa iässä. YASH tekee aina kulttuuritutkimusta jokaisesta yhteisöstä, jossa se toimii, ja pyrkii vastaamaan yhteisön yksilöllisiin tarpeisiinsa. YASH:n ydinarvo on työskennellä suoraan ruohonjuuritasolla paikallisten perheiden ja ammattilaisten kanssa.

2.Koska koulutus on avain kehitykseen. Korkealaatuinen koulutus on tärkein ihmiskunnan tervettä kehitystä ohjaava asia. Yhteisöt, joissa seksuaalikasvatusta ei ole, kamppailevat usein ongelmien kanssa kuten teiniraskaudet, koulunkäynnin keskeyttämiset, seksuaaliset hyväksikäytöt sekä huono seksuaali- ja lisääntymisterveys. Sukupuoli- ja seksuaalivalistus on tärkein ennaltaehkäisykeino näihin ongelmiin. Alueilla, joilla toteutamme YASH projektia, on väestönkasvu nopeaa, kun taas elinolosuhteet ovat edelleen huonot. Koulutuksella ja lisääntymisterveydellä on suuri rooli näiden ihmisten elinolojen parantamisessa. Kun suuri osa tytöistä keskeyttää koulun varhaisessa iässä, se lisää sukupuolten välistä eriarvoisuutta ja vaikuttaa koko maan talouteen.

3.Koska se edistää kestävää kehitystä. Ilmaston lämpeneminen ja ylikansoitus ovat olleet osa ihmiskuntaamme viime vuosikymmeninä. Vaikka nämä asiat nähdäänkin ylivoimaisina, YASH uskoo tulevaisuuden olevan erittäin myönteinen, jos oikeat asiat tehdään riittävän aijoissa. YASH uskoo, että lisäämällä korkealaatuista koulutusta ja sukupuolten tasa-arvoa, ihmisillä on paljon parermmat mahdollisuudet löytää ratkaisuita suuriin globaaleihin kysymyksiin. 

 

 

 

Teimme ensimmäisen vuonna 2017 toteutetun YASH -projektin nollabudjetilla. Loimme projektissa ensimmäiset versiot kaikista YASH -koulutusmateriaaleista, koulutimme peruskoulussa 120 lasta, järjestimme yhden työpajan 5 opettajan kouluttamiseksi käyttämään koulutusmateriaaleja sekä järjestimme iltapäiväohjelman 8 viikon ajaksi 12 murrosikäiselle.


Keräämämme rahat käytetään oppimateriaalin luomiseen ja projektin toimintakuluihin, joita ovat internet-, sähkö- ja luokkahuoneiden vuokrauskulut. Projektihenkilöstölle ei makseta palkkoja. Työskentely perustuu vapaaehtoisuuteen.

YASH- projektin järjestäminen  yhdelle instituutiolle maksaa noin 600 euroa. Mitä enemmän rahaa onnistumme keräämään,  sitä enemmän kouluja ja organisaatioita pystymme ottamaan projektiin mukaan. Tämän joukkorahoituskamppanijan tavoite on 5000€  mutta sen ollekka joustava tavoite olemme tyytyväisiä, jos saavutamme 2000€ tavoitteen.

Aiomme järjestää YASH-projektin niin moniin instituutioihin kuin saavuttavamme budjetti sallii. Nämä laitokset ovat peruskouluja ja nuorten kanssa työskenteleviä paikallisia organisaatioita.

Jokainen instituutio, jonka kanssa työskentelemme tulee 

1. Vastaanota opintosuunnitelmamme ja oppimateriaalimme.

2. Järjestämme työpajoja ammattilaisille näissä instituutioissa ja opastamme heitä käyttämään materiaaleja askel askeleelta. 

3. Järjestämme kattavan YASH-koulutusprojektin  heidänopiskelijoilleen. 

4. Seuraa ja auta heitä jatkamaan seksuaalikasvatuksen järjestämistä tulevaisuudessa.

Päätavoitteemme on että projektissa mukana olevat instituutiot alkaisivat järjestämään kattavaa seksuaalikasvatusta näissä laitoksissa pysyvästi.

 

 

 

Karolina Lahti:Sosionomi, video artisti ja YASH-projektin perustaja. Vaikka työni tällä hetkellä on videotuotannon parissa, sosionomi-opinnot veivät minut ensimmäistä kertaa Ghanaan vuonna 2017. Tein seksuaalikasvatusta koskevan opinnäytetyöni yhteistyössä paikallisen samoihin aiheisiin keskittyvän organisaation SCEF: n kanssa. opinnäytetyöni valmistuttua päätimme testata oppimaamme paikallisissa kouluissa ja organisaatioissa, ja näin syntyi erittäin onnistunein tuloksin YASH. 

Eugene Ufoka: Sosionomi, ihmisoikeusaktivisti ja YASH-projektin projektipäällikkö. Olen syntynyt Kamerunissa pienessä rannikkokaupungissa nimeltään Tiko. Intohimoni on tehdä maailmasta parempi paikka elää. Olen sitoutunut tehtävääni saada aikaan oikeudenmukaisempi ja tasa-arvoisempi yhteiskunta, jossa ei ole sukupuolten ja rotujen eriarvoisuutta.

Paul Semeh:Yhteiskuntatieteiden kandidaatti, Street Children Empowerment - organisaation perustaja ja YASH-hankkeen pääpartneri Ghanassa. Johdan Street Children Empowerment -säätiötä (SCEF) Ghanassa. Olen intohimoinen ihmisoikeuksien ja inhimilliseen kehitykseen liittyvien asioiden puolustaja.


 

 

 

YASH pyrkii saavuttamaan korkeat tavoitteet 6 kuukauden aikana suhteellisen pienellä budjetilla. YASH on varautunut jatkamaan hanketta vielä pari kuukautta yli alkuperäisen aikataulun tarvitsematta lisäbudjettia.

YASH on kehitysyhteistyöhanke, joka toimii eri kulttuureissa. Yhteistyössä eri kulttuurien kesken on aina väärinymmärryksen riski, etenkin kun käsitellään vaikeita aiheita, kuten seksuaalisuutta. YASH kunnioittaa paikallista kulttuuria ja yrittää välttää haitallisia väärinkäsityksiä ja kulttuurikonflikteja kuuntelemalla, pohtimalla, keräämällä palautetta ja pysyttelemällä rauhallisena vaikeissakin tilanteissa.

Seuraa meitä Instagramissa, Facebookissa tai käy verkkosivuillamme. Karolina Lahti vastaa myös mielellään kaikkiin kysymyksiisi. Voit sopia Skype-puhelun hänen kanssaan tai tavoittaa sähköpostitse karolina@lina.media
story_txt:
*Please find text in Finnish bellow*   We are fighting against one of the biggest challenges which teenagers are facing in Ghana, poor sexual health. A huge amount of adolescents aged between 12 - 19 have faced issues like early and unintended pregnancies, HIV/AIDS/ sexually transmitted Infections and sexual abuse. With YASH project, we aim to bring sexuality education to local schools and organisations in Ghana with the goal to increase their human sexual rights for information and equation and therefore significantly increase their sexual health.Our crowdfunding goal is 5000€ but as it is a flexible goal we are happy if we achieve a goal of 2000€ which enables us to create the updated study materials and organise YASH education in schools and afternoon programs. The more money we get the more schools and organisations we are able to take on board. Organising comprehensive YASH program for one institution costs around 600€.YASH is an art based sex education project delivering sex education in multiple different ways for the most vulnerable adolescents in our planet. We concentrate in urban slum areas in Africa starting from Ghana’s Capital city’s Accra’s neighborhoods Nima and Jamestown.We are looking to educate school students and teachers in primary schools, vulnerable adolescents who don't go to schools in afternoon programs in cooperation with local NGOs as well as organise sex education workshops in the project areas among the professionals from healthcare, social work, politics and education. We have created the study materials for the program in cooperation with a local organisation using trusted research methods and by testing the materials in practice. Throughout the time we have modified the materials to serve  the needs of these local communities.                                                                 1. We believe the change starts with empowering individuals and vulnerable communities . YASH offers support and guidance for the most vulnerable adolescents in our planet to give them stronger life skills for their future and to enable their human sexual right to information and education. YASH involves the local communities in every step of the project.  YASH does always cultural research about every community it works in and aims to respond to their individual needs.  YASH's core value is to be community-orientated by working directly on the grassroot level with the local families and professionals.2. High-quality education is the most important thing driving the healthy development of our humanity. Communities, where sex education does not exist, are often struggling with problems such as teenage pregnancies, school dropouts, sexual abuses, and poor sexual and reproductive health. Sex education is the number one prevention tool for these issues. 3. Sexuality education promotes sustainability. In the neighborhoods we chose to run YASH in we have rapidly growing populations while the living conditions are remaining poor. Reproductive health plays a big role in increasing these people’s life quality. When a big percentage of girls drop out of school at an early age it creates a bigger gender gap with an impact on the whole economy of the country.     With the first YASH project in 2017, we created the first versions of all the YASH education materials, educated 120 children in a primary school, organised one workshop to train 5 teachers to use our sex education materials  and organised an 8 weeks long afternoon program for 12 adolescents.The money we are raising this time goes to the creation of the study material and to the project operational costs, like transport, internet, electricity and classroom rental. Salaries will not be paid and all the workforce in the project will work voluntarily. Organising comprehensive YASH program for one institution costs around 600€.  The amount of money we are able to raise in this crowdfunding will have an immediate impact on how many organisations we will be organising YASH project for. Our crowdfunding goal is 5000€ but as it is a flexible goal we are happy if we achieve a goal of 2000€ We will go to organise YASH project in as many institutions as the budget allows us. These institutions are primary schools and local organisations working with adolescents.  Each institution we work with will:1. Receive our study curriculum and study materials.2. We will organise workshops for the professionals in these institutions and l walk them through how to use the materials step by step3. We will organise comprehensive YASH education project for their students4. Follow up and help them to continue organising sexuality education in the future.Our main goal is to implement comprehensive sexuality education in these institutions permanently.                                                                                                                                      Karolina Lahti: Bachelor of social services, a  visual artist  and the founder of the YASH project. While my career has kept me involved with art and videography, my studies brought me to Ghana for the first time in 2017, where I worked on my Thesis on sexual education in cooperation with SCEF, a local NGO focused on the same topics. As my work evolved, we decided to test what we learned in the local schools and organisations and that is how, following very successful results, YASH was born. Eugene Ufoka: Bachelor of social services, human rights activist and project manager of the YASH project. I'm born in a small coastal city called Tiko in the southwest of former British Southern Cameroons. I'm passionate about making the world a better place. I m committed in the mission to achieve a more fair and equal society closing the gender and race inequalities in the world.Paul Semeh: Bachelor of social science, the founder of the Street Children Empowerment Foundation and the main partner for the YASH project in Ghana. I founded and lead the Street Children Empowerment Foundation (SCEF) in Ghana and I am passionate about Safeguarding, human rights, and human development-related areas.  
  YASH is aiming to achieve high goals in 6 months' time with a relatively low budget.  YASH is prepared to extend the project for a couple more months if needed without needing a bigger budget. YASH is a development cooperation project, working within different cultures. When cooperating between  different cultures there is always a risk for misunderstandings, especially when dealing with difficult topics such as sexuality. YASH is designed with cultural sensitivity to respect the local culture and will try to avoid harmful misunderstandings and cultural conflicts by simply listening, reflecting, collecting feedback, and keeping calm in difficult situations. Follow us in Instagram, Facebook or visit our website. Karolina Lahti is also more than happy to reply to any questions you may have. You can schedule a Skype call with her or reach out through an email karolina@lina.media  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*Teksti Suomeksi * Suomenkieliseen videoon pääset täältä  Yksi suurin haaste joka vaikeuttaa nuorten elämää Ghanassa on heikko seksuaaliterveys.  Länsi Afrikassa 12–19-vuotiaiden nuorten keskuudessa varhaiset tai tahattomat raskaudet, HIV / AIDS / sukupuolitaudit ja seksuaaliset hyväksikäytöt ovet yleinen syy peruskoulun keskeytymiseen.YASH on taidelähtöinen seksuaalikasvatus projekti jonka tavoitteena on tarjota kokonaisvaltaista seksuaalikasvatusta kaikkein haavoittuvimmassa asemassa oleville nuorille. story:
App

Junipr immediately and securely matches people who are threatened with nearby people who will take action as allies and provide safe spaces. It is not a replacement for local emergency services — it’s a community-based response to aggression.

You can request Refuge at a nearby safe space, and Junipr will direct you to the closest locations. You can request an Ally at three different levels of urgency, and Juniper will send a request to nearby vetted Allies. And you can be an Ally to others by responding to those requests and helping others.

Use Junipr to find an ally or be an ally. Ride the bus together, pee in safety, welcome a vulnerable neighbor into your business.

 

Features

Security. Our team is working with some of the world’s top experts in information security to help us meet the highest standards of security and privacy. From industry standard encryption to full penetration testing to careful decisions on what data we will and will not ever collect, we’re prioritizing your privacy in every feature decision we make.

Anonymity + Vetting. No identifying information is disclosed about you until both the Requestor and the Ally have mutually accepted the Request. You can, however, add visible tags that allow others to help you better. (For example, if you need a Refuge with wheelchair access.) 

You can create a profile with a default name of Junipr or June. Connect to your Facebook, or don’t. You can immediately ask for help. 

To become one of our initial Refuges, apply to be connected with one of our Safe Spaces program partners, or to be vetted through your existing community reputation.

Our initial V1 phase of development will focus on Refuges and will not support Allies. Our V2 phase will roll out a system for vetting individuals’ accounts without causing privacy concerns. (Want the V2 to come out faster? Help us exceed our fundraising goals!)

If you’ve been connected through a Request, you’ll be able to answer the question, “Was this Ally or Refuge safe?” Answering “Yes” adds +1 to their reputation. Answering “No” removes their vetted status. When you say someone isn’t a safe person, we believe you.  

Location aware. Junipr uses location to connect you to the nearest Refuges and Allies. You’ll need to give the app access to your location when it’s running, if you’re Requesting help. If you’re an Ally or Refuge the app will always need location awareness. We will take every effort to protect both your privacy and your battery life.

Mobile. Junipr works on both iOS and Android. It supports the US only. 

 

Community

Training. When someone makes a Request for help, they’re already in a stressed situation. Our system moves the burden of making observations and decisions to the Ally or the Refuge. Therefore, we need to support our Allies and Refuges with information and training on how to handle the situations they’ll encounter. Most of our community resources will be directed at those who help. When Allies and Refuges accept a Request for help, Junipr will also show cards of actionable, easy-to-read support information. 

Diversity. From Day 1 our team has been in constant communication with user groups across multiple diverse communities, including the LGBTQ+, disabled, African American, and immigrant communities in several US states; many members of our team are also members of those communities. Your voices have informed every major decision we’ve made, and will continue to do so.

Partnerships. We’re creating nationwide partnerships with safe spaces programs and local partnerships with small businesses and community organizations. Join us! Reach out through the IndieGoGo messaging system and we’ll connect with your business or organization.

Hashtags. What does #I'mwithJune, #I'mwithJunipr, #JuniprsFriend, and #JunesFriend mean? This is how an Allies who have never met can find each other: by asking, "Are you June's friend?" or "Are you with Junipr?” (Our LGBTQ youth user group spontaneously started using this when we asked them about the name "Junipr!")

 

Funds

We have self-funded $10,000.00, and have a team of 14 volunteers in the US. This has covered our tech demo, architecture design, UX design, branding, and video. 

Our development and hosting partners have estimated a cost of $110,000.00 to complete development on the first stage of the app: Safe Spaces. Development time is estimated at 16 weeks.

This will also allow us to provide support and training materials to Refuges and Allies. 

Exceeding our goal will allow us to develop the second stage: Allies.

If the IndieGoGo campaign doesn’t fund enough to complete our first stage of development, we will keep fundraising and our volunteers keep working to get this app into people’s hands. We will make sure that Junipr is always free.

Even if you can’t donate right now, here’s how you can help –

Share! Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Help us get the word out there.

Like Ram Dass said – We’re all just walking each other home.

 

Team

This project started two days after the Election. Our COO put signs in her yard welcoming everyone to a safe space, which caused our CEO a moment of terror followed by, “What if there was an app where you could do the same thing anonymously…”

We have all seen countless videos of and articles about people who have been harassed for being a different color, from a different place, of a different faith, a different identity, or who love differently than those who hate and fear them. We wanted to have an answer to the question:

What can I DO about this?

Juniper Family is a nonprofit incorporated in the state of Washington, currently filing for 501(c)3 status. Our team is made of people who are passionate about keeping their friends and family safe. We also have world-class experience in mobile development, information security, and non-profit leadership.

We’re a baker’s dozen of security professionals, project and product managers, front and back end developers and architects, community advocates, graphic designers, artists, and The Dread Pirate Rad Beard.

We are the targeted. We are allies. We’re June’s friends.

 

 

No one should feel afraid because of who they are.
story_txt: AppJunipr immediately and securely matches people who are threatened with nearby people who will take action as allies and provide safe spaces. It is not a replacement for local emergency services — it’s a community-based response to aggression.You can request Refuge at a nearby safe space, and Junipr will direct you to the closest locations. You can request an Ally at three different levels of urgency, and Juniper will send a request to nearby vetted Allies. And you can be an Ally to others by responding to those requests and helping others.Use Junipr to find an ally or be an ally. Ride the bus together, pee in safety, welcome a vulnerable neighbor into your business. FeaturesSecurity. Our team is working with some of the world’s top experts in information security to help us meet the highest standards of security and privacy. From industry standard encryption to full penetration testing to careful decisions on what data we will and will not ever collect, we’re prioritizing your privacy in every feature decision we make.Anonymity + Vetting. No identifying information is disclosed about you until both the Requestor and the Ally have mutually accepted the Request. You can, however, add visible tags that allow others to help you better. (For example, if you need a Refuge with wheelchair access.) You can create a profile with a default name of Junipr or June. Connect to your Facebook, or don’t. You can immediately ask for help. To become one of our initial Refuges, apply to be connected with one of our Safe Spaces program partners, or to be vetted through your existing community reputation.Our initial V1 phase of development will focus on Refuges and will not support Allies. story:
WHAT

In April, RAaW are filming a series of high quality, professional standard, short films with our students, in order to create showreels to launch their careers in the industry. 

Many of these films are about important issues including sexual abuse, mental health, drug abuse and cancer. These will be done both subtly and overtly, enabling taboo subjects to be discussed and explored. 

An example of one of these is 'Grow old together', a beautiful short about Daisy, who's best friend is terminally ill from cancer, and how her boyfriend, Jamie, helps her through it. 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We are a self-funded company, and as it stands are unable to fund the films this year.

The money you donate to us will go towards:

  • Paying crew
  • Paying for locations
  • Buying food for the cast and crew
  • Paying a photographer to take stills

THE IMPACT:

These films will be edited together to make a showreel for each of our students. A showreel is extremely important to help launch their careers in the industry, providing Casting Directors with a quick and clear demonstration of an actor's talent and range. An example of some of RAaW's showreels can be seen here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4iIcAi9HaxdMkWMEFgxys09vESJhG_Vf

ABOUT RAAW:

RAaW London is an award winning film and theatre company specialising in a range of genre's including thrillers, urban, realistic and issue led film and theatre. RAaW also have a very established film and theatre training arm for children and young people.

RAaW has made some beautiful films in the past, and wishes to continue this year. You can see see some on this page, or all of them here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4iIcAi9HaxeLdngvGcdbTXEvJzFU9GXJ

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP: 

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute. However, you can still help! By sharing our campaign on your social media you will help us to spread the word and find those who can. 

THANK YOU! AS MUCH OR AS LITTLE AS YOU CAN DONATE IS A HUGE HELP TO US!

story:
Background

For years, ISPs needed a way to get around having to ask for your permission to sell your private data. ISPs knew that if they could figure out a way to sell your secrets, it would make them even richer. So ISPs sent their lobbyists to Congress to buy influence and votes.

Then it finally happened: Congress recently voted to repeal rules that, before, prevented ISPs from selling your private browsing data without your consent. Your private data--everything you have ever done on the internet--is now for sale.

It is your move.

 

 

 

You have one option: you can still opt out your data-- if you do, ISPs are legally prohibited from selling it. But do you know how to do that (or want to spend the time trying to figure it out)?

The Solution

We built a way to automatically opt out your private browsing data, so that you don't have to pull your hair out trying to figure it out on your own. However, we're taking your privacy a step further:

 

 

 

 

1. We will permanently opt out your data with all major ISPs, including--

- Comcast

- Spectrum(Time Warner)

- Cox

- Verizon

- Sprint

- AT&T

- T-Mobile

..and any others you request. We will even pre-emptively perform our opt-out service if you don't have an account with these providers!

2. We will monitor ISPs, and alert you when they abuse your data

 

Did you know, that Verizon stored 6 million customer records on a publicly available, totally open server? These records included account credentials and passcodes-- enough for anyone to get into any of these accounts and discover personal financial information as well as make changes to the account.

If you are a Verizon customer, this may be the first time you are hearing about this, because Verizon hasn't said a word to its customers, despite knowing about this problem for over a month. 

This kind of sloppiness from ISPs isn't new. In fact, there's a good chance they'll expose your data again. And now, when they slip up, it won't just be your Verizon account info-- it could be your entire internet history. Next time, however, we will be watching. And we will personally let you know if your data is in jeopardy, and what you can do to protect yourself.

3. Half of All the Money We Raise Goes Into A Legal Fund That Will Bankroll Civil Cases When and If ISPs Violate Your Privacy

Although monitoring ISPs is good, privacy protection is not a spectator sport. When ISPs violate your privacy, you want to take action. However, these Service Providers have stacked the deck, making fighting back expensive and time consuming.

That's why half of the money we raise will go directly into a legal fund. When we(or you, or anyone else) detects that your data is being abused, we will be prepared to immediately  launch and bankroll a civil case on your behalf. 

 

 

 

 

How It Works

1. Opting Out 

ISPs are required to opt you out. ISPs are not required to make opting out easy. Comcast is already making you opt out in three separate places before you are fully protected.

However, the FTC doesn't state that they have to opt you if you jump through the ISPs hoops. It states they have to opt you out if you request it.

So what's the most effective way to request an opt out?

In a previous organization, we spent over five years helping people break predatory cell phone contracts. And we found out the quickest way to communicate with ISPs is to ignore all the "channels" they've set up and just send them a demand letter. 

So that's what we're doing here. We will build you a demand letter, and continue sending that letter to your ISP until they acknowledge your opt out request.

It's that simple.

2. ISP Watchdogs

How can you tell when an ISP is selling your data?

The short answer is: you can't. Not really.

But, there are a few warning signs we can check. And most importantly, we're not going it alone-- organizations like the Electronic Frontier Foundation, Fight For the Future, and the Electronic Privacy Information Center have been on the fronts lines of this battle for years. They've exposed ISP programs in the past and brought to light the privacy violations of hundreds of millions of individuals.

We can get insights into ISP tracking programs using data like public financial filings, looking at phone software, and other efforts. However, we will also be following other experienced organizations, and can notify whenever their discoveries also affect you.

3. The Legal Fund

This one's simple: we find evidence of data abuse, or you find evidence of data abuse. You reach out to us. We bankroll your case, help you find representation, and submit all information we uncover as evidence for your lawyer.

After this campaign ends, we will maintain the fund by taking a small contingency fee on any cases we win.

It's a win-win -- your data is protected, and you are compensated for any breach of privacy-- without any personal risk. We can maintain this project, and fund other cool ideas, like a tool that tracks what Congress is looking at online.

 

Data Collection Means More Than Just Targeted Ads

At this point, you may be wondering, "This isn't great, but they can only get high level data. isn't what Google and Facebook are doing far worse?"

Alternately, you may be thinking,"I don't really mind if ISPs use my data for targeted advertising. What are the risks to me if they can distribute my data?"

These are fair questions. 

Question 1: Can ISPs get more than just high level data on my internet traffic patterns?

The answer, unequivocally, is YES. 

When a single entity(like an ISP) controls all of your communication with the internet, that entity can bypass even the end-to-end encryption(aka https) that many websites use to protect you. 

This isn't a theoretical possibility-- ISPs have already done once this before. Actually, make that twice before. 

In fact, some companies, like ZScaler, offer a service that does exactly that-- it operates by routing all your traffic through their router(like an ISP would) and bypassing your encryption, allowing them to monitor all your data. Many companies use this service to monitor what their employees are doing online.

Question 2: Why should I care if my ISP sells my data?

Now that you know that ISPs can access all of your data-- including bank details, searches, texts, emails, medical records, social security info, credit score, shopping habits, travel habits, job, political views, sexuality, kinks-- basically all of the information thats make you, you, the behavior of these ISPs may seem more sinister. 

Indeed, when corporations have access to all this, they tend not to discriminate in who they sell it to. That means that search about a persistent cough? That time you looked up online whether or not you were undercooking your beef? Or even the weird rash you had a month ago-- these searches could now end up in the hands of your insurance provider. 

And based on this incomplete(and irrelevant) information, they could change the medical coverage they offer you.

Your bank, credit agencies, even current or future employers could get ahold of this data. Don't let them use it to run your life.

Tell Your ISP "No" (And Remember That ISPs Are No Longer Required To Ask)

So take action now!

This is a different kind of crowdfunding campaign, so we want to be clear why your contribution matters. It matters for three reasons:

  1. Your contribution to this campaign solves your problem (the problem of ISPs trying to sell your private data).
     
  2. Your contribution to this campaign helps fund another project inspired by Congress's recent vote: we built a way to get Congress' browser history--and we know it works, because it is already available!
     
  3. Your contribution to this campaign helps fund a new legal fund Veeto is setting up exclusively for Veeto members, and this is how it works: let's suppose an ISP tries to ignore a Veeto members' opt-out request...this legal fund could then be used to bankroll litigation against that ISP.

By default, Congress has made it lawful for ISPs to assume that you are OK with them selling your private browsing data (even though you are probably not OK with this). And the only way you can stop ISPs from selling your data is by sending your ISP a legal notice that you are choosing to opt out your private data from being sold.

If you do this correctly, ISPs will no longer have lawful permission to sell your private browsing data.

But most people do not know how to do this. In fact, I bet that most people have still not done it, even though their private data is now exposed. And this is not because people do not want to opt out; it is because, unless you have some experience in this area, you probably fall somewhere on a spectrum of "I have no clue how to do this" to "I do not have the time to try to figure this out on my own."

To make it dead-simple, Veeto (that's us) will use our legal-demand automation app to send your ISP a legal notice that you are opting out your private data.

Simple not being easy, of course, we have put a ton of work into modifying the app to solve this particular problem (hopefully for thousands of people). So we are asking for a contribution of $10 or more in exchange for opting out your data.

(Also this is how we have been able to build, and also how we will be able to maintain, the tool that gets Congress' browser history, without having to ask for donations to support that project; it is a self-funded project, and we are happy to make it available, which is why we really appreciate your support now of this campaign).

How you can support this campaign?

Share. Share. Share. And share. Seriously, more important than your monetary support is your endorsement to people who know, like and trust you. If you want to support what we are doing here, our primary ask is that you share the campaign.

Second, if you do not want ISPs to be able to sell your data, contribute $10 or more, and let us do the dirty work or opting you out.

Lastly, if you have comments about what we are doing, how we have presented the information here, or how we might be able to do more good for more people, please leave a comment. We will read every single comment, whether words of affirmation or honest criticism.

This is a unique kind of cause in that our target audience is anyone in the US who uses the internet. That is a much larger audience than most crowdfunding campaigns, and we take very seriously the fact that, should this campaign not hit its mark, the consequence would not merely be that our gadget or widget will not be manufactured; rather, the consequence would be something far more important: the ISPs will have gotten away with selling the secrets of millions of Americans whose lives and prospects could be damaged as a result.

Thank you for trusting us with the defense of this right today.

- Jon and Matt, Veeto

And this is not because people do not want to opt out; it is because, unless you have some experience in this area, you probably fall somewhere on a spectrum of "I have no clue how to do this" to "I do not have the time to try to figure this out on my own."To make it dead-simple, Veeto (that's us) will use our legal-demand automation app to send your ISP a legal notice that you are opting out your private data.Simple not being easy, of course, we have put a ton of work into modifying the app to solve this particular problem (hopefully for thousands of people). So we are asking for a contribution of $10 or more in exchange for opting out your data.(Also this is how we have been able to build, and also how we will be able to maintain, the tool that gets Congress' browser history, without having to ask for donations to support that project; it is a self-funded project, and we are happy to make it available, which is why we really appreciate your support now of this campaign).How you can support this campaign?Share. Share. Share. And share. Seriously, more important than your monetary support is your endorsement to people who know, like and trust you. If you want to support what we are doing here, our primary ask is that you share the campaign.Second, if you do not want ISPs to be able to sell your data, contribute $10 or more, and let us do the dirty work or opting you out.Lastly, if you have comments about what we are doing, how we have presented the information here, or how we might be able to do more good for more people, please leave a comment. We will read every single comment, whether words of affirmation or honest criticism.This is a unique kind of cause in that our target audience is anyone in the US who uses the internet. That is a much larger audience than most crowdfunding campaigns, and we take very seriously the fact that, should this campaign not hit its mark, the consequence would not merely be that our gadget or widget will not be manufactured; rather, the consequence would be something far more important: the ISPs will have gotten away with selling the secrets of millions of Americans whose lives and prospects could be damaged as a result.Thank you for trusting us with the defense of this right today.- Jon and Matt, Veeto

story:
The LGTBQ+ Youth Legislative Theatre Project is civic engagement at its best with a creative twist: employing interactive theatre to directly impact policy change on a local as well as potentially state and national levels.

Your voice is needed in this practice of true democracy!

The Mandala Center for Change proudly launches this project aimed at public education and social change around the issues faced by LGTBQ+ youth – an underrepresented population, especially on government and policy-making levels. Legislative Theatre has been effectively used to steer laws and policies around the world.  Inclusive, fun, dynamic and participatory!


LEGISLATIVE THEATRE: A THREE-STEP PROCESS

1 - The project kicks off this August 2017 with a 5-day Theatre of the Oppressed (TO) workshop for 20 youth (ages 14-20), who self-identify as LGBTQ+. Participants will be guided by Marc Weinblatt, a world-renowned TO facilitator and founder of the Mandala Center, and assisted by Tanner DeLuna, a youth leader, activist, and emerging TO practitioner. The youth will explore their struggles through dynamic creative processes and identify real threats to themselves and their community. 

2 - Through personal story sharing youth will create a short play depicting their real-life struggles. This play will be presented in two interactive theatre performances for the general public and invited legislators/policy makers on September 25 & 26, 2017. 

Each performance will include a community forum where audience members come on stage to take over a character and improvise solutions to the issues presented by the youth.

3 - Finally both youth and audience will propose policy ideas and vote on the laws they want to see passed in a theatrical mock legislature. Legislators and other policy makers who have the power to create the change will see and hear first-hand the problems faced by the youth and the community’s solutions to address them.


THE ROOTS OF LEGISLATIVE THEATRE

Developed by Brazilian visionary and Nobel Prize nominee, Augusto Boal, Legislative Theatre is part of his famous Theatre of the Oppressed (TO). TO is used all over the world for social and political activism, conflict resolution, community building, therapy, and government legislation. It is practiced globally on a grassroots level by community organizers, activists, teachers, social workers, cultural animators, and more.

The Mandala Center for Change, along with its founder, Marc Weinblatt, is one of the most experienced and long-standing hubs for the training and grassroots practice of Theatre of the Oppressed in the world. Founded in 1999, the Mandala Center is a multi-disciplinary arts education organization dedicated to community dialogue, social justice, and societal transformation.


RIPPLES OF IMPACT

Not only will this project cultivate a way for LGBTQ+ youth to bond and express their experiences in a supportive, safe space; it will create a platform for the local community and its legislators to directly change laws -- youth, adults, allies, and policy-makers working together.

It also gives youth an opportunity to participate in a true democratic process and an experiential knowledge of how the legislative process works.

And we know it works...because of the success of Mandala Center’s previous Legislative Theatre projects: Youth Legislative Theatre project in Clallam County, WA on the failure of the education system (2016) and our Legislative Theatre project on Healthcare Access and Affordability in Jefferson County, WA (2015).

Take it from the Jefferson County Hospital Commissioner, in office 44 years, Anthony DeLeo: "This was the most effective community dialogue on healthcare I have ever attended."
 

YOUR MONEY AT WORK FOR SOCIAL CHANGE

The success of this project depends on the support of individuals like you. The youth are ready to dive in, the facilitators are eager to begin, grant proposals are being written, PR is underway, legislators are being contacted... now it's your turn to get involved and support grassroots social change driven by the voices of creative, powerful young people and their allies.

Your financial contribution will support a percentage of our $12,000 budget. Along with basics like administrative costs, facilitator fees, production costs, and marketing materials, we are also dedicated to providing youth stipends, food for participants during the project, and an accessible public venue for two evenings of Legislative Theatre performances so anyone who is interested in supporting this issue can attend.
 

It is time for unheard voices to be expressed. It is time for policy-makers to listen. Join us and make this exploration a call to action!
Thank you for your support.

story: Sekou Kambui spent forty years behind bars as a political prisoner, and now he needs our help! The former Panther, CORE, and SCLC member was diagnosed with liver cancer shortly after his release, and has been in and out of the hospital for cancer treatment as well as other health problems, including severe edema in his leg. The edema requires almost weekly trips to the hospital to have fluid drained from his leg, an expense in time and money he can't afford. Though chemotherapy has produced encouraging results so far, the medical bills keep piling up. Despite his poor health, Sekou has continued his work with the organization he founded in prison, the Social Consciousness Development Group, and has continued to speak publicly on behalf of U.S. Political Prisoners. Now he needs our support to get through the trying times ahead. Help Sekou Kambui continue his long fight for justice in good health!

story:
GROW ACTION

Grow Action want to rise a support network for refugees that aims to integrate them in their income country, to awake their human potential through the power of entrepreneurship.

Grow Action breaks with the asistencialist approach of humanitarian help and it works as an organization that promotes an integral companionship for the families in their immediate needs and also in their future development. We believe that acknowledging their rights and human potential, and giving opportunities is how families can actually get an effective and long lasting develpment.  

How do we do it?

We do this through an Inclusion program called Let's Grow, where refugees will get emotional support, and legal support and then a program of entrepreneurship called Let's Act, where migrants will get workshops, and the possibility to apply for a seed capital.  

Our Impact

Through this initiative you’ll help us to support every person’s right to be recognized, included, valued by their skills, and empowered by a network of partner organizations and institutions committed to advise their entrepreneurial journey.

In this sense, our program Let's Grow is customed for each family through networking, legal support, participation of cultural activities from their host country.  This program will be the primary support platform for the families involved can start their enterprises.

Then, they will be part of the program Let's Act which want to link them with others institutions like Incubators, Business training, Government institutions, Seed Capital and crowdfunding, so that they can co-build new business ideas and entrepreneurships to obtain their own income using their own abilities.

We want to make the difference

 

1. We have an integral approach with our programs which include emotional support and also an opportunity of income offering  long and short term solution.

 

2. Our process are inclusive since we also work with ex refugees to tell their stories, and do workshops inspire and train other migrant families.


3. Our organization co-builds the services from the abilities of the families

 

                      Our Team                      

Karla Araya (CHI) - Felipe Espinoza (CHI) - Constanza Garcés (CHI) - Daniela Hoyos (COL)

We are an interdisciplinary group of students and professionals from Universidad de la Frontera, Chile. We believe that the full integration of refugees in their host country is possible, and it’s an opportunity to value diversity.
