You can see more about us at www.ecountabl.com, including our founding story and my 2020 Letter to Prospective Investors describing the next-generation business tools we're building to help companies and their customers improve society together.
So much has happened since that morning more than three years ago and we're closer than ever to bringing ecountabl to life. On behalf of the whole team: Thanks so much for your generosity and support, and I hope to see you out there on this amazing journey.
Andy Burr, Co-Founder & CEOOct. 7, 2020

story:
Healing Architecture – a pilot project                             Deutsche Version siehe unten  :-) 

 

Home4Kids Children Village Philippines

Not just hurricanes constantly hit the Philippines creating suffering. Many Philippine children are treated badly at home. They prefer to make their own way on the street, rather than staying in suppressive conditions. Thousands of children take this courageous step but then suffer physically and mentally in the daily struggle for survival.

My friends Katherine, Marie and Sara were in the Philippines and are determined to take care of these children. They founded the 'Home4Kids' initiative, registered in Austria*. 

 

They asked me to design a children's home that would suit these children and this country.

To face the dramatic situation of these children and give them space to heal, I am addressing you.

 

We need your help to give our help

I already designed the draft of the universal ‘mother ship’, where 32 children will live, play and learn, in January and donated it to the initiative and the children.  

At least 7 buildings are to be built: children's houses, a school, a dining room, accommodations/ guest houses and a garden where the children help to grow their own organic vegetables.

 

Now it’s about realizing the next steps. For the construction process and further designs, it is important to be onsite. 

We ask You for financial support for travel expenses and accommodation for my team and myself so that we can start.

4500, - are required.

 

Help us with your donation, select a perk and get excited to see Home4Kids and Healing Architecture grow.  

 

The Impact

When I heard from my friends about the situation in the Philippines, their perspective on these children and their creative vision for them, I gained a new insight on 'global responsibility'. 

We want to make our contribution to help these street children grow into confident, successful and happy individuals that achieve their goals in life.
 

"Problems can never be solved with the same mindset that created them…

     The only real valuable thing is intuition.“                        Albert Einstein

 

Each of my architecture projects has brought forth new methods. I became aware of systematic steps for the intuitive approach to finding house solutions. This systematic intuition can be transferred into other fields of life and I have been teaching it for many years in different countries.**

I am used to the experience of my customers that the buildings thus constructed have stress releasing and creativity-enhancing effects. This gives a hope.

How architecture can have a healing impact on traumatized children is the new challenge in this project. 

The Home4Kids in the Philippines is the pilot project for other children's villages with this approach in other parts of the world.

 

My upcoming book “Intuitive -Holistic-Architecture“ is an experience report. With the help of practical examples from architecture, I draw up intuitive approaches for every field of life. Possibly also in Your area?

This project with the special needs of this children’s should give new insights.

 

How can we make a change finding deeper and more sustainable ways to help children worldwide?

Please give Your contribution! 

Find Your perk!

 

Every CENT counts!


 

Further Ways You Can Help

• You are also welcome to join us building or help with childcare: workshops accompany the work. The intuitive practice of "Systematic Intuition" flows into every work and design step.

• Please spread the word! Share this page on your facebook and twitter and other pages and tell your friends -  go crazy!

• Organize a workshop or lecture about Home4Kids, Healing Architecture or Practical Intuition in your town – School, Culture Center, Philosophical Cafe etc. 

We are currently traveling to spread the word to make it possible.

 

Lastly, as soon as the fund reaches 50% percentage we will get the message and START! Please donate and help us to start soon!

Lectures already support the project.

5% of the book's proceeds are also earmarked for the children's village.

10% of other architectural projects.



 

Thank you for your support!  

 

 

*Home4Kids,  Registered association in Austria: ZVR number 1235413876

 

**www.reinhard-coppenrath-architecture.com 



 

Just contact us 00491781709540 

Facebook: Reinhard Coppenrath

 

*****************************************************************************

 

DEUTSCH

 

Healing Architecture - ein Pilotprojekt

 

Home4Kids Kinderdorf Philippinen

Die Philippinen sind nicht nur ständig von Hurrikans und Unwettern betroffen, die Leid verursachen. Viele philippinische Kinder werden zu Hause missbraucht. Sie ziehen es vor, ihren eigenen Weg auf der Straße zu gehen, anstatt in der Unterdrückung zu Hause zu bleiben. Tausende Kinder machen diesen mutigen Schritt, leiden dann aber körperlich und seelisch im täglichen Überlebenskampf.

Meine Freundinnen Katherine, Marie und Sara waren auf den Philippinen und sind entschlossen, sich diesen Kindern anzunehmen. Sie haben die Initiative ‚Home4Kids‘ in Österreich* gegründet.

 

Sie haben mich darum gebeten ein Kinderheim zu entwerfen, das zu diesen Kindern und zu diesem Land passt.

 

Um der dramatischen Situation dieser Kinder zu begegnen und ihnen Raum zum Heilen zu geben, bitte ich Euch um Unterstützung.

 

Damit wir helfen können, brauchen wir eure Hilfe

Ich habe bereits den Entwurf des universellen „Mutterschiffs“ entwickelt, in dem 32 Kinder leben, spielen und lernen werden. Den Entwurf habe ich bereits der Initiative und den Kindern gespendet.

Es sollen mindestens 7 Gebäude gebaut werden: Kinderhäuser, eine Schule, ein Speisesaal, Gästehäuser und ein Garten, in dem die Kinder ihr eigenes Bio-Gemüse anbauen.

 

Jetzt geht es darum, die nächsten Schritte zu realisieren. Für den Bauprozess und weitere Entwürfe ist es wichtig, vor Ort zu sein.

 

Wir bitten Dich um finanzielle Unterstützung für mein Team und mich – Reisekosten und Unterkunft - damit wir vor Ort beginnen können.

 

4500, - sind erforderlich.

Hilf uns mit Deiner Spende und freu Dich darauf zu sehen, wie wir Healing Architektur umsetzen und Home4Kids wächst.

 

Der Impact

Als ich von meinen Freundinnen über die Situation auf den Philippinen hörte, ihre Sicht auf diese Kinder und ihre Vision für sie kennen lernte, bekam ich einen neuen Einblick in „globale Verantwortung“.

 

Wir möchten unseren Beitrag dazu leisten, dass diese Straßenkinder zu selbstbewussten, erfolgreichen und glücklichen Menschen werden, die ihre Lebensziele erreichen.

 

"Probleme können niemals mit derselben Denkweise gelöst werden, mit der sie entstanden sind... Das einzig wirklich Wertvolle ist Intuition."                        Albert Einstein

Jedes meiner Architekturprojekte hat neue Methoden hervorgebracht. Heute habe ich
systematische Schritte, mit denen man intuitiv Lösungen finden kann, die die Gesamtsituation
nachhaltig unterstützen. Ich habe sie im Rahmen meiner Architektur herausgearbeitet, und
nenne sie ‚Systematic Intuition‘. Sie kann auf andere Lebensbereiche übertragen werden. Dies
unterrichte ich seit vielen Jahren in verschiedenen Ländern.** 

Aus den Erfahrungen meiner Bauherren weiß ich, das die so entstandene Architektur Stress releasing und Kreativitäts steigernde Effekte hat.
 
Die neue Herausforderung mit den Kindern in diesem Projekt ist, die Frage ob Architektur Trauma heilende Wirkung haben kann? 
 
Home4Kids auf den Philippinen ist ein Pilotprojekt für andere Kinderdörfer mit diesem Ansatz
in anderen Teilen der Welt.

 Mein nächstes Buch „Intuitive-Holistic-Architektur“ ist ein Erfahrungsbericht anhand von
Praxisbeispielen: intuitive Methoden, die für jeden Lebensbereich umsetzbar sind, sicher auch
für Dein Lebensfeld.
Das Projekt mit den besonderen Bedürfnissen dieser Kinder soll entscheidende neue Impulse
bringen.
 
Wie können wir Veränderungen bewirken, indem wir tiefere und nachhaltigere Wege finden,
um Kindern auf der ganzen Welt zu helfen?
 
Bitte gebt Euren Beitrag!
 
Mit den kleinen Andenken auf der rechten Seite  (perks) wollen wir uns bei dir bedanken.


Jeder Euro zählt. ! ! !
 
Weitere Möglichkeiten, wie Du helfen kannst
 
• Du bist herzlich eingeladen, beim Bau auf den Philippinen mitzumachen oder bei der
Kinderbetreuung zu helfen. Workshops begleiten die Arbeit. Die intuitive Praxis der
"Systematischen Intuition" fließt in jeden Arbeits- und Gestaltungsschritt ein.
 
• Bitte weitersagen! Teile diese Seite auf deiner Facebook- und Twitter-Seite und teile sie
deinen Freunden mit – please go crazy!
 
• Organisiere einen Vortrag oder Workshop über Home4Kids, Healing Architecture oder
praktische Intuition in deiner Stadt – in der Schule, im Kulturzentrum, im Philosophischen
Café oä.


Gerade sind wir auf Reise, um diese Sache zu verbreiten und Vorträge zu halten.

(In kürze Berlin) 


 
Sobald der Spendentopf 50% erreicht hat können wir wieder STARTEN!  
Bitte spende und hilf uns, dass das Projekt weiter geht!
 
Schon heute unterstützen meine Vorträge das Projekt.
 
5% des Bucherlöses werden in das Kinderdorf fließen.
 
10% von meinen anderen Architekturprojekten werden Home4Kids unterstützen.
 
 
Danke für Deine Unterstützung!
 
 
 
 * Home4Kids, Eingetragener Verein in Österreich: ZVR-Nummer 1235413876
 
** www.reinhard-coppenrath-architecture.com
 
 
Kontaktiere uns einfach unter 00491781709540
Facebook: Reinhard Coppenrath

story:
Our Campaign

 Did you know last month Drake’s song “God’s Plan” got a total 319,000 downloads.  That’s $143,500 that the record label made off of one song in one month!  Let’s say after overhead expenses and incidentals, they grossed just about $100,000…that’s still a lot of money!  Half of that could have been given to Shelter Services to help battered women.  That’s $50,000!  That could be the cost of a new job, a new program or service that could’ve been created.  DCAST Music wants to do this.  We are a music record label committed to donating half of all our profits to a local Shelter Service.  If we can buy music and help a Record Label get rich and gross over $100,000 off of one song in one month, then we can surely buy music that Supports Survivors of gender-based violence.

Did you know that 1 in 3 women will experience gender-based violence in their lifetime?  This abuse can be caused by a current or former spouse or partner in an intimate relationship.  The effects of abuse (mental, emotional, physical) could cause a number of chronic health problems – irritable bowel syndromes, gastrointestinal disorders, hypertension, various chronic syndromes.   Abuse could also cause a number of psychological effects, too – anxiety, fear, mistrust of others, inability to concentrate, PTSD, depression, or even suicide.  The CDC has now confirmed that gender-based violence is a major health concern that causes an estimated $5 billion in medical & mental health services and lost of productivity.  Survivors of abuse are in need of a number of services including safe housing & shelter for their families, food & clothing, counseling, medical examinations, legal and advocacy support.  These services cost and with Federal and State budget cuts our local Domestic (Intimate) Partner Violence Shelters are in need of support so that they can continue to help survivors. Truth is…we all can help.

Why are we doing this?

    Few years ago I use to work at a Sexual Assault/Domestic Violence Service Center where I was the Volunteer Coordinator, a Prevention Educator, and Crisis Counselor.  I counseled a number of women that went through horrific abuse from partners – many of their stories still weigh heavy on me even to this day.  I know these local Support Centers really work but the reality of it is that many of them are understaffed, overworked, and often in jeopardy of losing funds, which means loss of services to people that need them.  If more businesses found more creative ways to support these shelters it would be a HUGE HELP!  When I first created DCAST Music I wanted to do more than just sell and distribute music, I wanted it to be a vehicle to help others – to support services that are already doing great work in their communities.  I wanted to prove that it was possible to create a successful business, do something you love, and help others in the process.  What if more companies adopted this kind of business model?  The possibilities could be endless.  We could actually put our dollars to work for causes that really matter.

Our Goal

    We want  to run a campaign for the next 40 days to raise at least $50,000.  Half of our profits will go straight to a local Domestic (Intimate) Partner Violence Shelter.  The other half we’ll put to use so that we can continue to build our company, create more music projects, and continue to run future campaigns like this so that we can support causes that matter like homelessness, food security for hungry families, and afterschool programming for inner-city youth.  With your contribution to DCAST Music you could help provide a number of services for survivors.

What your funding contributes to:

•    Safe housing/shelter for women and their families at a safe location
•    Food, clothing, and toiletries 
•    Free counseling services
•    Access to social services
•    Legal resource planning
•    Court accompaniments and advocacy
•    Assistance with orders of protection
•    Financial empowerment training
•    Self-provided childcare

Any Risks?

There are always some risks and challenges involved in pulling off a project, mostly anticipated from printing, production and shipping delays.  Music digital downloads are usually the easiest to send – if given email addresses.  You have our full commitment that we will work tirelessly to get you all music and merchandise sent to you within the estimated time-table.  It’s important to us to come through on our agreement, especially when referring to giving half of our profits to a local Shelter.  In researching other campaigns on this site, we anticipate that 30% of the funds will go directly to paying host fees, credit card transaction fees, cost of merchandise, and shipping cost.  The rest of the funds generated from this campaign will be split down the middle with a local Shelter Service and DCAST Music.  We believe it’s important to be honest and transparent with all our backers about the financial breakdown – building trust and community is the only way we want to do business.      


What you get

$5 –     One Track “A Beautiful Mess” (Digital download will be sent via email)

$10 -    Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” (Digital downloads will be sent via email)

$25 -    Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & Music Gives Pen

$50 -    Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & “I’m a Beautiful Mess” V-neck T-Shirt

$75 -     Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & “I’m a Beautiful Mess” Tote Bag

$100 -     Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & “I’m a Beautiful Mess” Hoodie

$200 -     Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More”, Music Gives Pen, “I’m a Beautiful Mess” V-neck, tote bag, & Hoodie

$600 -     10 Pack of V-neck T-shirts “A Beautiful Mess”

$1000 – Presentation about the effects of gender socialization, gender-based violence, violence prevention, positive masculinity by founder of DCAST Music.  Limited to California only.

$2000 – Out of state presentation about the effects of gender socialization, gender-based violence, violence prevention, positive masculinity by founder of DCAST Music.


How else you can help
    
If you can fund this project, please do.
    -If you can’t, please purchase songs on I-Tunes.  Each song is only $0.99 cents but you could at least be contributing $0.22 cents to a Shelter Service.  
        -Please share it all over the internet

       - Or join our Mailing List https://dcastmusic.us18.list-manage.com/subscri...

Either way you’ll be helping survivors of gender-based violence and helping us continue our services.  


What is DCAST Music

    DCAST Music is a record label that signs music artists and producers to one song record contracts.  We work on a word-of-mouth model to promote, advertise, and distribute singles.  We are committed to sharing half of all our profits with local charities and non-profits.  These charitable organizations provide services for the homeless, survivors of domestic (intimate) partner Violence & sexual assault, hungry families, and inner-city youth.  We believe this business model can prove to others that it’s possible to create a successful business, love what you do, and help others in the process.  Check out https://dcastmusic.com/music-gives to find out more about what we do or join our mailing list here https://dcastmusic.us18.list-manage.com/subscri...

security for hungry families, and afterschool programming for inner-city youth.  With your contribution to DCAST Music you could help provide a number of services for survivors.What your funding contributes to:•    Safe housing/shelter for women and their families at a safe location•    Food, clothing, and toiletries •    Free counseling services•    Access to social services•    Legal resource planning•    Court accompaniments and advocacy•    Assistance with orders of protection•    Financial empowerment training•    Self-provided childcareAny Risks?There are always some risks and challenges involved in pulling off a project, mostly anticipated from printing, production and shipping delays.  Music digital downloads are usually the easiest to send – if given email addresses.  You have our full commitment that we will work tirelessly to get you all music and merchandise sent to you within the estimated time-table.  It’s important to us to come through on our agreement, especially when referring to giving half of our profits to a local Shelter.  In researching other campaigns on this site, we anticipate that 30% of the funds will go directly to paying host fees, credit card transaction fees, cost of merchandise, and shipping cost.  The rest of the funds generated from this campaign will be split down the middle with a local Shelter Service and DCAST Music.  We believe it’s important to be honest and transparent with all our backers about the financial breakdown – building trust and community is the only way we want to do business.      What you get$5 –     One Track “A Beautiful Mess” (Digital download will be sent via email)$10 -    Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” (Digital downloads will be sent via email)$25 -    Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & Music Gives Pen$50 -    Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & “I’m a Beautiful Mess” V-neck T-Shirt$75 -     Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & “I’m a Beautiful Mess” Tote Bag$100 -     Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More” & “I’m a Beautiful Mess” Hoodie$200 -     Two Tracks “A Beautiful Mess” & “Back for More”, Music Gives Pen, “I’m a Beautiful Mess” V-neck, tote bag, & Hoodie$600 -     10 Pack of V-neck T-shirts “A Beautiful Mess”$1000 – Presentation about the effects of gender socialization, gender-based violence, violence prevention, positive masculinity by founder of DCAST Music.  Limited to California only.$2000 – Out of state presentation about the effects of gender socialization, gender-based violence, violence prevention, positive masculinity by founder of DCAST Music.How else you can help    If you can fund this project, please do.    -If you can’t, please purchase songs on I-Tunes.  Each song is only $0.99 cents but you could at least be contributing $0.22 cents to a Shelter Service.          -Please share it all over the internet       - Or join our Mailing List https://dcastmusic.us18.list-manage.com/subscri...Either way you’ll be helping survivors of gender-based violence and helping us continue our services.  What is DCAST Music    DCAST Music is a record label that signs music artists and producers to one song record contracts.  We work on a word-of-mouth model to promote, advertise, and distribute singles.  We are committed to sharing half of all our profits with local charities and non-profits.  These charitable organizations provide services for the homeless, survivors of domestic (intimate) partner Violence & sexual assault, hungry families, and inner-city youth.  We believe this business model can prove to others that it’s possible to create a successful business, love what you do, and help others in the process.  Check out https://dcastmusic.com/music-gives to find out more about what we do or join our mailing list here https://dcastmusic.us18.list-manage.com/subscri...

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone,

My name is Iris Koh and I’m from Singapore. I started the Healing The Divide initiative in July this year to present the other side of the vaccine story so people can have medical informed consent before taking the vaccine. 

In our core, we believe openness is required for facts to be confirmed and verified. While sharing and reading news is one of the processes we must do, we also believe that at times seemingly extreme measures have to be taken. Like taking institutions, corporations, the press, medical institutions and governments to task in the court of law under oath to clarify facts and to be made responsible for all the information they have released in the course of their work.

Truth is a herculean task not for the faint of heart. While open discussion is essential, it is not sufficient.

Healing the Divide stands for Unity, Truth and Empathy. We protect our rights to live in a society where diversity is celebrated especially regarding our medical health.

As this is evolving, the amount that we are seeking will help fund and support the work that we do for the next 3 months. When you support this, you will be supporting the initiatives that we have to protect medical freedom in our society.

Thank you for your support and together we can heal the divide and create a society based on justice and equality. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to achieve the following aims;

To take legal actions on local media and news outlets for irresponsible and non-factual reporting - in the process preventing our country, society, and government from making the wrong decision about dealing with the pandemic. 

1) Taking Singapore Press Holdings Ltd to Court of Law under The Protection from Harassment Act for publishing news with unverified facts.

2) Taking Calvin Cheng to Court of Law under The Protection from Harassment Act for publishing news with unverified facts.

3) Help desk for those who wish to take legal action against their employers for discrimination at the work place. 

4) To continue to publish alternative news/research and data about the other side of the vaccine story not featured by the mainstream media and to give the public medical informed consent through information disseminated via our website, Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, WhatsApp, videos and articles.  We wish to 

5)To continue our work to investigate, write and present the other side of the vaccine story in our social media / website and share information with the community. 

6) Reaching out to the victims injured during vaccination to assist them to tell their stories so as to inform the public about dangers of vaccine and also to put pressure on the government on their claims.

7) Secondarily, to allow them to reach a bigger public so that they may receive financial assistance where necessary to alleviate the pain & suffering as a result of vaccination.

Highest aims

1) To heal the divide caused by misinformation and narrative-based reporting instead of fact-based reports. Truth will heal the divide in our country.

2) Research and evidence from many countries have already shown that simple medication like Ivermectin, Vitamin C, D etc can stop covid right now. We wish to end the pandemic with correct information to the public. 

3) To support victims who suffer from after-vaccine injuries and to work with the government to provide support to them. 

 

The Impact

There are about 500,000 Singaporeans & residents who are not vaccinated at this stage, and these people are suffering from discriminatory measures from our government, in the workplace and in different areas of our lives. 

Among the rest who are vaccinated, there are also numerous people who are injured after vaccination.

The success of this project would have the following impact;

  • To completely halt the discriminatory measures on the unvaccinated.
  • To completely halt false reporting by our local newspaper and other news media.
  • To allow alternative medication to be used in the treatment of covid. 
  • To pursue fair medical compensation for the victims injured during and after vaccination - if it can be ascertained in Court on a balance of probabilities that it is due to the experimental vaccine.

Risks & Challenges

During the process of realizing the mission and goals of our project, we would be initiating legal actions on organizations & prominent individuals. The risk of a counter legal lawsuit from these organizations and individuals is present. 

  • The founder and the plaintiffs may be counter-sued.
  • The founder is risking her name, business, and potential income by taking on this initiative.

The government currently is the biggest employer in the country and thus it is difficult to find people who will speak up openly / do the work.

The organization, along with its volunteers engage at least 2 law firms to provide us legal services, and to protect us legally. 

Of cos, this is a huge global problem that doctors, lawyers and citizens around the world are standing up against and over in Singapore we wish to do our own small part to stop vaccine passport mandates in our country. We also know that our success also depends largely on what happens around the world and their efforts.  As we do our part, we seek to gain a little more time for the rest of the world to gather data, evidences to share with the rest of the world. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 

We are also on the lookout for those who can join our volunteer team. Go to www.healingthedivide.cc/getinvolved and connect with us. 

You may share this campaign on your social media accounts. You may Whatsapp / Telegram to your friends for them to contribute.

For those who would prefer to pay to us via cash options, you may also do so via our office. 

Make an appointment with us before you reach. You can either meet with;

1) Ms Iris Koh, https://calendly.com/iriskoh. 

2) Mr Raymond Ng, https://calendly.com/candle. 

Or

3) Mr Tan Pei Kai, https://tidycal.com/occamlogic/30-minute-meetin....  

Our office is in Macpherson Road.

story:
About the School Bus Project

The School Bus Project was founded in Brighton in September 2015 in response to the growing refugee crisis as it is manifested in Europe. Between January and December 2015, over a million people (mostly refugees) arrived in Europe, making their way to cities and towns such as Calais in France, in the hopes of finding safety and stability for themselves and their families. Given Brighton’s proximity to Calais, a small group of passionate Brighton-based educators began working together to see how they could help to address the educational needs of the Calais-based refugees, and, with that, the School Bus Project was born.

With the support of donors like you, we have:

  • developed online and in-person training resources and activities to support individuals working on refugee education and trained about 60 volunteer educators
  • raised funds to buy a double decker yellow bus and converted it into a mobile school, which was deployed as part of a pilot project in the Jungle Camp in Calais from September 2016 until the camp's closure
  • provided key life-saving and life-sustaining lessons and resources in collaboration with a range of partners
  • raised awareness about the refugee crisis among schools, communities, government, and international organisations

What do we need the money for?

Since the founding of the School Bus Project, we have come to realise that we can maximise our impact by focusing on the development and delivery of guidance and training for a range of educators, the identification and deployment of no-, low-, and high-tech educational resources in various refugee contexts, and collaboration with individuals, groups, and partner organisations to better support education delivery.

If you make a donation to the School Bus Project, you will be helping us to:

  • cover the costs of training and providing guidance and support to educators working with refugees across Europe
  • identify and/or develop a range of no-, low-, and high-tech educational resources for deployment where they are needed most
  • support individuals, groups, and partner organisations wishing to set up their own mobile learning spaces or further develop their own educational interventions
  • support the integration of refugees and vulnerable migrants in mainstream schools and communities and promote social cohesion
  • raise awareness about the refugee crisis in the UK and internationally

What difference will it make?

We have recently relaunched our eCourse: Introduction to Refugee Education, and are hosting in-person training sessions at one of our three UK-hubs for individuals, groups, and organisations on a regular basis, starting in March 2017. We are also proud to be supporting the efforts of Edlumino, a collaboration of qualified teachers and education experts from the UK and mainland Europe who are providing quality education for refugees in Greece, and the Dunkirk Children’s Centre, which provides play-based learning and a space for creative expression for the children in the refugee camp in Dunkirk, France.

All of this work would not be possible without donors like you!

We have some exciting projects in the pipeline, including the redeployment of our Big Yellow School Bus and our Little Red Bus, the building of support mechanisms for educators working in challenging contexts, and the development of training materials to support inclusion in schools. We need your support to make these visions a reality!

What else can you do?

We realise that not everyone is able to donate money, but we also appreciate your time, interest, and engagement. With that in mind, you can:

  • visit our website
  • like us on Facebook and share our Facebook page with your friends
  • follow us on Twitter
  • sign up for our eCourse: Introduction to Refugee Education

If you would like to organise a fundraising event, set up an educational intervention, or think we might be able to collaborate in some way, please get in touch.

Education is a basic human right, as set out in Article 26 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and you can help us make that right a reality. We have registered as a charity to ensure that we are held accountable for our work, and that you can be confident that we are working hard to do what we have promised.

An appeal video made by the Key Stage 3 pupils at Charter International School, Bangkok, Thailand, to raise awareness of the current refugee crisis and the work of the School Bus Project to provide education and hope to thousands of displaced people.

story:
Short Summary

The Equipo Forense Internacional-International Field Initiatives and Forensic Training (EFI-IFIFT) is a Guatemalan/Canadian forensic anthropology team consisting of six individuals who conduct work in Guatemala. The EFI-IFIFT team formed in May 2015. Together, we have a combined sixty years of experience in forensic archaeology, forensic anthropology as well as socio-cultural anthropology. Our mission is to support both the justice system in Guatemala through expert forensic reporting, as well as the human rights of victims of the armed conflict in Guatemala. This is accomplished by retrieving the remains of loved ones who fell victim to La Violencia, or armed conflict. This is a time period between 1960 and 1996, when 250,000 people were massacred, 45,000 individuals were disappeared, and 1.5 million individuals were displaced from their homes and communities.  Since May 2015, the EFI-IFIFT team have recovered six remains in two separate communities of Nebaj, and San Juan Cotzal in the province of Quiche. But there are many, many more remains left to retrieve in these communities.
The campaign is raising funds to support the exhumation process within Nebaj and San Juan Cotzal. This includes gathering information about those who are buried (the historical memory), the exhumation (recovery) of the remains, the analysis of the bones, and the proper inhumation, or burial for the family members. The transcriptions of the historical memory, the analysis and remains, as well as any images that are collected during the process will be given to the families,  and the Public Ministry as a public record of what occurred to the families and communities of Nebaj and San Juan Cotzal during La Violencia.
Your contribution will help bring closure to families and assist in the grieving process. It is important to note, the burials to be exhumed are considered "closed cases", this means that the cases have more information on both the victim(s) and the place(s) where they were buried.  Families know where their loved ones were buried during the armed conflict. The information gathered will assist in bringing justice to communities that have been waiting for more than thirty years, and tell the story of what many communities have lost, 
 

What We Need & What You Get

To date, the EFI-IFIFT team has supported the project through personal funding of $25,000.00, but there is still much to accomplish. The breakdown of $50,000.00 we are crowdfunding for encompasses the 90 day period for the exhumation process, from the initial interviews, to the Inhumation of remains :

Fieldwork (includes meals, accommodation, wages for the six member team for the duration of the exhumation process)

12,000.00

  Historical Memory – gathering information: Interviewing, recording  equipment, cameras 

6,000.00

  Exhumation - necessary equipment: shovels, trowels, containers,        bags, boxes, tape, brushes, scissors, root cutters, tarps, rope,    replacement cost of damaged crops from the exhumation, 

9,000.00

  Lab Analysis of remains-  rent of building for lab work, X-Rays,    tables, calipers, glue,  computers, printer,  chairs, desks

7,000.00

  Transcribing  and translating recordings,  binding of historical    memory, 

5,000.00

  Inhumation

5,000.00

  Rent of vehicles, fuel, maintenance of vehicles, 

6,000.00

Total

 50,000.00

There are several beautiful contribution awards. Each textile included in the perks was hand made on a backstrap loom in San Juan de Cotzal, by female victims of the armed conflict who lost family members. These women developed a cooperative, Cooperativa Tejidos Cotzal, to achieve economic sustainability for their community, and they will also benefit from your contributions.  

One perk includes an opportunity to travel to Guatemala, work alongside the EFI-IFIFT Team, and see the work being conducted in the communities,  This contribution includes the cost of travel to and from Guatemala, as well as your meals and accommodation for one week while you are with the team.  **You must have a valid passport in order to travel to Guatemala. 

If the entire goal is not met, the funds that are raised will be focused on the analysis stage of the exhumation process, that is, where the means and mode of death are determined. This will provide the families with the necessary information in their search for justce. 


The Impact

The communities of Nebaj and San Juan Cotzal are both in the Highlands in the province of Quiche, Guatemala.  Each community has several smaller clandestine gravesites, that include four or less remains. These gravesites have largely "fallen through the cracks", but with your contrubutions, will have the opportunity to be exhumed and the remains returned to family members. 

The EFI-IFIFT team, together with experienced forensic anthropology and forensic archaeology interns, in collaboration with the communities, record and transcribe the communities' historical memory, conduct the exhumations, analysis of remains, and assist in the inhumation (proper burial) of the remains. The goal is to complete this process in a matter of ninety days. This process currently takes several years to complete. Because the EFI-IFIFT team is focused on smaller exhumations, the time frame of ninety days to return the remains to the family is feasable. 

Our goal is to have the families at the burial site for the duration of the exhumation. In having the families close, additional stories of the past are relived, memories are shared and recorded. Without us working together, the families may not ever have the ability to properly bury  and grieve their loved ones, or have justice realized for the severe human rights abuses that occured in the communities of Nebaj and San Juan Cotzal. 

  

Risks & Challenges

Some challenges we face include weather: inclement weather, extreme heat, and rain that may slow the exhumation process; the distance that needs to be travelled by foot, and larger spaces that need to be examined prior to the start of the exhumation. We overcome these challenges by collaborating with local communities, for cover when it rains, for meals when we have walked into the burial site, assistance in identifying or narrowing the area that needs to be exhumed. 

Many of the families who travel to the exhumation site have to take time away from their jobs in the fincas (working in a landownders' crop, like coffee), making $5.00 - $7.00 USD a day, so they can be present for when their family member is retrieved from the site. We aim to conduct the exhumation, quickly, and with no cost to the families or communities, as it is imperitive that the community is present, and there is transparency in the exhumation. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, there are other ways you can support this project. Assist us in getting the word out about this project and share the information with friends, peers, colleagues. Invite us to present on the work being conducting in Guatemala. Remember to make use of the Indiegogo share tools as well! 

Thank you for your support of this project!

7,000.00




  Transcribing  and translating recordings,  binding of historical    memory, 


5,000.00




  Inhumation


5,000.00




  Rent of vehicles, fuel, maintenance of vehicles, 


6,000.00




Total


 50,000.00




There are several beautiful contribution awards. Each textile included in the perks was hand made on a backstrap loom in San Juan de Cotzal, by female victims of the armed conflict who lost family members. These women developed a cooperative, Cooperativa Tejidos Cotzal, to achieve economic sustainability for their community, and they will also benefit from your contributions.  
One perk includes an opportunity to travel to Guatemala, work alongside the EFI-IFIFT Team, and see the work being conducted in the communities,  This contribution includes the cost of travel to and from Guatemala, as well as your meals and accommodation for one week while you are with the team.  **You must have a valid passport in order to travel to Guatemala. 
If the entire goal is not met, the funds that are raised will be focused on the analysis stage of the exhumation process, that is, where the means and mode of death are determined. This will provide the families with the necessary information in their search for justce. 
   The Impact The communities of Nebaj and San Juan Cotzal are both in the Highlands in the province of Quiche, Guatemala.  Each community has several smaller clandestine gravesites, that include four or less remains. These gravesites have largely "fallen through the cracks", but with your contrubutions, will have the opportunity to be exhumed and the remains returned to family members. 
The EFI-IFIFT team, together with experienced forensic anthropology and forensic archaeology interns, in collaboration with the communities, record and transcribe the communities' historical memory, conduct the exhumations, analysis of remains, and assist in the inhumation (proper burial) of the remains. The goal is to complete this process in a matter of ninety days. This process currently takes several years to complete. Because the EFI-IFIFT team is focused on smaller exhumations, the time frame of ninety days to return the remains to the family is feasable. 
Our goal is to have the families at the burial site for the duration of the exhumation. In having the families close, additional stories of the past are relived, memories are shared and recorded. Without us working together, the families may not ever have the ability to properly bury  and grieve their loved ones, or have justice realized for the severe human rights abuses that occured in the communities of Nebaj and San Juan Cotzal. 
  
    Risks & Challenges Some challenges we face include weather: inclement weather, extreme heat, and rain that may slow the exhumation process; the distance that needs to be travelled by foot, and larger spaces that need to be examined prior to the start of the exhumation. We overcome these challenges by collaborating with local communities, for cover when it rains, for meals when we have walked into the burial site, assistance in identifying or narrowing the area that needs to be exhumed. 
Many of the families who travel to the exhumation site have to take time away from their jobs in the fincas (working in a landownders' crop, like coffee), making $5.00 - $7.00 USD a day, so they can be present for when their family member is retrieved from the site. We aim to conduct the exhumation, quickly, and with no cost to the families or communities, as it is imperitive that the community is present, and there is transparency in the exhumation. 

    Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute financially, there are other ways you can support this project. Assist us in getting the word out about this project and share the information with friends, peers, colleagues. Invite us to present on the work being conducting in Guatemala. Remember to make use of the Indiegogo share tools as well! 
Thank you for your support of this project!

story:
(A magyar nyelvű leíráshoz kérjük, görgess lejjebb.) 


Hungary's future is at stake.

We need your help and your financial support to fund our referendum initiative against the autocratic regime of Prime Minister Viktor Orban so that Hungary can finally escape its outcast status. 


The world has already figured out what Orban’s nasty little game is. They know that he is a corrupt liar, that his relatives and acquaintances are getting rich on stolen money, that he ignores the norms of European civilization and governs Hungary like a dictator. We are ashamed of him. But until now, neither Hungary nor Europe have had enough willpower or determination to stop the madness from escalating. 

We, the founder-members of the New Hungarian Republic ("Új Magyar Köztársaság" in Hungarian) Association, an organisation built on the foundations of recent civil demonstrations, have decided to take our country back, step by step. Our referendum initiative is designed to give everybody who wants change an opportunity to unite. 

For the first time under (Orban's party) Fidesz’s rule and despite laws made more severe by Orban's parliament and its non-impartial bodies, we have come up with five questions which can be decided upon by the Hungarian people. 

These questions get to the heart of what Orban’s corrupt system is all about. So for example, we are asking whether we should allow politicians to conceal their stolen wealth by putting it in their family members’ names; whether we should allow one of Orbán’s cronies to tax our businesses; whether we should put up with a law that prevents our children from being properly educated; whether we should suffer any more when we get ill; and whether politicians should enjoy greater rights than the people they govern. 

Our proposed petition anticipates a successful referendum. And a successful referendum is our best chance of creating an opposition capable of governing. 

First we must collect at least 200,000 signatures of support for our cause. If we succeed, Parliament is obliged to order a referendum. 

Our petition - set to launch in mid-July – and the subsequent campaign of opposition both need to be properly funded. 

We will do what needs to be done to rescue Hungary from its fate. We are counting on you, too! Please support our “Autocracy-demolishing referendum” for the New Hungarian Republic with your donation and share our appeal with your friends as well! 

----------------------------------

Magyarország jövőjéről van szó. 


Támogatásodat és pénzbeli adományodat kérjük Orbán Viktor autokratikus rendszere elleni népszavazási kezdeményezésünkhöz, hogy hazánk végre kiszabaduljon a párialétből. 
 

Orbánt és rendszerét már kiismerte a világ. Tudják, hogy hazug és korrupt, hogy rokonai és ismerősei lopott pénzből gazdagodnak, hogy fittyet hány az európai civilizációs normákra és fél-ázsiai diktátorok ízlése szerint kormányozza Magyarországot – szégyenkezünk is miatta eleget. Ám eddig sem itthon, sem Európában nem volt elegendő elszántság és akarat, mely képes lett volna megállítani a fokozódó tébolyt. 


Mi, a közelmúlt civil tüntetéseinek bázisán szerveződött Új Magyar Köztársaság Egyesület tagjai elhatároztuk, hogy lépésről lépésre segítünk visszafoglalni Magyarországot. Népszavazási kezdeményezésünkkel lehetőséget adunk arra, hogy a változásra vágyó, de szertefutó akaratok összefonódhassanak. 

Az Orbán parlamentje által megnehezített törvényi feltételek és a részrehajló testületek ellenére sikerült elérnünk, hogy a benyújtott két tucat kezdeményezés közül – először a Fidesz-uralom évei során – öt kérdésben a nép dönthessen! 

Ezek a kérdések a rendszer lényegéről szólnak. Így például arról, hogy engedjük-e a politikusoknak családtagjaik nevén elrejteni a lopott vagyont, hogy tűrjük-e Orbán egyik vazallusának vállalkozásaink megsarcolását, vagy hogy beletörődünk-e abba, hogy törvény korlátozza gyermekeinket a tudás megszerzésében. Hogy elviseljük-e a kiszolgáltatottságot, ha megbetegszünk. És hogy több jog illetheti-e meg másoknál a politikusokat. 

A sikeres aláírásgyűjtés megelőlegezi a sikeres népszavazást, a sikeres népszavazás pedig megfelelő alkalom a kormányzóképes magyar ellenzék felépítésére is. 

Elsőként legalább 200 ezer támogató aláírást kell összegyűjtenünk. Ha sikerrel járunk, az országgyűlésnek kötelezően ki kell írnia a népszavazást. 

A július közepén kezdődő aláírásgyűjtés elindításához és az eredményes kampány lefolytatásához pénzre, sok pénzre van szükség. 

Mi megtesszük, amit hitünk szerint meg kell tenni Magyarország sorsának jobbra fordításáért. Számítunk rád is! 

Kérjük, támogasd adományoddal rendszerbontó népszavazásunkat az új magyar köztársaságért, és oszd meg felhívásunkat a barátaiddal is!

story:
The Future Is Voting Tour featuring Jim James

We all know what’s at stake on Election Day. All 435 House seats and 35 Senate seats are up for grabs. And the last two special elections came down to fewer than 2,000 votes -- about the number of students who can pack a large auditorium on campus.

So, Jim James and all the other performers will travel the country, donating 100% of their time and art to the cause of turning out voters. None of the artists participating on this tour are being paid.

  • Jim will appear at all six shows; other performers will join for select dates
  • Candidates of all political affiliations will be invited to participate in Q&A sessions
  • Funds will directly cover the costs of bringing these events to college campuses at no cost to the students or schools

And you can help make it all happen by making a contribution. Moving the artists and staff to six college markets and campuses all over the United States is not easy... and it will be expensive, even if no one gets paid. And none of the schools will be charged anything. So, please pitch in what you can.

Any funds raised that exceed the tour expenses will be donated 100% to HeadCount to help them continue to support local and campus organizations doing important get-out-the-vote work. We realize that you are being asked to contribute to multiple campaigns and causes in election years. We feel strongly that this is a unique opportunity to come together as a national community and motivate younger voters to get out and make their opinions count!

Tour Schedule

The tour kicks off with a late-night celebration open to the public at Emo's in Austin, Texas, on Sunday, October 7, before heading off to college towns across the country. Here's the full schedule...

Sun, Oct 07  ||  Emo's (Austin, Texas)

Tue, Oct 09  ||  Texas State University (San Marcos, Texas)

Wed, Oct 10  ||  University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee (Milwaukee, Wisconsin)

Mon, Oct 15  ||  Georgia Theatre (Athens, Georgia)

Tue, Oct 16   ||  Simpson College (Indianola, Iowa)

Wed, Oct 17  ||  Canopy Club (Urbana, Illinois)

Tickets for the October 7 show in Austin are available for purchase here. The rest of the shows are primarily for students on each campus, but a limited number of tickets will be available to the public for the Athens, GA (tickets here), event. And there are lots of ways you can be part of this tour and help get out the vote.

Support The Tour

This is an amazing opportunity for you to support participation in the Midterm Elections and motivate college students in critical areas of the country to vote. You’ll help educate them on issues in their states and where the candidates stand, so they are armed with the facts at the ballot box.

  • Our goal of $50,000 is the amount it will take to cover the costs of bringing the tour to six college towns.
  • We've got a variety of giving levels, and every dollar donated truly does help.
  • Perks for donations include a tour t-shirt, tour poster, and more!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you may not be able to make a donation, you can still help make this tour a reality!

  • Help us get the word out by sharing the campaign with friends, family, and classmates.
  • Post to social media using #TheFutureIsVoting and share what's driving you to be a part of the 2018 midterm elections.
  • Visit HeadCount.org to learn more about getting involved in voter engagement.

Thanks for your support!
